loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessa is 39 years old and has three children are still in school.

Jessa has a cake making business in the Philippines. Jessa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Jessa has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school, Rossana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Rossana has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Rossana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Merly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merly has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 40 years old and widowed with three children, all of whom are currently in school. Richel works very hard to provide for them.

Richel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and candies. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Richel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like eggs, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabrics of different textures, threads, spools and other necessary accessories for production.

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is a 36-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy more clothes and bedsheets for the business. He still sells used clothes and bedsheets as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like taxis and rentals where he earns extra income. Nicholus faces a challenge of price fluctuation of goods, but has hopes of fulfilling his family dream and having a wholesale boutique for clothes.

He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes like shirts, trousers, bed covers and bedsheets for the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes like shirts, trousers, bed covers and bedsheets for the business.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a forty seven year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He practices cattle fattening and selling alongside farming where he gets his extra income. With this, he has been able to sustain his family. He hopes to expand his cattle farm and also buy a motorcycle however his main challenge is foot and mouth diseases that attack his cattle and high transportation costs.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Mitali

texts.en:
Mitali is a 36-year-old widow and a mother of an only daughter. Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years back. She is from a rural village in Alipurduar district of West Bengal, India. Her only daughter has gotten married. Mitali had studied till grade 9. Now she is involved with a clothing business to earn her livelihood.

She runs her business from her home. She sells mainly saris in her locality. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India. For additional income, she sells many kinds of readymade garments according to the customer’s demand. 

Now she wants to expand her business to generate more income, so she is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more attractive varieties of saris and other clothing from the wholesale market to better satisfy her customers. Her neighbors, relatives and friends are her main customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with the profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of saris and other clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Jyotsna lives in a small village of Alipurduar with her family, comprising her husband, Bablu, and one son. Her son reads in grade 7 in a local village school. Her husband is engaged with a car renting business. 

Jyotsna is involved with animal husbandry; she sells milk and cattle byproducts like cow dung in her local area. Her neighbors are the main customers. Now she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another dairy cow and fodder so that she can sell more milk to increase her family's income. 

Jyotsna is very much confident about her business and hopes that this loan will give a lift to her business.

She is very obliged to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her dairy business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a home products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more plastic wares and other home products to offer for sale.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more plastic wares and other home products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en:
Enedina is 41 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Enedina has a general store business in the Philippines. Enedina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Enedina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Enedina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 49 year old woman with two children and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Carmelita has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She requested a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional computer unit.

Carmelita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer unit

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 57 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a poultry business in the Philippines. Ma. Delia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her business.

Ma. Delia has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from charcoal vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 50 years old and married with six children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, coffee, and noodles.

Lyn has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Lyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, coffee, noodles, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, beverages, home care products, and other groceries for her general store business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is still in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been in this business for 17 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Catalina Karen

texts.en:
Catalina Karen is 35 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Catalina Karen works very hard to provide for them.

Catalina Karen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, detergent, soap, chocolate drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.

Catalina Karen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent, soap, chocolate drinks, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Catalina Karen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, detergent, soap, chocolate drinks, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Adela Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Adela tiene 60 años de edad es casado vive con su esposo en Chimbo, provincia de Bolivar, ella tiene una tienda de abastos en general , solicita el crédito a la cooperativa para capital de trabajo para comprar mas mercaderia y tener variedad su sueño es incrementar el negocio, realiza las compras en Guaranda cada semana, en su tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar con su esposo.
texts.en: Adela is 60 years old, is married and lives with her husband in Chimbo, Bolivar province. She has a general store. She is applying for a loan from the cooperative for working capital to buy more merchandise and have variety. Her dream is to increase the business and make her purchases in Guaranda every week. In her free time, she likes to go out walking with her husband.

loans.use: for working capital.

loans.name: Mworra  I Nyekundire Group

texts.en:
Asaph is a 30-year-old hardworking married man with two children, aged 4 and 2 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income. However, he also earns extra income from his monthly teacher's salary.

He started these businesses mainly to boost his family income. His main challenges are high transportation costs and price fluctuation. His vision is to expand his business and increase his outputs.

Asaph is a member of Mworra I Nyekundire Group, where members guarantee one another for a loan instead of pledging security.

He is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his retail shop like soap, sugar, salt and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his retail shop like soap, sugar, salt and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marlenis Veronica

texts.es:
Marlenis, de 19 años de edad, estudio un curso de cosmetólogia, está acompañada y su pareja tiene un vehículo en el cual realiza viajes a vecinos que se lo solicitan, junto a ellos viven sus suegros, los cuales se dedican a la herrería.

Marlenis, se dedica a la cosmetólogia desde hace tres años, inicio laborando en una sala de belleza como empleada, pero actualmente cuenta con sus propias maquinas y herramientas requeridas para brindar un buen servicio en su casa de habitación, todos los servicio que realiza son planchados, pistoleados, tintes, cortes de pelo, etc en su mayoría a mujeres.

El presente crédito servirá como capital de trabajo, específicamente será para comprar productos como tintes, cremas humectantes para la piel, shampoo, peróxidos, ampolletas, tratamientos y otros productos, ella no cuenta con una sala de belleza bien equipada y amueblada, más bien tiene un espacio reducido, pero suficiente para brindar un buen servicio a ss clientes.

Verónica, sueña con tener una familia e hijos, ya que actualmente no tiene ninguno, también desea establecer una sala de belleza con más espacio, muy equipada y contar con todos los muebles que se necesitan para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marlenis, 19 years old, studied a cosmetology course. She is accompanied and her partner has a vehicle, in which she carries out journies to neighbors who ask for it. With them live their stepchildren, who dedicate themselves to blacksmithing. 

Marlenis has worked in cosmetology for the past three years. She started working in a beauty salon as an employee, but currently she has her own machines and required tools to provide a good services in her house. All of the services she performs are: straightening, curling, dying, haircuts, etc. in majority for women.

The present loan will serve her for working capital, specifically it will be for buying products like dyes, humectant creams for the skin, shampoo, peroxides, vials, treatments and other products. She doesn't have a well equipped or furnished beauty salon, rather, she has reduced space, but sufficient for providing good service to her clients.

Marlenis dreams of having a family and children, since currently she doesn't have any. Also, she wishes to establish a beauty salon with more space, well equipped and having all of the furniture that is needed to provide a good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy products like dyes, humectant creams for the skin, shampoo, peroxides, vials, treatments and other products.

loans.name: Sandro Jefferson

texts.es:
Sandro, es un joven proveniente de la ciudad de Pucalá, perteneciente al Distrito de Chiclayo, más conocido como La Capital de la Amistad.

Él se encuentra estudiando Agroindustrias, carrera que es muy demandada en esa ciudad, porque es su principal actividad económica. Le interesa mucho estudiar los productos de cultivo, para aportar sus conocimientos y afianzarlos.Cuando culmine su carrera, él se va a beneficiar profesionalmente porque le permitirá sacar adelante a su familia, sintiéndose orgullosos de sus logros. Adicionalmente a su carrera, a Sandro le gustaría estudiar Inglés, asistir a cursos y capacitaciones de diferentes universidades y de SENATI, referente a mi carrera. Aún le falta 2 años por estudiar, recién tiene un año y cinco meses.

Le va muy bien en sus estudios, reconoce que aprendió muchas cosas sobre mi carrera que me profundizó a estudiar cada día más. El principal obstáculo por el que está atravesando es la falta de economía para seguir con sus estudios, poniendo en riesgo su continuidad profesional. 

Sandro recurre al apoyo de KIVA para poder cubrir los gastos de pensión de SENATI con el préstamo que le puedan brindar. Le ayudará muchísimo, porque solventaría las pensiones de su carrera, le permitirá sentirse realizado profesionalmente, muy feliz y agradecido porque hay entidades como KIVA que apoyan al desarrollo personal y profesional de las personas. Gracias a este apoyo, él puede continuar estudiando con miras a convertirse en un excelente profesional de su carrera.

Su mayor sueño es finalizar la carrera en SENATI y convalidar sus cursos en la universidad, graduándose como Ingeniero Agroindustrial.

Sandro quiere expresarles lo siguiente: "Deseo que sean muy bendecidos y que sigan apoyando a gente que quiere estudiar para poder lograr sus metas y aspiraciones profesionales. Muchas gracias KIVA!".
texts.en:
Sandro is a young man from the city of Pucalá, belonging to Chiclayo district, better known as the Capital of Friendship.

He is found studying Agroindustry, a career that is in high demand in this city, because it is its principal economic activity. It interests him a lot to study crop products, to support and establish his knowledge. When he finishes is degree, he is going to benefit profesionally because it will let him get his family ahead, feeling proud of his achievements. Additional to his degree, Sandro would like to study English, attend courses and trainings of different universities and of SENATI, relating to his career. He still lacks 2 years for studying; recently he has done one year and five months.

It's going very well for him in his studies. He recognizes that he learned many things about his career that were deepened by studying more every day. The main obstacle for him is that he is going through is the lack of money to continue with his studies, putting him at risk of his professional continuity.

Sandro resorts to the support of Kiva to be able to cover the boarding costs of SENATI with the loan that you can provide him. It will help him a lot, because he would cover the boarding costs of his degree. It would let him feel accomplished professionally, very happy and thankful that there are entities like Kiva that support the personal and professional development of people. Thanks to this support, he can continue studying with a view of converting himself into an excellent professional in his career.

His greatest dream is to finish his degree in SENATI and validate his courses in the university, graduating as an Agroindustrial Engineer.

Sandro wants to express to you the following: "I wish that you are very blessed and that you continue supporting people who want to study to be able to achieve their professional goals and aspirations. Many thanks Kiva!"

loans.use: to pay for his Agroindustry studies and convert himself into an excellent technical professional, a specialist in his career.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's welding shop, to try to bring her family out of poverty

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cart and more petrol to be sold around the village

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 37-year-old, married man who has two children for whom he provides.

To earn a living and with the help of his wife, he engaged in a motor transport business as a source of income. He aims to have a greater income so he decided to borrow a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance, to enable him to continue catering to more passengers that will generate more income.

In the future, Alexander plans to save money from his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Elsa has been in this business for 21 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and married with one child. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Gina has been in this business for five years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 44-year-old hardworking married man with four children, aged 20, 18, 16, and 10 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a business in agricultural produce, and that is where he earns a living. He was inspired by the need to cater for his family.

He hopes to buy more plots of land and develop the one he already has, though he faces challenges of price fluctuations and delay in payments from his customers.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more bags of coffee and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ester is 57 years old now.

Ester has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Ester has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 36 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries. Lolita has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es: Segundo tiene 21 años de edad es soltero y tiene un hijo de 5 meses, vive solo en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos y abonos agricolas para la siembra gracias a este crédito podra mejorar sus cultivos y obtener mas ingresos realiza las compras en Guaranda cada semana su sueño es comprarse un terreno ya que el que siembra es alquilado, en su tiempo libre le gusta visitar a su hijito.
texts.en:
Segundo is 21 years old. He is single, and has a son who is 5 months old. He lives alone in Chimbo in the Bolivar province.

Segundo makes a living farming corn. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure for his farming. Thanks to this loan, Segundo will be able to improve his harvest and earn more income. He sells his products every week in Guaranda. His dream is to buy land, since that which he farms now is rented. In his free time, he likes to visit his young son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair the lathe machine and purchase some cutting tools for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Mamani lives in a small town named Debinagar in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a mother of two children (a daughter and a son). They read in grade 10 and 2, respectively. Mamani studied till grade 5. 

She runs her own small sewing business from her home. She is a good seamstress and has good experience in this field. She purchases fabrics, cut pieces of cloth, threads and other sewing materials from the wholesale market and makes many kinds of readymade garments, like ladies nightwear, salwars, blouses, petticoats, frocks, etc. After she makes these products, her husband supplies them to the local garment shops. Together, the couple runs this business properly to earn their living, since this is their sole source of income. 

Now they want to invest in this business to earn more income. Thus, Mamani applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. With this loan money, she will buy more sewing materials like fabrics, cut pieces of cloth, threads and other necessary things to increase their stock of products, which will enable them to earn more money. Her dream is to provide a good quality education to her children.

She and her husband are very thankful to their lenders for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials like fabrics, threads and others necessary things for her existing business.

loans.name: Gantur

texts.en:
Gantur is 65 years old and lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as cab driver since 2010 and also runs a cafe at a school where his wife is a janitor. His oldest son studies at university and his younger son goes to high school. 

The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs urgent repair. Gantur is requesting a loan of 2,700 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam for to renovate his house. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into air. Gantur is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is a young 25-year-old woman from the community of Moalboal in Cebu. She has owned a sari-sari store (general store) for seven years now. In her store she sells products like shampoo, soy sauce, canned goods, detergent, chips, and seasoning. She is asking for a loan to buy more of these items as well as other goods such as coffee, vinegar, and sugar. Cristy plans to expand her business with improved inventory for more stability.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, coffee, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and detergent to sell in her store

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
She runs a sari-sari(variety) store.  She lives in Talibon, Bohol. Her name is Jovita, 29 years of age, married with four young dependents. Her oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 4. She sells various commodities ranging from canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, toiletries other merchandise. In addition to that, she raises and sells hogs, as supplemental income.

Jovita has requested a loan  to buy soft drinks and purchase pig feed and pig supplements.  These will help improved the stocks of her store and attract buyers to come. With these, she will be able to augment her earnings and able to pay her obligations. 

She is thankful for availing the funds and is determined to manage her business successfully to support the schooling of all her children for better future.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks and purchase pig feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Padilah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Padilah, one of Ruma’s agents. Padilah lives in Cilegon, Banten, a semi-urban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.

She is happily married. Together with her spouse, she has three children: two sons and one daughter.

Padilah owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to community members. She has already been with Ruma for almost a year. She knew of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology. Padilah is a kind and hardworking person and her community sees her as a trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Padilah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to community members. This loan will have great importance: the loan will be very useful in helping Padilah improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

Padilah's goal wih Ruma in the near future is to offer an e-commerce business for low-income communities with Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so that, later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices.

Padilah is pictured in the photo, in front of her stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping semi-urban community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a determined man of 34, he is married and has a 3-year-old child. Isaac has been running his money transfer business in one of the townships called Zingalume in Lusaka, Zambia since November, 2014. He is requesting for a loan in order to purchase the two trading kiosk which he is currently using and to provide the funds needed to serve customers. The loan will also be used to employ one person to help serve customers faster. 

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, do not have bank accounts. Distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Zoona is a company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction services by propagating an open network using small businesses called Agents. 

Isaac is one of the Agents, he earns a profit for every transaction that he makes at the kiosks. This is his story: When Isaac first started his business his main focus was to get people in his community to know about the service that he provides. He started off by doing direct sales to customers in his community by distributing flyers and explaining his business to them in person. His strategy paid off because barely a month later his transactions had increased from a mere 10 transactions a day to 30 transactions a day. He then set up his second outlet and because of the quick growth of his business he faces the challenge of working float (electronic and cash value of his working capital) which means he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers from time to time. He frequently has to close his shops and make trips to the bank to convert his electronic money to cash and vice versa.
 
Isaac is certain that purchasing his trading kiosks so that he can own them and the capital injection in his business will help him grow his business and earn more profits. The profits will help him to provide basic needs for his family, as the business is his only source of income.

loans.use: To buy two trading kiosks and provide financial services needed by the10 million people in Zambia without bank accounts and to make jobs

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juanita has a general store business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 51 years old and married with five children. Leonarda works very hard to provide for them.

Leonarda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Leonarda has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  additional items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is a 50-year-old lady who lives in a small village of Alipurduar in West Bengal. She has two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter is married, and her son works in a tea garden on a daily wages basis. Her husband is engaged with a paddy business.

But in this era of price hikes, one individual’s income is not sufficient to fulfill all the needs of a family. So, Bina is also involved with a clothing business to give financial support to her household. She buys a variety of clothing, such as sarees (an Indian traditional attire for women), salwar pieces, petticoats, etc. according to the seasonal demand from the wholesale market, and sells them in her neighborhood. Now she needs to buy more stock of clothing to expand their business.

For that reason, Bina applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy stock of clothing, especially sarees, to meet her customers’ demand. She hopes this loan will give a boost to her business. The profits generated from her business will upgrade the financial status of her family. Bina is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to expand her existing business.

loans.name: Creciendo Con Fe Group

texts.es:
¨Creciendo con Fe¨, es un grupo solidario, laborioso y proveniente de un área rural. Estas 3 mujeres emprendedoras han demostrado ser personas capaces y cumplidas con sus metas y deberes. Por 3era. vez solicitan a ADIM y a los socios de Kiva financiamientos para sus negocios. 
La coordinadora del grupo es Josselin, ella esta casada y tiene una hija de 1 año, la cual expresa que es su razon de lucha y sus ganas de salir adelante para ofrecerle una mejor vida. Su negocio es de una pulperia en su domicilio, quien la empezó gracias a la liquidación que recibió su esposo del trabajado anterior. Con el crédito otorgado comprara arroz, azucar y aceite.  Las demás integrantes son María Alejandra de 19 años, tiene una pulpería. Y Ana Felix de 58 años, es un ejemplo de lucha se dedica a la venta de cosechas y también vende gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
¨Creciendo con Fe¨ [Growing in Faith] is a supportive and hard-working group that comes from a rural area. These 3 entrepreneurial women have demonstrated that they are capable and accomplished women with their goals and their work. For the third time, they are requesting financial help from ADIM and the members of KIVA for their businesses.

The coordinator of the group is Josselin. She is married, and has a daughter who is 1 year old. Josselin says that giving her daughter a better life is the reason she fights and desires to get ahead. She has a convenience store in her home, which she started with money her husband received from a previous job. With the requested loan, she will buy rice, sugar, and oil.

The other members are 19-year-old María Alejandra who has a convenience store, and 58-year-old Ana Felix. Ana Felix is an example of a fighter, and she makes a living selling crops, and also sells soda at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Jhonny Enrique

texts.es: Jhonny está nuevamente con ADIM, demostrando ser un micro empresario trabajador y cumplido con los pagos de las cuotas. Por 2da vez solicita crédito para su negocio. El tiene 28 años, esta soltero, tiene responsabilidad con sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 año respectivamente. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos, desde hace 7 años, y sus hermanos le ayudan en la comercialización del producto. Con el dinero recibido comprara sandalias sencillas y finas, calzado de la marca vans y convers. Ya que son los mayores demandados por su variada clientela. Con esto seguirá brindándole la mejoras económicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhonny is with ADIM again, showing himself to be a hard-working micro-entrepreneur who has made the payments on his bills. For the second time, he is applying for credit for his business. He is 28 years old and is single. He is responsible for his two children, ages 3 and 1. He has been selling shoes for seven years, and his siblings help him sell the products. 

With the money received, he will buy sandals, [both] simple and fine, and footwear of the Vans and Converse brands, since these have the greatest demand by his various customers. With this he will continue offering the best financial resources to his children.

loans.use: to buy sandals, both simple and fine, and footwear of the Vans and Converse brands

loans.name: Makariyo

texts.en:
Makariyo used the previous loan to buy a plot of land, for rearing his animals.

He is a farmer rearing animals to sell and he is also growing bananas. He also owns rentals and a bar. He is faced with challenges due to weather changes and limited capital, which hinder expansion of his business. But however much this hinders his growth, he has future hopes of constructing a residential house. He has asked for a loan to buy cows for fattening in order to mature them quickly for sale.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening which will mature quickly and be sold

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a thirty four year old hard working married man with two children aged 5 and 3 years old living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is crop farming alongside his monthly salary and mobile money shop. He was inspired by the flexibility of the business to start it up since it required little capital. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes however he has a vision of expanding the business and moving to bigger towns.

He is requesting for a loan to buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne works hard to support her family. Joanne is married with five children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Joanne requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional more fish to sell in her food stall.

Joanne has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liliosa is 38 years old and has one child in school.

Liliosa has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Liliosa requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Liliosa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Liliosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle business

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos, actualmente está casada y tiene dos hijos, el primero asiste a sexto grado y el segundo a tercer grado y su esposo actualmente trabaja como motorista.

Verónica, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, el cual lo aprendió gracias a su madre, quien también hacía esta misma actividad.- Anteriormente, vendía tamales de elotes y tostadas de plátanos, ahora solo vende tortillas y a través de esta actividad ayuda mucho a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. 

El préstamo será para hacer una pequeña galerita, para que tenga su negocio de tortillas, porque se acerca el invierno y necesita estar más segura.- Además, otra parte será para colocar una pequeña tienda.

El sueño de Verónica, es que sus dos hijos alcancen un nivel de estudio universitario, para que puedan trabajar y defenderse en la vida.
texts.en:
Veronica, 33 years old, attended school through the sixth grade. Her parents have scarce financial resources. She is now married and has two children, one attending sixth grade and the other third grade. Her husband currently works as a driver.

She  has a small business selling tortillas, she learned this work from her mother who did the same. Previously, she was also selling corn tamales and fried plantains, but now she just sells tortillas, and through this work she greatly helps her husband to cover the household expenses.

This loan is to build a small shed that she will use for her tortilla business, because the winter is approaching and she needs a more protected work area. Additionally, she will use part of it to set up a small store.

Veronica's dream is to see her children complete a college education so they can find jobs and become independent in life.

loans.use: to build a small shed for use in her tortilla business.

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en: Rodney sells a variety of vegetables and grocery items.  He has been in this kind of business for 30 years.  Aside from selling vegetables and grocery items, he also has rice farming and hog raising businesses.  He and his partner have one child.  Rodney would like to increase his stocks of grocery items and vegetables but does not have enough capital.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP, which he believes will enable him to reach his goals.  Rodney hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a forty-seven-year-old single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more soap, salt, sugar, drinks, and other items to sell. She still owns a retail shop as her main source of income and still gets extra income from agriculture. She started up this business so that she could earn herself a living. She still has personal goals of expanding the retail shop into a wholesale business and building a permanent house, though she still faces a problem of price changes. 

Sarah intends to use this loan to buy more soap, salt, sugar, drinks, and other items to sell to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt, sugar, drinks, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Enma Isabel

texts.es:
Enma, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera de dos hijos que viven con ella, pero solamente uno depende de ella.

Enma, vende productos como hilo, cinta adhesiva, jabón, mascones, lapiceros desde hace más de 6 años; también trabaja la agricultura y en el negocio se involucra un hijo y la distancia hasta donde sale a vender está a 10 kilómetros de su casa.

Enma, necesita le crédito para comprar más productos y para comprar abono para sembrar maíz.

El sueño de Enma, es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad, para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Enma is 51 years old, and she studied in school through the fourth grade. She is a single mother with two children that live with her, buy she only supports one of them.

Enma has sold products such as thread, adhesive tape, soap, scrubbing pads, and pencils for more than 6 years. She also works in agriculture, and her son is involved in the business. She travels as far as 10 kilometers from her home to sell her products.

Enma needs a loan to buy more products, and to buy fertilizer to grow corn.

Enma's dream is to have a shop in the center of the city where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more products, and to buy fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is an energetic and hardworking lady of 41 years of age. She lives with her husband and two sons. Both the sons are students. One is in college; the other is in a university. They reside at Alipurduar, West Bengal. Sima always dreamed to provide a better education to her sons. Sima and her husband are working hard from dawn to dusk to fulfill their mission. Together, they are running a fast food stall. 

Sima is a good cook and always enjoyed cooking and wanted to utilize her culinary skills to start her own food stall. So she and her husband started the fast food stall. They sell fast food items and local popular snacks like samosas (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), chow mein, pakora (a piece of vegetable or meat, coated in seasoned batter and deep fried), etc. Her products are very popular among local young boys and girls. Her husband brings the raw materials from the nearby markets. 

Sima faces difficulties to manage her household with the present income. So, she wants to increase the volume of her business for earning some extra income for the future. 

She has requested a loan through BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, besan (gram flour), and spices for the food stall. She hopes the expansion of her business will strengthen the economic status of her family. She wants her sons to be successful in life through proper education. She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for her fast food stall.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as school supplies, personal care products, and other groceries.

Maricel has been in this business for four years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as school supplies, canned goods, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Joy

texts.en:
Ma. Joy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Joy is 49 years old now.

Ma. Joy has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Joy requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ma. Joy has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ma. Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Charito has been in this business for 26 years. Charito earns additional income from a general store.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Enelyn Joy

texts.en:
Enelyn Joy works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Enelyn Joy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net, and other materials for her business.

Enelyn Joy has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Mamavi

texts.fr: Mamavi est une femme mariée âgée de 62 ans et mère d’un enfant. Mamavi vit à Tokoin                                                                                                                                pour entreprendre son activité. Mamavi vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Mamavi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Mamavi demande ce crédit pour acheter un bidon d’huile et des cartons de spaghetti  afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en:
Mamavi is a married woman aged 62 and the mother of one child. She lives in Tokoin where she has her business. 

Mamavi sells assorted foodstuffs to earn a living and help her family. She stocks up four times a month at the market. She is asking for this loan to buy a tin of oil and some cartons of spaghetti so as to make a profit to help her husband with family expenses and permit her child to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy a tin of oil and three cartons of spaghetti.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es una muchacha de 34 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de San Antonio Palopó.
Olga para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace ocho años en una comunidad circunvecina de su comunidad, Olga con el afán de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como block, arena y hierro para la terminación de la construcción de su casa.
El gran sueño es conseguir el crédito para terminar de construir su casa en este año.
texts.en:
Olga, age 34, is single.  She lives with her parents in a community in San Antonio Palopó.

In order to be able to get income and to get her family ahead, she buys and sells typical clothing.  She has been doing this work for eight years in a community adjacent to her community.

Out of the desire to improve her family’s quality of life, Olga has made the decision to request a loan to buy construction materials.  She will buy things like cement block, sand, and iron to finish building her house.

Her big dream is to get the loan in order to finish building her house this year.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement block, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Benes

texts.en:
Benes is a married man from Ronda, Cebu. He is 38 years old, and his son is 19 years old. For 16 years now, he has been dependent on hog raising to provide for his family's needs.

He is asking for a loan to buy sacks of feed for his hog. This will assure Benes that he can look after his business well without buying feed on a per-kilo basis, which is more expensive.

In the future, he plans to make a proper barn to house his hogs and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino tiene 68 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 6 años el cual cursa primaria en colegio nacional del caserio Conchua, en el distrito de Sallique, provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica el cliente es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 20 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Florentino, age 68, lives in his own house made of basic materials.  He lives with his wife and their six year old son, who attends the national Conchua village school, in the Sallique district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Florentino devotes himself to agriculture, and he grows coffee.  He has 20 years of experience in this line of work.

He will use the loan for agricultural work such as applying plant products and fertilizer, as well as labor costs for his harvest.  This will help him improve his coffee crop physiologically, morphologically, and productively. He will also have a timely crop and, therefore, a better yield and a better quality product. This way, he will have no problem selling his product.  He has very good personal and work references in his community.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work such as applying plant products and fertilizer, as well as labor costs for his harvest.

loans.name: Giannina Imelda

texts.es:
GIANINA IMELDA TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR, EN UNA COMUNIDAD TRANQUILA, DONDE LA GENTE SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO,GANADERIA Y AGRICULTURA, EN EL DISTRITO DE ZAÑA, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, QUE PERTENECE A LA REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO Y RECORRIDOS A DOMICILIOS DE SUS CLIENTES.DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. ES MUY LUCHADORA Y TRABAJADORA, NECESITA EL PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS(AUMENTAR SU STOCK) Y OTROS GASTOS DIVERSOS, ESTO LE PERMITIRÁ AUMENTAR SU VOLUMEN DE VENTAS,GENERAR MÁS INGRESO Y POR ENDE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Gianina Imelda is 22 years old, and she lives in her family's home in a peaceful neighborhood where the residents make a living in commerce, ranching and agriculture. Her neighborhood is located in the district of Zaña in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

She has made a living selling beauty products out of her home and by traveling to the homes of her customers for more than 3 years. She is a very determined and hardworking woman. She needs a loan to buy products (and increase her inventory) and to pay for other expenses. This will enable her to increase her sales volume, earn more income, and as a result improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products (and increase her inventory), and pay for other expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up with groceries such as rice, oil, canned goods, detergents, and other items.

loans.name: Elvamie

texts.en:
Elvamie is 25 years old and has two children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Elvamie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elvamie has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis de 30 años,  emprendió hace dos años su negocio de venta de complementos dietarios que impulsa por medio de charlas sobre el beneficio del uso de estos productos naturales y como aportan al bienestar y salud de los consumidores. Él se dedica a esta actividad todos los días en el horario de 8 a.m. a 7 p.m. ofreciéndoles a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares.  Como su capital es muy escaso para cumplir con la demanda de pedidos y desea expandirse aún más, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en productos naturales; té, malteadas, proteínas y demás.  Esta inversión es muy importante para cumplir con sus propósitos y lograr incrementar sus ventas. Luis es padre de dos hijos a quienes ofrece bienestar fruto de su trabajo y su meta a futuro es continuar trabajando comprometido para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 30 years old. He started his business selling dietary supplements two years ago; he promotes it by talking about the benefit of using these natural products, and the health and wellbeing they bring to consumers. He spends every day on his business, from 8am until 7pm, offering the supplements to friends, neighbours and family. His resources are very limited in terms of meeting the demand for orders and he wants to expand further, so he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

He will invest it in natural products such as tea, milkshakes and proteins. This investment is very important for accomplishing his objectives and being able to increase his sales. Luis is father to two children and, thanks to his work, he can offer them wellbeing. His goal for the future is to continue working, committed to improving his children's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in natural products such as tea, milkshakes and proteins

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Glenda is 40 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Glenda has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

Glenda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 20 years old. With one child, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for the family.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 39 ans, Ayélé est une femme qui vit à Tokoin avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Pour réaliser son revenu et subvenir favorablement aux besoins de ses enfants Ayélé vend des sachets plastiques dans son quartier. Ayélé s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des cartons de sachets plastiques Ayélé  demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider ses enfants dans leurs éducations.
texts.en: Single and aged 39, Ayélé is a woman who lives in Tokoin and is raising four children. In order to make a living and cover the needs of her children appropriately, Ayélé sells plastic bags in her neighborhood. She stocks up five times a month at the local market. So as to place an order for some cartons of plastic bags,  Ayélé  is requesting this loan to cover the cost of her order and have an income to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy three bales of plastic bags.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she cooks potatoes for sale. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy frying pans. Her business goal is to be a supplier of potatoes in the region within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of the family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy frying pans

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 48 ans. Adjoa habite à Tokoin et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour son épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Adjoa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois dans un  marché local. Pour commander des sacs de riz et un bidon d’huile, Adjoa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari à assurer leurs dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Married and aged 48, Adjoa lives in Tokoin and sells foodstuffs in her area so as to have enough income to flourish. To achieve her goals, Adjoa stocks up three times a month in a local market. Intending to order some sacks of rice and a tin of oil,  Adjoa is requesting this loan to make her purchase and dispose of income so that she can help her husband to cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and one tin of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's business.

loans.name: Heizl

texts.en:
Heizl is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Heizl is 26 years old, and her three children are in school.

Heizl has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Heizl requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Heizl has been in this business for one year. In the future, Heizl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores Paola

texts.es: Dolores tiene 26 años es soltera vive con sus padres en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico una refrigeradora ya que no tiene y las cosas de comer se le dañan realizara la compra en Guaranda en almacen La Ganga gracias al crédito podra mejorar su calidad de vida, su sueño es conseguir un trabajo para mejorar su situación económica, en su tiempo libre le gusta caminar por el campo con su mascota.
texts.en: Dolores is 26 years old and lives with her parents in Chimbo in the province of Bolivar. She works in agriculture and is requesting the loan to buy an appliance, a refrigerator. They don't have one and their food spoils. She will make the purchase in Guaranda at La Ganga's store. Thanks to the loan she can improve her quality of living. Her dream is to get work to improve her economic situation. In her free time she likes to walk in the country with her pet.

loans.use: to buy an appliance.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko vit à Tokoin et est âgée de 54 ans. Mariée, Akoko est mère d’un enfant et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son éducation. Akoko vend de la boisson locale préparée à base du mil dans son quartier pour avoir un revenu leur permettant de faire face aux charges quotidiennes. Akoko s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander un sac de mil et un tas de bois de chauffe pour la cuisson, Akoko demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité.
texts.en:
Akoko lives in Tokoin and is 54 years old. She is married and works dynamically to further the education of her one child. 

Akoko sells the local beverage, which is prepared with millet. She sells in her neighborhood to earn the revenue that allows her to take care of her daily expenses. 

Akoko buys her supplies two times a month in the market. Akoko is asking for this loan so that she can buy a bag of millet and a pile of firewood for cooking. The loan will help her with her purchase and allow her to be profitable.

loans.use: buy one bag of millet and one pile of firewood.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 37 years old and married.

Jennifer is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jennifer has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ericka Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta sétimo grado, abandono los estudios porque quería trabajar para poder ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres junto a 4 hermanos más.

Marisol, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y cuando termina los quehaceres les ayuda a sus padres en el cuido y manejo de una granja de gallinas ponedoras; además, también tiene cerdos los cuales tiene que cuidar y se turna con su madre para atender una pequeña tienda que tienen; antes de dedicarse a esto, trabajo durante 5 años en una pequeña empresa creada por amigos, para atender eventos en distintos departamentos del país.

Marisol, necesita el crédito para realizarle mejoras a la granja de gallinas ponedoras y para comprar concentrado y más aves para crecerlas y tener más producción, ya que ellos además de vender en su casa, dan abasto a 4 tiendas más en su comunidad. 

Ella, desea en un futuro poder formar una familia y tener 2 hijos, pero además desea poder construir su propia casa para estar seguros con su familia.
texts.en:
Marisol is 21 years old. She studied in school through the seventh grade, but abandoned her studies because she wanted to work to be able to help her parents with the household expenses. She is single, and lives in her parents' home along with 4 siblings.
 
Marisol does work around the home, and when she finishes her chores, she helps her parents care for and manage hens on their farm. In addition, she has pigs which she has to care for, and she takes turns with her mother running a small store which they have. Previously, Marisol worked for 5 years in a small company created by her friends, which handled events in different parts of the country.

Marisol needs a loan to carry out improvements to the farm for her hens, and to buy feed concentrate and more birds to increase production, since in addition to selling from their home, they supply 4 other stores in their community.

Marisol would like to be able to form a family and have 2 children in the future. Also, she would like to be able to build her own home in order for her family to be secure.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to the farm for her hens, and to buy feed concentrate and more birds to increase production.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular ones. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 53 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Amada has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Amada has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jeralyn is 31 years old, and her three children are in school.

Jeralyn has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines. Jeralyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jeralyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Jeralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 27-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer rearing cattle for milk production, and at the same time has a pool table business, plus earns a salary.

He is faced with hardships of limited space for his projects. Besides that, he is looking forward to growing his business.

Tadeo has asked for a loan to buy land and expand his livestock farm.

loans.use: to buy land and expand his livestock farm.

loans.name: Ma. Ofelia

texts.en:
Ma. Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines.

Ma. Ofelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products such as bags, wallets, umbrellas, perfume, body lotion, and other beauty products.

Ma. Ofelia has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as bags, wallets, umbrellas, perfume, body lotion, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilou is 48 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Marilou has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Marilou has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Elineliko

texts.en:
Elineliko is a 36-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income, where he mainly grows bananas. He also earns extra income from motorcycle transport. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes and price fluctuations. He has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer.

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure for his banana farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana farm.

loans.name: Los Meneses Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario ¨Los Meneses¨, esta integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, dueñas de sus negocios, con el fin de sacar ganancias para poder ayudar a los gastos del hogar y salir adelante. Quien coordina el grupo es doña Migdalia, ella es un ejemplo de lucha, a sus 47 años tiene en su domicilio una pulperia y con la ayuda de su esposo ha sacado adelante poco a poco, su hijo de 21 años le ayuda en la venta de productos. Y con el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. 
Las otras socias son Julia de 54 años ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, tortillas, refrescos y helados. E ileana, quien desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
The ¨Los Meneses¨ is made up of three fighters and entrepreneurial owners of businesses, who have the goal of making a profit to be able to help with the household expenses and get ahead. The coordinator of the group is Migdalia, and she is an example of a fighter. At 47 years old she has a small store in her house and with the help of her husband has been able to get ahead little by little. Her 21 year old son helps her with selling products. She will invest the money in buying rice, sugar, oil and beans.

The other members are Julia who is 54 years old. She works preparing and selling food, tortillas, soft drinks and ice-cream. And Ileana who for 15 years has worked raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and beans.

loans.name: Cingiz

texts.en:
Cingiz is a 34-year-old single man. He lives with his parents in the Agjabadi region. He earns a living by working as a waiter in a small café. He has been doing this for seven years.

Cingiz is the only person bringing income to the family because his parents are very old and retired. His salary is 80 AZN per month, but this isn’t enough to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Cingiz requires 340 AZN because he has a serious illness. He has been suffering from sugar diabetes for more than two years. As you know, the medical expenses are high, and medical drugs are expensive.

Please give your support to Cingiz.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Perlita is 35 years old, and her child is in school.

Perlita has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like blouses, etc.

Perlita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like blouses, etc.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 47 años de edad, vive en casa de material rustico con su cónyugue y sus 5 menores hijos de los cuales 3 cursan estudios en el colegio del caserio Santa Rosa de Minas, en el distrito de Querocotillo, en la provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú. Dicho caserío se dedica mayormente a la agricultura, ganadería y cría de animales menores.

Él se dedica al cultivo de café, cultivos de pan llevar, cría de ganado y a las labores de peón agrícola, cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad.El destino del crédito será invertir en labores de mantenimiento, podas y abono de su tierra en cultivo.De esta manera aumentarán sus ingresos y por ello mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 47 years old. He lives in a house made of basic materials with his spouse and 5 children. Three of them study at the school in Santa Rosa de Minas village, in the district of Querocotillo, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. The people of this village work mainly in agriculture and raising cattle and small animals.

Leoncio works growing coffee, growing basic foods, raising cattle and working as agricultural labor. He has good references, personal as well as for work in his community. The loan will be used to invest in maintenance work, pruning and applying manure to his land under cultivation. In this way he will increase his income and doing this improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance work, pruning and applying manure to his growing land.

loans.name: Mujer De Valor 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Mujer de Valor 2¨, lo conforman tres integrantes trabajadores, provenientes del área rural del país. La líder del grupo es Karla, de 31 años, casada y con 1 hijo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de forma ambulante en la comunidad. Este negocio lo inicio con el financiamiento de su esposo. Por segunda vez solicita del crédito ya que desea comprar productos de ropa intima que son de alto consumo para su clientela, como son boxers, blumers, brazzieres y talladores. Así obtendrá ganancias y podrá cumplir con las cuotas del préstamo. 
Los demás integrantes son Nora, de 24 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. y Oscar quien a sus 31 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo.
texts.en:
The Mujer de Valor 2 [Woman of Value 2] lending group is composed of three hard-working members who come from a rural part of the country. The group leader is Karla, who is 31 years old, is married and has one child.

She makes a living from the itinerant sale of new clothing in her community. She started this business with financing from her husband. She is requesting a loan for the second time as she wishes to buy high-demand underwear for her customers, such as boxer shorts, bloomers and brassieres. In this manner she will earn an income and will be able to pay back her loan.

The other members of the group are Nora, who is 24 years old and makes a living from the sale of pigs, and Oscar who is 31 years old and makes a living from raising and selling chickens.

loans.use: to buy boxer shorts, bloomers and brassieres

loans.name: Aljamra

texts.en:
Aljambra is 62 years old from Ronda, Cebu. She is married and her husband is a farmer. 

Aljambra buys and sells vegetables and bananas to earn a living. She is also into raising hogs for an additional income. 

She is requesting a loan to increase her stock of bananas and vegetables. With the loan as additional capital, she can improve her profits and buy healthy meals for herself and her husband. 

In the future, Aljambra plans to have a bigger barn and expand her buy-and-sell business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a fifty-one-year-old hardworking married man with four children who are 16, 9, 7, and 5 years old and living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

His main business is cattle fattening alongside farming, where he earns a living. He started this business to settle down and stop working for other people.  He has hardships of lack of capital, theft of his cows, and insufficient grazing land. However, he has a vision of becoming a great leader and having a good residential house. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Verónica Florentina

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer amable y responsable tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades  entre 3 y 6 años en una comunidad de San Antonio Palopó.
 Verónica para obtener sus ingresos  y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa típica ella tiene siete años de realizar esta labor. Verónica desde hace algún tiempo se había puesto a ver las necesidades de su familia y una de las más importantes es la adquisición de un terreno con construcción, pero una de las dificultades que Verónica tiene es no contar con el capital suficiente para poder realizar la compra, por tal razón solicita un préstamo.
El gran sueño de Verónica es contar con el préstamo para poder comprar su terreno y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Verónica is a friendly, responsible woman of 23. She is single and lives with two children aged 3 and 6 in a community in San Antonio Palopó.

She earns her living and supports her family by buying and selling traditional clothing, a job she's had for seven years. For some time now, Verónica has been assessing her family's needs. One of the most important is the acquisition of land with a building on it, but one of her problems is that she doesn't have enough money for such a purchase. For this reason she is seeking a loan.

Verónica's greatest dream is to get a loan so she can buy land and have her own home.

loans.use: buy land with a building on it

loans.name: Agung

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Agung, one of Ruma’s agents. Agung lives in North Tangerang, a suburban area located about a two hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Agung is happily married. Together with his wife, they have one cute daughter. Agung owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn more about expanding business in technology. Agung is hardworking and friendly guy and his community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.
