As the business grows, Agung is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Agung improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Agung's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for lower communities, a Ruma latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Agung is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil is 52-years-old, married and has 3 kids. He is a taxi  driver. In recent times, Mayil’s work is doing well in terms of income. Now he needs 410 AZN, because his spouse is very sick. The prices of drugs which the doctor has advised are very high. He is in desperate need and you can be of great support to him. Please help Mayil.

loans.use: to buy medical expenses

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour, sugar, bread, salt, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a mother of three children, at the age of 43 she wants the best for her family. She engages in banana production as a source of living with the help of her husband, who is also a farmer. She aims to have a better income for her family.   So, she decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for her banana plants to produce good quality bananas and to be able to cater orders to the market that will create greater income.

Rosalinda's plan for the future is to buy a new vehicle to use for delivery of her banana products.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for banana plants.

location.town: sangay daku, ozamiz city, Mis. Occ

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42-years-old and married.  Marilyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feeds, additional chickens and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds, additional chickens and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es: Rosa Aura de 42 años se encuentra dedicada a la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos por catálogo,  a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; su negocio inició con la finalidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Se incorporó en el año 2012 a esta modalidad de comercialización en la que gracias a su compromiso y dedicación ha obtenido éxito y su entusiasta forma de vender le ha permitido fidelizar a los habitantes del sector donde reside en un barrio de la ciudad de Barranquilla, quienes encuentran a la mano prendas de vestir, calzado, accesorios y demás artículos en campaña.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de mercancías varias; ropa, calzado, productos de aseo personal  y accesorios. Esta inversión promete incrementar las ventas y el número de clientes que actualmente atiende al incrementar su capital de trabajo, siendo la falta de ingresos una limitante para la estabilidad en su negocio.  Su meta a futuro es estabilizar su economía e incrementar su cartera de clientes.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos  a  quienes desea educar profesionalmente para que tengan un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
42-year old Rosa Aura earns her living selling products from catalogs through which she promotes various items that are on sale. She began her business so she could help her husband with household expenses. She started it in 2012 using a business model that drew on her enthusiasm and dedication. As a result she has been very successful and has many loyal customers in the neighbourhood of Barranquilla where she lives. Her customers have easy access to clothing, footwear, accessories and other similar items.

Now Rosa Aura is applying for her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which she will use to buy clothing, footwear, personal hygiene products, and accessories. She expects to increase sales and number of customers as a result. A lack of capital currently limits the stability of her business. 

Her goal is to expand her business and number of regular customers. 

Rosa Aura has four children for whom she wishes to provide a good education so they have a bright future.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as clothing, footwear, personal hygiene products, and accessories

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wilma is 35-years-old and has four children who are in school.

Wilma has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Wilma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlinda is 54-years-old and has one child who is in school.

Merlinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 37-years-old and has three children who are presently in school.

Marivic has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of  fish to sell in the market.

Marivic has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nerissa is 52-years-old and has two children who are in school.

Nerissa has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Nerissa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Monien

texts.en:
Monien is a married woman and 60-years-old with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Monien has a food vending business in the Philippines. Monien requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, additional utensils and materials for her food production business.

Monien has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, flour, cooking oil, additional utensils and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 60-years-old and has two children.

Amelia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Amelia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Amelia has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: El Mango Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨El Mango¨, esta por 6ta vez solicitando financiamiento para poder seguir prosperando en sus negocios. 
Maria Teresa, es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos a responsabilidad de ella de 20 y 13 años de edad. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de pan. quien pudo iniciarse con prestamos de otras microfinancieras. Hoy requiere del préstamo para invertirlo en harina, aceite, azúcar y canela. Con estos productos aumentara la producción. 
Los demás miembros son Carelia, 31 años y se dedica a la preparación y venta nacatamales en su domicilio. Jorge de 40 años quien comercializa cosechas.
texts.en:
This is the “El Mango” group’s sixth time requesting a loan to continue prospering in their businesses.

Maria Teresa is the group’s coordinator. She is married and has two children, who are 20 and 13 years old, under her care. For eight years, she has been selling bread. She was able to start the business with loans from other microfinance institutions. 

Now, she needs a loan to invest in flour, oil, sugar, and cinnamon. With these products, she will increase her production.

The other members are Carelia, who is 31 years old and makes and sells nacatamales in her home, and Jorge, who is 40 years old and sells crops.

loans.use: to invest in flour, oil, sugar, and cinnamon.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 47 años de edad, conviviente, vive en casa propia de material noble, junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el caserío Laynas del Distrito de la Matanza,que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú; es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la preparación y venta de chicha de jora los dias jueves y sábado , actividad que realiza hace más de 10 años, con muy buenas referencias, contando con clientela fija. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como harina, leña, azucar y otros, para incrementar ventas y reducir los costos, esto le ayudará tener un mejor modo de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own house built of solid materials together with her spouse and son. She lives in the village of Laynas in La Matanza district which belongs to Morropón province, Piura region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this place work in farming, raising livestock and commerce and enjoy basic services like running water and electricity.

Santos works making and selling chicha de jora (corn beer) on Thursday and Saturday, a business she has done for more than 10 years. She has good references and has a regular clientele. The loan will be used to buy ingredients like flour, wood, sugar and others to increase her sales and reduce her costs. This will help her have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare corn beer.

loans.name: Nimia Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 4 están estudiando, 2 aun no entran a la escuela y uno de 16 años no pudo seguir sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos de su madre, Rosa trabaja cocinando en una hacienda y ahí mismo le prestan un cuarto para que viva con sus hijos, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, Rosa tiene una discapacidad en su pierna izquierda pero ella dice que esto no le impide trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para tenerlos en la hacienda donde trabaja, su aspiración es que nunca le falte el trabajo y mejorar su negocio no faltar el alimento a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother. She has 7 children; four of them are studying, two still have not started school, and one, who is 16 years old, could not continue his education because his mother lacked the financial resources. 

Rosa cooks in an estate, and there she has been offered a room where she lives with her children. She also raises small animals. Rosa has a disability in her left leg, but she says that this doesn’t prevent her from working and taking her children forward. 

The loan will be invested in buying pigs to raise on the estate where she works. Her goal is that she never lacks work, that she can improve her business, and that her children never lack food.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Santiago Fabricio

texts.es: Santiago a su corta edad se dedica al comercio de ganado y también trabaja al jornal en el campo, el vive con su madre y con una hermana ya que no tiene padre, comenta Santiago que un vecino le enseño el manejo de este negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para venderlos en las ferias de ganado, su aspiración es seguir adelante con este negocio y llegar a ser un gran comerciante de ganado vacuno y también dedicarse y comercializar animales menores
texts.en: Santiago, at his young age, works selling livestock and also as a day laborer in the countryside. He lives with his mother and a sister as he does not have a father. Santiago comments that a neighbor taught him this business. He will use the loan to buy calves in order to sell them in the livestock markets. His goal is to keep being successful in this business and to become a major dealer in livestock as well as selling smaller animals.

loans.use: to bu calves

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells tea which he has been involved in for 10 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fresh tea leaves. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fresh tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent used the previous loan to buy windows and doors for his house construction.He has a business of owning a hotel. He is also a farmer who grows different types of crops and sells chapatis that add him supplementary income. Vincent is aiming at expanding his business to new areas and has asked for a loan to buy land where he can expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy land where he can expand his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy variety of cloth for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Grupo Los Primos De Santa Cruz La Laguna Group

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 32 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 2 y 7 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Francisco (es el primero del lado derecho de camisa negra) para  poder generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se esmera de sol a sol en sus cultivos sembrando una variedad de verduras como cebolla, zanahoria, papa y otros, el aprendió esta labor con su padre y el ahora ya tiene diez años de realizar esta labor.
Francisco con el afán de mejorar la calidad de su cosecha solicita un préstamo junto a un grupo de personas  para poder comprar fungicidas y abono químico para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, y poder obtener una buena cosecha  en esta temporada.
El gran sueño de Francisco es poder comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa más grande para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 32-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with three children between 2 and 7 years old. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

To generate an income and take his family forward, Francisco (the first from the right in the black shirt in the photo) puts in a lot of effort from sun up to sun down into his crops. He grows a variety of vegetables, including onions, carrots, potatoes, and other things. He learned this work from his father, and now he has spent 10 years doing this work.

Francisco, with the desire to improve the quality of his crop, requests a loan with a group of people to be able to buy fungicides and chemical manure to maintain his crop and to get a better harvest in this season.

Francisco’s big dream is to be able to buy land where he can build a bigger house for his children.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and chemical manure to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Gioconda Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta tiene 42 años de edad, su familia la conforma con su esposo que es chofer y sus 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos se encuentran estudiando, es una señora muy positiva con su negocio, son 13 años que Antonieta se dedica a la venta de ropa, esto lo hace ofreciendo a sus clientes y también vende bajo pedido, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar mercadería en ropa, la aspiración de Antonieta es seguir trabajando y por medio de su negocio tener los suficientes ingresos para dar la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Antonieta is 42 years old. Her family is comprised of her husband, who is a driver, and their 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a woman who is very positive about her business. Antonieta has been selling clothes for 13 years. She offers a selection of clothing to her customers and also sells to order. She will use the loan to buy merchandise. Antonieta's goal is to keep working and, by means of her business, to have sufficient income to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Nancy Iveth

texts.es: Nancy, es soltera y propietaria de una pulperia en su casa,  es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora quien ha salido adelante, por ser una persona responsable y ha cumplido con las cuotas de los prestamos. Ella es fiel cliente de nuestra microfinanciera, esta por vigésima vez para financiar su negocio. Este negocio lo impulso hace 5 años con la ayuda económica de su papa. Con el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, lácteos, jabón, frijoles, gaseosas, entre otras productos. Expresa que los créditos han sido de suma ayuda ya que le han ayudado para su crecimiento profesional, ya que asiste a la universidad y con las ganancias pudo comprar una computadora.
texts.en:
Nancy is single and the owner of a store in her house. She is a hard working, persevering, and enterprising woman, who has gone forward by being a responsible person and by complying with the repayment schedules for previous loans. She is a loyal client of the microfinance institution; this is the twentieth time she has gotten a loan for her business. 

She started this business 5 years ago with financial support from her father. With the money, she will invest in buying rice, sugar, oil, chicken, dairy products, soap, beans, and soda, among other products. 

She says that the loans have been a great help, since they have helped with her professional growth. She attends university and, with the earnings, she was able to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, chicken, dairy products, soap, beans, and soda, among other things.

loans.name: Carita De Angel Group

texts.es:
¨Carita de Angel¨ es un grupo solidario, que están solicitando a ADIM, un crédito para poder seguir sacando adelante sus negocios y a la vez a su familia. La coordinadora es Julia, 48 años, casada y con 5 hijos. Ella comercializa frutas, y viaja a otros departamentos para poder obtener mejores ganancias. Logro iniciar su negocio con ayuda de otras microfinancieras. Su esposo siempre la ayudado económicamente. Con el dinero invertirá en la compra de banano, piña, sandia, mamón chino, naranja, aguacate. Esto le permite ofrecer mas productos y vender mas. 
Las otras integrantes son Maria Teresa, 24 años y tiene en su casa una venta de fritanga. y Silvia de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de plátanos.
texts.en:
"Carita de Angel" is a solidarity group that is requesting a loan from ADIM in order to keep moving their businesses and families forward. The coordinator is Julia, who is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She sells fruits, and travels to other districts in order to earn better income. She was able to start her business with the help of other microfinance institutions. Her husband has always helped her economically. With the money, she will invest in the purchase of banana, pineapple, watermelon, rambutan, orange, and avocado. This will allow her to offer more products and sell more. 

The other members of the group are Maria Teresa, who is 24 years old and sells fried foods from her house, and Silvia, who is 25 years old and sells plantains.

loans.use: to purchase banana, pineapple, watermelon, rambutan, orange, and avocado

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a Kiva borrower, with 7 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds for the welfare of her cows. This her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy animal feeds for the welfare of her cows

loans.name: Lucrecia Etelvina

texts.es:
LUCRECIA ETELVINA TIENE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD,VIUDA,CON UN HIJO A CARGO, VIVE EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO,REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ, DONDE LA GENTE SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO,GANADERIA Y AGRICULTURA.

LUCRECIA SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE CONFECCION Y COSTURA, EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO. DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS PROXIMADAMENTE. ES MUY LUCHADORA Y TRABAJADORA, GOZA DE MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS POR PARTE DE SUS VECINOS Y CLIENTES, NECESITA EL PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE TRABAJO COMO TELAS,BROCHES,ENTRE OTROS, ASÍ MISMO CANCELAR UNA DEUDA CON MIBANCO Y OTROS GASTOS DIVERSOS, ESTO GENERARÁ EN ELLA Y SU HIJO UNA MEJORA EN SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Etelvina is 55 years old. She is a widow with 1 son in her care. She lives in the district of Cayalti, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Peru. The people here work in business, livestock, and agriculture. 
Lucrecia works making clothes in her own home. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. She is very hardworking and a fighter. She enjoys very good references from her neighbors and customers. She needs the loan to buy work materials such as fabrics and pins, among other items. She will also use it to cancel a debt with MiBanco and various other expenses. This will give her and her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as fabrics, pins, and other items and also to cancel a debt with MiBanco.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es: Diego es un joven trabajador, cuenta que su padre se dedica a la agricultura y que por este motivo le enseñó a la agricultura, son 3 años de que Diego siembra papas esto es desde que termino la secundaria, Diego  desea ingresar a la universidad pero que pese que ha intentado por algunas veces aun no lo logra, diego también trabaja de estibador de tanques de gas de uso doméstico, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para cuidar sus cultivos, la aspiración de Diego es seguir trabajando en la agricultura para tener algunos ahorros y solventar los gastos que implica ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en: Diego is a young worker. He says that his father is a farmer and, for this reason, taught him farming. For 3 years, since he finished secondary school, Diego has been growing potatoes. Diego wants to go to the university but, despite having tried a number of times, he has not been able to go. Diego also works as a stevedore for domestic gas tanks. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer to care for his crops. Diego's goal is to keep working as a farmer so that he can have some savings and pay the expenses necessary to go to the university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Purevsuren, 57 years old, lives with his wife and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting people between districts using his minivan since 2004 and his wife works as the conductor on his minivan. This year his 8th grade student granddaughter came to live in their house, near his high school. Using his previous loan, he renovated his house and created a comfortable home for his family. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to repair the fences surrounding his land. The fences became damaged and lots of stray animals such as dogs and cattle are crossing his land and eating growing vegetables. After the repair, he has nothing to worry about his vegetables.

loans.use: to repair fences surrounding his land to prevent stray animals from eating his vegetable garden

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 29 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo, en el caserío Vista alegre, en el distrito de Callacyuc, Región de Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de esta comunidad de dedican básicamente a la agricultura, cría y venta de aniamales y al comercio.

Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa así como calzado para damas, caballeros y niños, hace 8 años aproximadamente en este negocio, con muy buenas referencias de parte de sus vecinos, el crédito esta destinado a incrementar el stock de su negocio y aprovechar las ventas por la feria en el distrito de Callayuc, con la compra de mercaderia incrementará sus ventas y con ello mejorara sus ganacias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, 29 years old, lives with her conjoint and youngest child in the tiny community of Vista alegre, Callacyuc district, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The majority of the population in this community earns a living by farming, raising and selling animals, or through commerce. 

Santos runs a business that sells clothes and shoes for women, men, and children. She has been doing this work for approximately 8 years, and has very good references from her neighbors. She will use the loan to increase the stock for her business and take advantage of sales for the fair in Callacyuc district. Buying more merchandise will allow her to increase sales, thus increasing her income and in the end her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and increase the stock for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Alona

texts.en:
Ma. Alona is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Ma. Alona has a buy-and-sell feed business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Ma. Alona has been in this business for 29 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is an old client to the institution, and she has two children both attending school.  She runs a restaurant as her major source of income which she has done for over 8years. Her major challenge was limited capital which used to affect her operations. To overcome this challenge, she joined Ugafode for financial assistance to boost her business and also pay school fees for her children, using the loans, Clare expanded her business and is able to meet her financial needs like paying school fees. 

She has applied for a loan of shs ugx4,000,000 to buy foodstuffs and increase her profitability. She thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled her to educate her children and meet her financial obligations.

loans.use: To buy food for her restaurant and also pay school fees

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 22 años de edad, él está muy satisfecho por el apoyo que recibió con el crédito pues gracias a ello él pudo comprar sus materiales de construcción y logro construir su casa, él y su familia ya tienen un mejor lugar donde poder vivir, José cuenta que antes él no tenía el apoyo de  ninguna institución y gracias a ADICLA y KIVA pudo hacer de su sueño realidad, es por ello que ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar productos como azúcar, huevos, café y golosinas  para surtir mejor su pequeña tienda.
José tiene el anhelo de construir otra casa para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 22-year-old man. He is very happy with the support he received with the loan, since, thanks to this support, he was able to buy his construction materials and build his house. He and his family now have a better place where they can live. José tells us that, before, he didn’t have the support of any institution and that, thanks to ADICLA and Kiva, he was able to make his dream a reality. It is for this reason that he is now requesting a new loan to be able to buy products such as sugar, eggs, coffee, and candies to better stock his small shop. 

José hopes to build another house to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, eggs, coffee, and candies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old and has six children. Delia is married and five of her children are in school.

Delia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Delia has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Rama is an active and energetic rural woman. She lives in Alipurduar with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter). Her children are in grade 10 and 4, respectively. She ended her education at grade eight.

Rama is a responsible mother and a dedicated housewife as well. Her husband Dipankar runs a small business selling spices to his local shops, villagers and neighbors. With the assistance of his skilled and dedicated wife, he offers a quality-assured range of spices with good packaging at most affordable rates. They sell raw and powdered spices like cinnamon sticks, sesame seeds, coriander seeds, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, cumin powder, chili powder etc. Sometimes they purchase raw spices from the wholesale market and then send them to a nearby mill to grind into fine powder for sale. It serves as key ingredients of cooking food with flavor and color and also is used as medicine. As per customers' demand, Rama wants to enhance her family-run business for more income. Thus, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase varieties of spices in bulk so that she can earn more profit.  

She hopes it will help to improve her family’s well-being as well as their financial condition. Her future dream is to expand the business to build a concrete house for her children so that they are not affected by any hindrance.

She thanks her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase various spices in bulk for enhancing her family-run business.

loans.name: Kajal

texts.en:
Kajal is an entrepreneur of 46 years and a mother of four children (three sons and one daughter). She lives with her family in a small village in Alipurduar district.  Two of her sons and her daughter go to school and one son plays musical instrument in an orchestra. Kajal’s husband Gopal is associated with a clothing business. Kajal is engaged in the artificial flower garland manufacturing business.  

She buys materials like plastic sheets, silk cloth, thread, aluminum wires etc. from the market and makes a variety of artificial flower garlands and supplies them in local market shops. Self-confident and supported by her family, Kajal is successfully running her business.  There is a great demand for her garland in the market, especially in the seasons of Hindu festivals.

Now she needs to buy materials for her business, but she does not have sufficient capital. So, Kajal has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to overcome the problems.  She will invest the loan to purchase necessary things for her business to manufacture more garlands.  She hopes the loan will enable her to reach to her goal to grow her business as well as lift their financial condition.

Kajal thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her existing garland-manufacturing business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic lives in Ronda, Cebu with her family. She has two children aged six and twelve. Her husband is a driver and Marivic helps by raising hogs near her house for six years now. 

She is asking a loan of PHP10000 from CEVI to buy three piglets and two sacks of feed. She is also determined to work hard so she can pay for the school fees of her children and buy what they need. She plans to improve her business and manage it well to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and two sacks of feed which will help pay school fees

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman from Moalboal, Cebu. She and her husband farms rice to earn a living for their fourteen year old son. In addition to farming, she also cook pork barbecue and puso (rice wrapped in coconut leaves). These foods usually sell in the evening to the locals. 

She is asking a loan of PHP4000 to buy a tractor for her farm and make her farm more productive. In the future, Thelma plans to build a comfortable house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for use on her rice farm

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos con 36 años de edad, soltero, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de infraestructura de corral de sus animales y alimentos para engorde de los mismos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; juan Carlos piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 36 years old, single, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, which is a rural area that specializes in agriculture, commerce, and livestock breeding. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. 

He makes a living by raising and selling animals, and he has more than 8 years of experience in this business. His business is located in his residence. He is requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure of his animals’ pen, and to buy food to fatten the animals. This investment will allow him to have a greater variety of animals and greater productivity from his animals, which will have a large influence on his business. Juan Carlos is planning to increase his stock of animals to be able to meet the diverse preferences and needs of the area’s customers. This way, he will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of his animals’ pen, and to buy food to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ana is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Sher Ann

texts.en:
Sher Ann works hard to support her family. Sher Ann is married with one child and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Sher Ann requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fishes, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Sher Ann has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishes, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling personal product retail business.

Cristina dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 39-year old married man with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells bananas, distills Waragi, a local brew in his area, and at the same time does motorcycle transport. He faces a challenge of limited capital that hinders expansion of his business. However, he is working very hard to make sure he constructs a residential house. Stephen has asked for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Graciela Nora

texts.es: A sus 47 años de edad Graciela es una señora casada y tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de ellos ya trabaja, el segundo se encuentra realizando la tesis, y la tercera asiste al colegio, Graciela comenta que es muy duro dar la educación a sus 3 hijos, ya que su economía no le alcanza para cubrir todos estos gastos, ella y su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina para hacer pan y otras productos que los ofrece en su pequeña panadería que ya la tiene 15 años, la meta que sea propuesto Graciela es que tiene que ver a sus hijos graduados para que ellas tengan una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: At 47 years old, Graciela is a married woman who has 3 children. The oldest of her children is already working. The second oldest is completing a thesis, and the third goes to high school. Graciela comments that it is very difficult to provide education to her 3 children, since her income does not cover all of the expenses. She and her husband work hard to get ahead. She is going to invest the loan by buying flour to make bread and other products that she sells in her small bakery, which she has had for 15 years. The goal that Graciela has set for herself is to see her children graduate so that they can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Semra

texts.en:
Semra is married and a mother of two. She is newly retired from a public company and has decided to buy and sell lingerie. With her first loan she is planning to purchase lingerie and she wants to open a store of her own in the future.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Semra hanım evli, iki çocuk annesi. Bir kamu kuruluşundan yeni emekli olmuş. Ailesine destek olmak boş durmamak için çamaşır alıp satmaya karar vermiş. Aldığı ilk krediyi sermaye yapıp çamaşır alıp satacak. İleride belki dükkan açabileceğini söyledi.

loans.use: to buy lingerie for sale with the hope of opening her own store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber for selling.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Sima hails from Alipurduar, West Bengal. She is a widow and lives in her own semi concrete house with children (one son and one daughter). Her son and daughter both read in the village secondary schools. Sima is an active, independent woman who started her own small business of ready-made garments after her husband's death, with an objective to develop their livelihood. She has taken a great role to look after her young children. 

Sima has been engaged in a home-based clothing business. She buys varieties of clothing and sells them in her neighborhood. She is the only breadwinner of the family, thus she is facing difficulties to bear all household costs as well as her children’s educational costs. She needs to expand her business to generate more income, thus Sima applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS.

She planned to purchase different types of ready-made garments (especially for ladies and kids) at the wholesale rate with the help of this loan. She hopes to earn more profit from her business and save money for the future. Sima wants to provide a bright future to her children, with a good education. 

Sima is thankful for the help of Kiva and its field partner BJS.

loans.use: to purchase different types of ready-made garments for her business.

loans.name: Rosmalana

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rosmalana, one of Ruma’s agents. Rosmalana is a young lady who lives in East Bandung, a village area in West Java, located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Rosmalana is a student who already owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to learn about how to become an entrepreneur, as well as to increase her revenue and savings so that she can continue her study to university. Rosmalana is a hardworking and kind person. Her community sees her as a trusted and cheerful mobile airtime credits.
 
As the business grows, Rosmalana is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Rosmalana's goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for lower-income communities with Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Rosmalana is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her village community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
From Badian, Cebu, Armida  is 56 years old and has been operating a sari-sari (general) store for two decades now. Each month, she earns about  PHP 7000  selling items such as bath soap, canned goods, noodles, seasoning, chips, shampoo and insect repellent. The store is attached to her home. 

Armida is requesting a loan to buy more such items for her store. She aspires to improve her livelihood and expand her business for a better revenue in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, seasoning, shampoo, soy sauce, canned goods and snacks

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
For almost nine years now, Irenea has operated a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells biscuits, canned goods, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, candles, soap, shampoo, medicines, and many others. She is a 35-year-old married woman with four dependents ages 2-15 years old respectively. She also goes fishing and sells fresh fish to have additional income. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise like canned goods and medicines and fishing net. With the resources at hand, Irenea would be able to maintain the content of her store and improve her fishing livelihood as well. Thus it will cause her income to augment and she will be able to handle her finances. She would now able to provide her family with a nutritious diet and better living conditions.

Irenea hopes that she could be successful in managing her current sources of income to become productive and sustainable in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like canned goods,  medicines, and fishing net

loans.name: Giigekhnaran

texts.en:
Mrs. Giigekhnaran, 34 years old, lives with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been sewing and selling clothes to local people since 2010. Her husband has the position of sales manager at a private firm. Their child is a fourth-grade student at school. 

The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs urgent renovation. She is requesting a loan of $2,700 USD to buy building materials such as cement, bricks and shingles. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 63 years old, married and has three children to provide for. To earn a living she is able to help her husband as a farmer.  She also engaged in a gardening business to earn income. As a mother she wants what is the best for her family and to achieve this she aims to increase her income. She borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for the vegetables garden to produce good quality of vegetables and to have plenty of vegetables to be able to sell in the market, that will generate more income.

Vivian's plans for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her vegetables garden.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 60 years old and married with three children.  

Matilde is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Matilde requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Matilde has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Matilde would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Roda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Roda has been in this business for three years now, and earns additional income from her general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has been farming vegetables for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, with three children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gemma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a basket weaving business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional weaving materials for her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Zaydee

texts.en:
Zaydee is 37 years old and has three children. Zaydee is married and has three children are currently in school.

Zaydee is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Zaydee requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Zaydee has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marializa

texts.en:
Marializa is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marializa is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marializa has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and supplies for her business.

Rosalia has been in this business for 40 years now.

Rosalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an initial stock of vegetables to set up her husband's green grocery shop.

loans.name: Franklin Santiago

texts.es: Santiago vive con sus padres, el es soltero y tiene 24 años de edad, Santiago se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que nuestra institución  le dio el primer crédito y es su madre quien le enseña la manera de cuidar a estos animales que son un buen negocio, Santiago también trabaja de albañil juntamente con su padre, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, y aspira de este negocio poder ampliarlo para seguir adelante para cubrir sus gastos diarios y de ser posible ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Santiago lives with his parents. He is single and 24 years old. 

Santiago has been raising pigs since our institution gave him his first loan. His mother taught him how to take care of these animals, which constitute a good business. 

Santiago also works with his father as a bricklayer.

His loan will be used to buy pigs, and he hopes to expand this business so he can make progress toward covering his daily expenses and being able to help his parents.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small necklace shop, in which he sells costume jewelry such as rings, bangles, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a glass display case for the attraction of customers.

He is the family's sole source of income. He has to afford the expenses of utility bills, the school fees of his children, and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy costume jewelry such as rings, bangles, earrings, and necklaces which will enable him to increase his earnings.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry for her husband's jewelry shop.

loans.name: Yesenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive solamente con sus 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela, Yesenia se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que era muy joven ya que su madre le enseño como se da un correcto cuidado a estos animales para que dejen algo de ganancia, Yesenia agradece a nuestra institucion por ayudarle a crecer junto a su negocio, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Yesenia aspira seguir adelante con la crianza de sus animales menores para de esta manera apoyarse en los gastos de educación, alimentación, vestido y salud de sus hijos.
texts.en: Yesenia is 36 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 2 children who go to school. Since she was very young, Yesenia has made a living by raising pigs. Her mother showed her how to care for these animals correctly so that they provide some earnings. Yesenia appreciates our institution for helping her to grow along with her business. She is going to invest this loan by buying pigs. Yesenia aspires to continue moving forward with breeding her small animals. This way, she will support herself and cover education, food, clothing, and health expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is an old client with the institution who has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. Her major source of income is a boutique, which she has done for 23 years. She also deals in agriculture, whereby she has nursery beds for tea seedlings. 

Her major challenge is limited capital to help her expand her nursery beds to meet the increasing demand from farmers. 

Gloria joined UGAFODE to access financial support and expand her business and earn more income. She has applied for this loan to buy paint for her house and also expand her nursery beds. 

Gloria thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance that it extends to her that has enabled her to educate her three children and sustain her business, which earns her more income.

loans.use: to improve the image of her house by painting it and to expand her tea-seedling nursery beds.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old, married with one child.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rebecca aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
This is Cesar, 43, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines and married to Merlinda, his business partner. He and his wife work hard to provide income to meet their family’s daily personal and household needs.

Cesar operates a variety store which his wife has managed for a number of years already. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from their small general store, Cesar also operates a tricycle which carries four passengers and brings them to their destination either to a town market, church, or a friend's house and or to schools. He is shown in his photo with his tricycle. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which he will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, corn rice, charcoal, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages and partly for the maintenance of his tricycle. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Cesar dreams that his small store will become a bigger grocery store someday. He prays for good health and life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items  to sell and partly for maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Ilduze

texts.en:
Ilduze is 38 years old, married and she has three kids.

Ilduze is a farmer. Her monthly income is 50 AZN. This is a very low amount to solve the family problems. She has problems with her health. She has a lot of pains in her backbone. The total price of this operation is 610 AZN. As much as she tried, she couldn’t collect this amount on her own. Because of this, her only support can be Kiva. We kindly ask you to help her.

loans.use: to pay for an operation.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 66 years old, married to Yuniah and supports a family of five children. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 32 years, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Johnson has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and cereal seedlings for use in planting. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a tax business in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and cereal seedlings for use in planting

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 55 years old and married with four children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, candies, biscuits, coffee, beer, etc. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Delfino

texts.es:
Delfino es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador tiene 40 años cuenta con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 3 y 14 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad denominada Sololá.
Delfino para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de consumo diario, él tiene ocho años de contar con este negocio, para Delfino sacar adelante a su familia es lo más importante.
Delfino gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende los clientes cuenta con mucha clientela es por ello que se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar más productos como azúcar, arroz, sal, entre otros, con esta inversión el podrá satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
El gran sueño de Delfino es que su negocio prospere para obtener mejores ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delfino is an honorable and hardworking man. He is 40 years old. He has a lovely family of seven children between the ages of 3 and 14. This humble family lives in a community called Sololá. 

To help his family get ahead, Delfino makes a living by buying and selling daily consumption goods. He has been in this business for eight years. For Delfino, helping his family get ahead is the most important thing.

Thanks to the kindness with which he serves his customers, Delfino has a lot of customers. It is for this reason that he sees the need to buy more products such as sugar, rice, and salt, among others. With this investment, he will be able to better satisfy the needs of his customers.

Delfino’s biggest dream is for his business to prosper, so that he can have more income and continue supporting his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy grocery store products such as sugar, rice, and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Willian Geovany

texts.es: Willian tiene 30 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo de 4 años vive en Chimbo provincia de Bolivar, el se dedica a la venta de legumbres en los mercados, solicita el crédito para  capital de trabajo para comprar mas legumbres y tener mayores ingresos, su sueño es salir adelante y progresar en su negocio, realiza las compras en Ambato, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Willian is 30 years old and married with one child, who is 4. They live in Chimbo, in Bolivar province. 

He earns his living selling vegetables and pulses in the markets. He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital so he can buy more vegetables and increase his income. 

His dream is to move forward and progress in his business. He buys his products in Ambat, and in his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to increase his working capital so he can buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have maintenance done on her husband's lathe machine and to buy tools, dies and spare parts for his manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 bags of manure, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Dominga Celeste

texts.es:
DOMINGA CELESTE CON 65 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADA, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI, UBICADA EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU. DONDE LA POBLACION SE DEDICA MAYORMENTE AL COMERCIO, GANADERIA Y AGRICULTURA.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE SERVICIO DE CORTE DE CABELLO,TINTES,ONDULACIONES Y OTROS, DESDE HACE MAS DE 15 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO, GOZA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS Y CLIENTES. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA MATERIALES DE TRABAJO, COMO SILLAS, ESPEJOS, TINTES PARA CABELLO, ENTRE OTROS, PARA SU NEGOCIO. DE ESTA MANERA HACERLO CRECER, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Dominga Celeste is 65 years old, married, and lives with her husband in their own house in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti, located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The people here work mostly in commerce, livestock, and agriculture. 

She provides services of haircutting, hair dye, and perms, among others. She has had this business for 15 years in her own home, and enjoys good personal and professional references from her neighbors and customers. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials for her business, including chairs, mirrors, and hair dye, among others. In this way, she hopes to make her business grow, obtain more income, and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase work materials for her business.

loans.name: Merry Gin

texts.en:
Merry Gin is 33 years old, married, and has one child to provide for. To earn a living, she runs a retail business selling cellphones and cellphone accessories.

She wants to improve her family living, so she needs to increase her income. That's why she borrowed a loan to buy more merchandise to sell and to increase her inventory, to generate more income.

Merry Gin's plan for the future is to expand her business out from her income.

loans.use: to buy more cellphone-related merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to meet her daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and beverages which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will surely help sustain her family's everyday needs. 

Mercedita dreams of having a bigger General Store and and prays for good health and a long life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her store

loans.name: Eubelen

texts.en:
Eubelen is a 40 years old, married and have three children to provide. To help her husband for living she engaged in a papaya production. She aims to increase her family income, so she decided to availed a loan to purchase fertilizer for papaya plants. With this she can harvest plenty of papayas and a good quality of papayas to deliver in the market that will generate greater income of her family.

Eubelen plan for the future to save money out from her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her papaya plants for a better income for her family

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Help Purificacion see a glimpse of a better future through your generosity today. With a dream to nurture a productive farm someday and earn money to ensure a more stable life for the whole family, she works hard to help her husband, Gaspar, a farmer. Purificacion is involved in hog raising venture, a practical business that provides food for the community. She loves enterprises that produce food, since food is a basic need. 

As she aspires to enhance her life and business, she wants to buy a water pump with a loan of 25,000 PHP. Water supply in her place is insufficient, hence she needs it very badly. It would be very helpful to her hog raising venture and it would also pave the way for her plan of starting a farm. This loan will not only benefit her and her family, but also the whole community, because of the food her farm will produce.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to aid her hog-raising business and to start a farming venture

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 25 years old, married to David, and she supports one child. 

She has been a dairy farmer for the last year and the business earns her 11,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase milk supply clients and meet their demands in milk supply.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase milk supply clients and meet their demands in milk supply

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two piglets and one sack of feed

loans.name: Reneboy

texts.en:
Reneboy is a head of the family, He wants to give what is the best for his family. At the age of 45 , he had one child to provide for, As a father, he wants to give his child a better life. So, he decided to avail a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance to continue to cater to passengers and have more income.

Reneboy's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
Iniciar un negocio no es fácil, Gloria es testigo de esto pues ella aún recuerda los duros comienzos  de su pulpería, la cual nunca imaginó que hoy se convertiría en su principal fuente de ingresos. Invirtió solo  120 dólares con los que compró granos básicos, con las ganancias fue ampliándola hasta que hoy tiene un lugar próspero y rentable. 

Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, salsas de tomate, café entre otros productos. Esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá aumentar el inventario, en consiguiente aumentará sus ingresos. Gloria planea evolucionar su pulpería a distribuidora.
texts.en:
Starting a business isn't easy. Gloria is a witness of this because she still remembers the difficult beginnings of her store. She never imagined that today it would become her main source of income. She invested only 120 dollars in buying basic grains. With the profits, she expanded until today, with her own prosperous and profitable place.

Nonetheless, she is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, sodas, ketchup, coffee, and other products. This will be a big help for her because she will be able to increase inventory and then increase her profits. Gloria plans on turning her store into a distribution center.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, snacks, sodas, ketchup, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feed for more production and supply, so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional bricks for her supply.

loans.name: Jerusa

texts.en:
Jerusa is 45 years old and married to Gilbert, and she supports five children. She has been a farmer for the last 12 years, and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing the crops on her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest to meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing the crops on her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 29 years old, married to Nyakundi and she supports two children.
 
She has been a farmer for the last two years and the business earns her 11,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase herbicides and insecticides so as to spray her crops to increase sales in the market.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and insecticides so as to spray her crops so as to increase sales

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason for Florentina’s perseverance. Wanting to give them a better living condition in the future, she’s doing her best to enhance her direct selling business. She dreams that all her children will finish schooling because she knows that it’s the only inheritance that she can bestow on them. A college diploma will be the first step to their success.

Florentina resides in Santa Barbara, Iloilo with her husband Ruperto and their six children. Ruperto is a laborer with irregular income. Aside from this, he is already 63 years old. At his age, his strength declines but he cannot retire yet because they have three children in college.

This is the reason why Florentina wants to enhance her direct selling business. She has to work hard to supplement the needs of the whole family. However, her stock is very limited and it will also give her limited income. Thus she appeals for a PHP 11,000 loan to buy additional products like food supplements, toiletries, apparel, shoes and bags. This will surely increase her profit and will help provide for their everyday needs and children’s education. You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Florentina meets with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more apparel, toiletries, food supplements, shoes and bags for her direct selling business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 42,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending, pig fattening, and tricycle passenger businesses.

Agnes dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Diego Javier

texts.es: Diego tiene 28 años de edad es soltero vive con su madre en Ventanas provincia de los Rios el es empleado público solicita el crédito para la compra de un terreno en Ventanas, su sueño es comprarse un auto para hacer taxi ya que tendria otro ingreso, en su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Diego is 28 years old, single and lives with his mother in Ventanas province of Los Rios. He is a public employee. 

He requests a loan to purchase land in Ventanas. 

He hopes to buy a car for taxi as another source of income. In his free time, he likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy a property

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a selling dried fish business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Virginia has been in this business for five years now.

Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mayra Lady

texts.es: A sus 26 años de edad Mayra está casada y tiene 2 hijas de 5 y 7 años mismas que asisten a la escuela, Mayra juntamente con su esposo viven en una casa que les presta un familiar y trabajan en una fábrica de flores, Ella también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas para ayudarse en los gastos de su hogar, por este motivo el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollitas para venderlas cuando ya sean gallinas, lo que esta señora aspira es mejorar su negocio y por medio de este más adelante comprarse una casa para tener una vida más tranquila juntamente con su familia y sobre todo que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en: At 26 years old, Mayra is married and has 2 daughters, aged 5 and 7. They are in school. Mayra and her husband live in a house lent to them by a relative and they work in a flower factory. She also raises chickens to help with the household expenses. That is why she is going to invest in buying chicks to sell when they grow into hens. What she aspires to is improving her business and by doing that buying a house in the future to have a more peaceful life with her family. Above all, she wants her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de ste negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos,pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
