Silvia continues working at the business of selling clothing. She sells pants, blouses and shirts. She is an entrepreneur and a fighter. She wants to support her family through her business. 

Silvia requests a loan to buy shoes, pants, sweaters, shirts and blouses.

She is happy because of the loan and commits to fulfilling her payment installments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants, sweaters, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Rodeliza

texts.en:
In remote areas of Cebu, like the town of Ronda, many people rely on a livelihood that doesn't take them away from their home.  Rodeliza is 38 years old with two children, ages one and three. She has been raising hogs for five years now, and her barn is located not far from her house so she can also look after her children. 

Rodeliza is asking for a loan to buy three piglets and one sack of feed.  Rodeliza hopes to make her business successful so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and one sack of feed

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 38 years old, married to Venic, and supports four family members.
 
He has been a farmer for the last nine years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

Richard has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops on the farm.  This will provide a better harvest for family use and sale in the market.

Richard plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate himself.  His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops on the farm.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 37 years old, married, and has three children to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband in providing for their family, she is engaged in a transport business. She rents to somebody, and she receives a rent income only.

As part of the motorcycle maintenance, it needs a motorcycle registration renewal so that it can continue to cater to more passengers and create more income. That's why Charlene decided to borrow a loan to pay for motorcycle registration renewal.

Charlene’s plan for the future is to save money out from her business.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle registration renewal.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is very grateful for your generosity, lenders.  Because you showed her heartfelt help when you lent previously, she found hope to continue. 

Today she is involved in her small sari-sari store business.  Through this she continually supports her family.  At times, income may not be as sufficient as expected, but the family remains firm in their belief that someday they will be able to reach their dreams -- including the hope to succeed. 

In fact to be more inspired, Maria faithfully attends a weekly fellowship where she studies the word of God together with her other colleagues. 

Now, Maria needs your help again. She humbly asks for a PHP 25,000 loan that she will use to supply her store with more grocery items to sell.  She hopes that you will be able to support her again. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to supply her store with more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 49 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Virgilia has been raising cattle for 18 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 18 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Josue Omar

texts.es:
El socio Josue Omar se sigue dedicando al negocio de ejecutivo de ventas,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josue Omar is still working as a sales manager. He is a hard worker who helps his family get ahead through this business. 

Josue Omar requests a loan to buy a sound system for his home.

He is happy to have this loan and pledges to make all the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: o buy a sound system for his home.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower Marina continues with her handmade goods business. She sells textiles, sweaters, blankets and looms. She sells different types of textiles and has been in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the textiles and loom selling business. She is asking for the loan to buy textiles, sweaters and looms.  

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy textiles, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of seven children. She has been practicing farming for the last 17 years, earning KES 17,000 per month.
 
Catherine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 Vision Fund Kenya to buy certified seeds and farm inputs for increased production and supply and to increase income.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand to a retail business in the area. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs to increase production and supply and to increase income.

loans.name: Haniceta

texts.en:
Haniceta is 53 years old, married, and provides for five children. To earn a living she manages a vegetable garden. She plants vegetables and sells them to the market. 

Hancieta aims to increase her income so she has decided to borrow a loan to pay for the labor cost of cultivating the land in preparation for planting vegetables.  She can then start to plant vegetables for the next crop and will be able to sell them to the market.

Haniceta's plan for the future is to save money from her business income.

loans.use: To pay for the labor cost of cultivating the land in preparation for planting vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 53 years old, married and supports 5 children. 

He has been operating in his butchery for the last 9 years earning KES 15,000 per month.

Christopher has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to paint the butchery so as to attract more customers for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot for constructing rental houses. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to paint the butchery so as to attract more customers for more income gain.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 42 years old, married to John and she supports 2 children.
 
She has been a farmer for the last 13 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting in her farm so as to produce enough for family use and others for sale to clients in the market.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting in her farm so as to produce enough for family use and more to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making artificial jewelry.

loans.name: Fernando Joel

texts.es: Fernando tiene 35 años de edad es soltero vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios, el se dedica a la agricultura y solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos y fertilizantes para sembrar maiz gracias al credito podra mejorar sus cultivos para producir en mayor cantidad, su sueño es comprarse un vehiculo para poder salir a vender lo que cosecha ya que no hay mucha movilización por el sector, los desafios a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Fernando is 35 years old, single and lives in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. 

He makes a living farming and is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds, supplies and fertilizers to plant corn. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to improve his crops and produce a greater quantity. 

His dream is to buy a vehicle so that he can go out to sell what he harvests, as there is not much mobilization of the sector. The challenge he faces is diseases. 

In his spare time, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ana Emilou

texts.en:
Ana Emilou works hard to support her family. Ana Emilou is married and has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines.

Ana Emilou requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers.

Ana Emilou has been in this business for 5 years now.

Ana Emilou would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Shiela

texts.en:
Maria Shiela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Shiela is 32 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Maria Shiela has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Maria Shiela requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Maria Shiela has been in this business for 6 years. Maria Shiela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a single woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennifer is 45 years old and has four children are currently in school.

Jennifer has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Jennifer has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
El socio Fabian  se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio hace servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño del socio es comprar un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Fabian, continues to work in the transportation business. He works in taxi services and works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. His dream is to have a new car. He is asking for a loan to buy tires for his car.

He is happy about the loan and promises to complete his payment according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more for more income gain.

loans.name: Andres Jr

texts.en:
Andres is a 33 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living he is engaged in banana production.  He wants to give his family a good life, so he decided to take a loan to buy fertilizer for banana plants.  This will produce a good harvest and he will have plenty of bananas to be delivered to the market to generate more income. 

Andres wants to renovate his house out from his business income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his banana plants and renovate his house from the profits

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 34 years old and has two children are still in school.

Marilyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fishes, fish nets, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, fish nets, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old, married to Ezekiel and she supports 5 children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 14 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 44 years old, married to Beatrice and he supports 4 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 15 year and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as for top dressing his crops in the farm for a better harvest for family use and sale in the market.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate himself. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as for top dressing his crops in the farm for a better harvest for family use and sale in the market.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Arlene has a direct selling MSE, Avon and Natasha products business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase products like shoes, bags, lotion, body spray, etc. to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase products like shoes, bags, lotion, body spray, etc. to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlinda is 50 years old and has five children are currently in school.

Merlinda has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fishes, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fishes, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old and has eight children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is 23 years old from Sagarejo, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife. 

Rajab serves people as a taxi driver with his own car and generates a daily income. He wants to start an additional business and requested a loan. 

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase wool. As the wool is purchased, Rajab will resell it at a higher price and will gain additional income. 

Rajab hopes that this new business initiative will give him a chance to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin trading wool

loans.name: Maria De Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente a ella.

María, tiene una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad y su hija es quien la administra, mientras María, trabaja todos los días en una casa cuidando a un anciano de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, entre otros, porque estos son los que sus clientes buscan más, de esa manera lograra obtener otros ingresos extras para el sustento de su familia.

El sueño de María, es seguir trabajando y que sus hijos prosperen y encuentren buenas oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
María, 51 years old, did not study and is a single mother. She has three children who are now adults, are working and help her economically. 

María has a small shop of goods of basic needs. Her daughter manages the shop, while María works at a house caring for an elderly person from Monday to Saturday. 

She needs the loan to purchase products such as oil, rice, and beans among others, because these are what her customers look for the most. Through this purchase, she will obtain extra income to sustain her family. 

The dream of María is to continue working and to have her children prosper and find good opportunities in life.

loans.use: to purchase products such as oil, rice, and beans among others

loans.name: Tshepang

texts.en:
Tshepang is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am a BBA student, currently doing an English composition class that is truly interesting and fun, equal educational.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My plans are to gain some working experience in the financial sector before venturing into my own business in the near future. Firstly I want to establish my business here in Gauteng then take it (expand) provincially then be global, which will constitute me to travel.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I am 32 year old male (1983/12/20) and the only child my mother could be able to have. I was raised by her alone with the help of my grandmother. Currently she is working part time as a cleaner, as she is helping out a few members of the family to get through school. I am not married but have four kids that live with me and their mother. They inspire me to go on in life and I want to be a living and shining example to them.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I love people and charity work; hence I am involved on part of 4 charity organizations. So I spend most of my time doing work at community centers.
 
5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Currently I am supporting myself in terms of my studies. Being a full time student makes it hard to get a part time employment and that makes it more difficult for me with transport money. The loan will defiantly ease the pressure of borrowing from people as it will make me more independent.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de veinte y tres años de edad, con una gran pasión por ayudar a los demás. El decidió estudiar medicina como licenciatura, para poder brindar su apoyo a personas de escasos recursos. Su madre, la cual es arquitecta, es la principal en brindarle soporte, también recibe una pequeña ayuda por parte de su padre cada mes. 
Este ejemplar joven ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde un financiamiento que le permita pagar los gastos por monografía y título, para poder insertarse en el mundo laboral. Su siguente meta es buscar una especialización en la medicina y luego esforzarse mucho para tener su propia clínica.
texts.en:
Luis is a 23-year-old young man, with a passion for helping others. He decided to study medicine as his degree in order to be able to offer his support to those lacking resources. His mother, who is an architect, is the main person supporting him. He also receives a small amount of support from his father each month. 

This model young man has turned to Kiva, together with MiCrédito, for financing that would allow him to pay for expenses related to his thesis and degree – and be able to enter the working world. His next goal is to find a specialization in medicine and later work hard to have his own clinic.

loans.use: to pay for expenses for his thesis and degree.

loans.name: Picaflores Group

texts.es:
Deisy es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 18, 23, 25, 27 y 29 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, decidida, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Urbari’ que es un área de la ciudad específicamente delimitada, cuyo uso de suelo ha sido asignado para la edificación y asentamiento de actividades industriales, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Deisy es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro). Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que trabaja como plomero y con sus 2 hijos menores que estudian sus demás hijos son independientes, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su anhelo de superación la impulsó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de huevo, confección de tejidos, panadería, venta de pescado, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos y venta de comida, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio constantemente con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otro puesto de venta del mismo rubro en otro mercado. “mi negocio necesita aumentar su oferta para poder crecer y con los beneficios abriré otro puesto de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es tener 2 puesto de venta, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Deisy solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir un puesto de venta nuevo.
texts.en:
Deisy, who is 50, is married and has five children, aged 18, 23, 25, 27 and 29. She works selling secondhand clothing. She is a good mother, and is enterprising, independent, determined, committed, responsible and very hard-working. She works in the 'Urbari' district, which is an area of the city which has been specifically classified for construction and industry. It has a sub-tropical climate, and the temperature ranges from 21 to 35 degrees celsius.

Deisy has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long brown hair that she wears tied back, and is short and of medium build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, although she also speaks Spanish which is the language she uses for business. (She is seated in the center of the photograph.) She shares her home with her husband who works as a plumber, and her two youngest children who are still studying. Her other children are now independent. Her home, which the family built, is made of bricks and cement with a tin roof and has water, electricity and sewage connection. 

Her desire to excel led her to lead a group of people engaged in different types of businesses, including selling eggs, weaving, bakery, selling fish, selling pies, selling cosmetics and food sales, to ask for a loan in order to improve their businesses. Her business is selling secondhand clothes, such as pants, sweatshirts, t-shirts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc. She needs to supply her business with a wide variety and large quantity of clothing constantly to compete in the market, and also wants to open another stall selling the same items in another market. "My business needs to increase its stock in order to grow, and the profits will go towards opening another stall" she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales are constant, but the disadvantage is that she doesn't have the necessary capital to expand her business. Her dream is to have two market stalls, and she wants to invest in buying secondhand clothing wholesale. Deisy has been in business for two years and this is the first loan cycle with the provider. Deisy is asking for a loan to buy secondhand clothing wholesale in order to open a new market stall.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes wholesale in order to open a new market stall.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old, married and has four children for whom to provide. 

To earn a living, Imelda is engaged in a rickshaw business and is able to help her husband in providing for their family. 

Imelda wants to improve their living, so she decided to take a loan to buy spare parts for rickshaw maintenance so that it can continue to cater to more passengers and generate more income.

Imelda's plans for the future are to save money from her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en las afueras del cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayor actividad de los habitantes es la pesca y el turismo ya que existen lugares paradisiacos que son visitados por muchos turistas.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar más su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Don José es un joven que le gusta valerse por sí mismo y ganar sus propios ingresos para irse forjando un mejor porvenir, el tiene un local en la casa de los padres donde vende bebidas gaseosas, aguas, cervezas y varios productos más y bocadillos de picar, son muchas las personas que llegan hasta su local a conversar y distraerse sobre todo después de la dura tarea que sus clientes tienen  en alta mar, allí el se gana la vida honradamente y espera con los créditos ir mejorando su negocio y su vida.
Este crédito es para comprar aguas,colas, cervezas y bocadillos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro De Jaramijo Credit Group meets every 15 days in the outskirts of the Jaramijo canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches. The main activities of its inhabitants are fishing and tourism as there are idyllic places which are visited by many tourists.
In this place lives José, who is 19 years old, single and lives in his parents' house. He has spent three cycles with the Credit Group and he likes it because thanks to the loans he has been able to improve his business which allows him to get ahead.
José is a young man who likes to get along on his own and earn his own income in order to force a better future for himself. He has a shop in his parents' house where he sells soft drinks, water, beers and various other products including snacks. Many people come to his shop to chat and be distracted above all after the tough jobs that his customers have at sea.There he earns his living honestly and hopes to continue to improve his business and his life with the loans.
This loan is to buy water, soft drinks, beers and snacks. His dream is to have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy water, soft drinks, beers and snacks

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 55 years old and married with six children. 

Carolina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carolina has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Nieves

texts.en:
Ma. Nieves is a married woman, 56 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Nieves has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Ma. Nieves requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fishes, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Ma. Nieves has been in this business for 37 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fishes, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn 06 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 31 years old and she is married  She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years and lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village. The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet. 

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to build a toilet for the health and safety of her family

loans.name: Zoila Leticia

texts.es:
Zoila, de 23 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, estudio hasta bachillerato, pero por la escases de recursos económicos de su familia no logro seguir estudiando en la universidad, está soltera, vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos y junto a su madre trabajan para sostener a sus hermanos.

Zoila, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras desde hace mucho tiempo, ella tiene que cargar su mercadería para ir visitando a sus clientes y como ya tiene ruta de venta sus clientes la esperan para comprarle y hacerle pedidos de verduras o frutas.- Antes de realizar esta actividad, ella tenía un trabajo fijo como cocinera en un turicentro, después de dejar este trabajo, decidió dedicarse a vender frutas y verduras junto a su madre y sus hermanos, las rutas las cubre de lunes a sábado y gracias a este negocio ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. 

Zoila, anteriormente solicito un crédito para fortalecer su negocio y le ayudo mucho y mejoraron sus ganancias, ahora con este nuevo financiamiento, quiere reforzar su negocio y vender por mayoreo, es por eso que comprará grandes cantidades de repollo, tomates, huisquil, papas, manzanas, mangos, melones, piñas, entre otros productos; con este nuevo proyecto ella pretende ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y poder aumentar sus ganancias.

Zoila, nunca ha descartado la posibilidad de seguir estudiando en la universidad y graduarse como Licenciada en Contaduría Pública; también desea tener un local amplio donde pueda tener su mercadería y en un futuro poder construir su propia casa y tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Zoila, 22 years of age, is a very hardworking young woman who studied through high school. Due to a scarcity of resources in her family, she was not able to continue studying in college. She is single and lives with her mother and two siblings, who are currently in school. Along with her mother, she provides an income to support the family.

Zoila has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for some time. She has to carry her merchandise to sell to her customers. Now that she has a sales route, her customers wait for her to buy from her and to put in orders for fruits and vegetables.

Before having this business, she had a job working as a cook at a call center. She left the job in order to sell fruits and vegetables with her mother and siblings. She runs her routes from Monday to Saturday and, thanks to this, she has been able to support herself and her family.

Zoila requested her first loan to strengthen her business. The loan helped her considerably, and improved her earnings. Now with this new loan, she hopes to expand her business by selling her products wholesale. She will buy cabbage, tomatoes, huisquil (chayote), potatoes, apples, mangoes, melons, pineapples and other products in bulk. With this new project, she hopes to offer a wider variety of produce to her clients and increase her earnings. 

Zoila has never given up on her plans to continue her studies at university and earn a degree in accounting. She would also like to have larger premises to keep her merchandise, and to build her own house in the future and have her own family.

loans.use: to sell large quantities of cabbage, tomatoes, huisquil (chayote), potatoes, apples, mangoes, melons, and pineapples, among other products.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a 27 year old married lady with two children; She is an accounts assistant at a referal hospital in Rukungiri Hospital, a job she has done for three years. Her major challenge is limited capital to invest in her agriculture business to supplement her salary. 

So to overcome this challenge, she joined Ugafode for financial assistance of UGX 3,000,000 to boost her agriculture by buying farm in puts such as organic manure and mulch for her plantation.  This will help to increase the output then sales and profit. Marion hopes that with financial assistance from Ugafode, her Agricultural business will expand thus becoming a commercial farmer in the near future. 

She is hard working and appreciates Kiva support and partnership.

loans.use: To boost her agriculture by buying farm inputs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rita is 51 years old and has one children who are in school.

Rita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fishes, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Rita has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fishes, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Lagrita

texts.en:
Lagrita is 57 years old and married with five children. Lagrita works very hard to provide for them.

Lagrita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like face powder, diapers, candies, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Lagrita has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as face powder, diapers, sanitary pads, candies, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. 

Lagrita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like face powder, diapers, candies, milk, juice, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is from the municipality of Badian in Cebu. She is a married woman with three children aged three, four and five. She has been raising hogs for three years now, earning her six thousand per month. At the moment she is in need of an additional capital to sustain her business. 

She is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy feed and school supplies for her children. In the future, Catherine dream of exploring more business opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and school supplies for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, y su hijo de 10 años, el cual se encuentra cursando estudios en un colegio del caserío San Juan de Chorrillos, que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Callacyuc, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú, dicha zona se dedica mayormente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Paulino se dedica al cultivo de café,hace 10 años apróximadamente, con buenas referencias. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Paulino espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Paulino is 53 years old and lives with his partner and his 10-year-old son who is studying in a school in the village of San Juan de Chorrillos.  The village is located in the district of Callacyuc in the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Perú.  This area is mainly engaged in agriculture, livestock and trade. 

Paulino has made a living cultivating coffee for approximately 10 years, with good references.  He will use the loan granted to him to purchase manure and fertilizers to properly maintain his coffee crop as well as to hire labor for harvest time.  With this Paulino hopes to offer a better quality coffee to his customers which will have a positive impact on his income level and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers to properly maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nheriza

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nheriza works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Nheriza is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Nheriza has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is widowed and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalia is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalia has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rosalia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, tienen 2 hijos que viven con ellos.

Sandra, se dedica a la venta de lácteos como leche, queso y requesón en la comunidad donde vida, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 14 años y ha sido la forma como ha logrado salir adelante con  su familia y colaborar con su esposo, se dedicó y se dedica a esta actividad debido a que no encontró otra forma de trabajar; su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día.

El crédito será invertido para compra una vaca lechera, para incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar el negocio de lácteos.

Sandra, sueña con colocar un negocio en un local y también desea que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra, 32 years old, studied through the fourth year of secondary school. She is in a common-law marriage and makes a living through farming and raising livestock. She and her partner have two children that live with them. 

Sandra makes a living selling dairy products such as milk, cheese and cheese curds in the community where she lives. She has been in the business for 14 years, and it has been through this work that she has managed to support her family and collaborate with her husband. She devoted herself to this business as she could not find another form of work. Her schedule is five hours a day. 

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase milk production and improve her dairy business. 

Sandra dreams of putting her business in a shop and also wants her children to have university degrees and be working professionals.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and be able to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 50 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To earn a living and be able to provide for his family, he engags in a transport business. He wants to give his family a good living. So he decided to borrow a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle repair, so as to continue to cater to more passengers and generate more income.

Angel plan for the future to save money from his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Felymar

texts.en:
Felymar sells bread and fish and would like to continue selling them as an additional source of income. She is 44 years of age, married with one child.She has been selling fish and bread for one year and three months. Felymar also accepts laundry as her additional source of income. She is responsible and industrious.

She aims to buy more breads and fish to sell but her capital is not sufficient.For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000. She hopes to obtain her requested loan amount to keep her business profitable.

loans.use: in buying more bread and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ATM machines such as equity, KCB so as to offer M-Pesa services such as banks, money transactions to clients so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Preciousa

texts.en:
Preciousa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Preciousa is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Preciousa has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines. Preciousa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear like pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Preciousa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Preciousa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear like pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Redenta

texts.en:
Redenta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Redenta is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

Redenta has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Redenta requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Redenta has been in this business for three years. In the future, Redenta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a buy and sell ornamental plants business in the Philippines.

Dolores requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like flower pots, fertilizers, etc. for her business.

Dolores has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like flower pots, fertilizer, etc. for her business

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leónidas, necesita un crédito para invertirlo en la preparación del terreno, además comprara insumos agrícolas  para cultivar granos básicos, también tiene pensado adquirir cerdos para ir fortaleciendo sus actividades económicas.
Ha Leónidas le ha dado un efecto positivo haber invertido el crédito anterior en sus trabajos agrícolas, tiene buena productividad y ofrece mejores circunstancias de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Leónidas needs a loan which he will invest in preparing his land for cultivation as well as buying agricultural supplies to grow basic grains. He is also thinking of getting some pigs in order to strengthen his economic activities. 

Investing the previous loan in his agricultural work has had a positive effect for Leónidas. He has a good level of productivity and is able to offer his family group better circumstances.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing basic grains. He is also thinking of getting some pigs to strengthen his economic activities.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Meet Virginia. 

There is nothing she dreams but to succeed in life. This is why, she's very been into her business to earn and save money. She is operating a sari-sari store and recently, she was granted a loan worth PHP 25,000 that she used to improve the enterprise. 

To help her grow the business, she needs additional financial assistance. It would be better if you let her avail a loan worth PHP 30,000 that she will utilize in buying more merchandise products to sell. 
Thank you in advance for your generosity and heartfelt concern for people her. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: in buying more merchandise products to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jean is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jean has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Jean has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Ares

texts.en:
Ares works hard to support her family. Ares is married and has a selling purified drinking water business in the Philippines.

Ares requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Ares has been in this business for 2 years now.

Ares would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Boitumelo

texts.en:
Boitumelo is a business management student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story:

1. What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most? 
I am doing a Bachelors of Art in Business Administration. The class I enjoy the most is marketing because, there you can express yourself and become as creative as you like; it does not limit you, but it helps you to think beyond.

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goals are to obtain my degree so that I can be able to support my siblings. The field I want to work under is the Marketing department because, it will give me more opportunity to travel the world. I would like to work in the USA because I feel there is more opportunity and growth since their country is more developed. Yes, I would love to travel.

3. Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? 
I was born in the informal settlement of Daveyton, where a child is exposed to drugs, prostitution and violence, which I feel no child should be raised in an environment like that.
I have three brothers which none of them has been fortunate to study further after matric because of the funds yet at the same time they had to go and look for work so that they can take care of the family.

4. What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I like reading books because it helps me to be more knowledgeable and expand my thinking capability all the time. So whenever I am free I got the primary schools and offer my services to help up bring kids and read looks for them.

5. What do you like to do in your spare time? How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: Will there be significant changes
Yes a lot, it will give me opportunity to arrive at school on time instead of walking distance and end up missing my first class and meditation programme. Not only that, it will also help me to be able to buy food at home.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Here is Adelaida. She didn't complete her studies. She only attained high school and though she wants to continue this, her age seems not to fit anymore. She is already 51 years old, living at Intramuros, Manila, Philippines and is married to Rodel. They have five kids by now, and only one is left studying. 

To support her child, she busies herself in managing her small sari-sari store, (a variety store in common) where she gains a not-so-high profit. 

Adelaida wants you to know that she wants to expand her business. But she doesn't have enough capital. She wants to provide stocks of grocery items for her store in large quantities, and that's why she would like to ask for a PHP 10,000 loan from you. Hoping a lot that you'd consider this, Adelaida plans to earn savings from the profit she will gain from the expansion. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to provide stocks of grocery items for her store in large quantities

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 51 years old. He lives in Khashuri district with his wife and two children. 

Ramaz is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of agricultural land, where he grows maize and wheat. He sells the harvested products locally. 

Ramaz wants to purchase a cow and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing a cow. After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products to sell.

Ramaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jovid

texts.en:
Jovid is a bright man. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1994, is single and lives with his parents. 

He is a third year student at university, studying finance and economy. He will apply his knowledge in a chosen profession and wants to be a specialist in order to increase the standard of living in Tajikistan. 

His parents are government workers and their salary is spending to every day necessary things as food and clothing. Jovid studies hard and is well known among students and friends. 

He appealed to IMON and requested a loan to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay his third year university fees in finance and economy.  He wishes to apply his education to his chosen profession, helping his country to improve

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 47 years old, he is married and has three children ages 21, 17 and 12.All his children go to school. His eldest is pursuing an undergraduate degree. Kenneth is a trained accountant and has over 20 years experience. He left formal employment in 2009 to pursue private business in financial services. 

Kenneth's Zoona business deals in the sending and receiving of money from one place to the other. People in Lumumba, Lusaka go to his shop to access financial services such as bill payments, forex and mobile money transfers. He explains that it brings him joy to provide high level technological services to the community at affordable rates. His vision is to bring as many services as possible under one roof.

Kenneth has requested a Kiva loan so that he can have the funds needed to service his customers, who need to access financial services. His biggest challenge is that he lacks a good working capital and struggles to serve his customers as fast as he would like. His is hopeful that this capital injection will enable him earn more profits. 

With the profits, the profits go towards insuring that his children stay in school. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide the funds needed to serve customers who need to send and receive money from his shop and to pay for signage

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Yakobo,who is in his early 30s is married with two children, one is still in school and the other one is still small.  He has had a shop for two years now.  He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Yakobo's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase stocks of sweets, biscuits, chewing gum, water, sodas, juice, lollipops etc and has paid all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan,  bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to sweets, biscuits, chewing gum, water, juice, soda lollipops etc. to resell.  He dreams of building his own house.

Yakobo will share this loan with his loan group Mpunga which has two members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, chewing gum, water, juice, soda lollipops etc. to resell in his store

loans.name: Karelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Las condiciones higiénicas son importantes para mantener una vida saludable y cómoda. Sin embargo, en algunos sectores del país no se cuenta con estos servicios, es por ello que la microfinanciera MiCrédito, en su labor de mejorar las condiciones de vida de esas familias, ofrece este tipo de financiamientos. 

Por lo ello, Karelia  solicita un crédito para la construcción de un sanitario, que le ayudará a mejorar las condiciones higiénicas de su casa. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y granos básicos para sacar a delante a su hijo de un año.
texts.en:
Hygienic conditions are important for maintaining a healthy and comfortable life.  However, some areas of the country don’t have these services.  That's why the microfinance institution MiCrédito, in its efforts to improve the living conditions of these families, offers this type of financing.

For this reason, Karelia is requesting a loan for the construction of a bathroom that will help her to improve the hygienic conditions of her house.  She is a hardworking, responsible and enterprising woman.  She makes a living selling tortillas and staple foods to get her one-year-old son ahead.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Thank you lenders for reaching out to Patricia! 

She wants to extend her gratefulness to you as she was able to supply her business with enough raw ingredients needed in cooking the dishes she sells. Part of the profit she gained from the business was used to establish another trade that she is currently handling. 

Today, she is busy selling different products, mostly plastic wares like lunch boxes, pails and other relative products. She wanted to improve this busy but she don't have enough capital to do so. With this, she would like to ask you humbly if she can avail a loan worth PHP 10,000. This would definitely help her in purchasing more plastic products that she's going to sell. 

She is loyal in repaying and she promises to take care of the trust you will give her. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: for purchasing more plastic products that she's going to sell.

loans.name: Bernandina

texts.en:
Bernandina is 38 years old and has three children. Bernandina is married and has three children who are in school.

Bernandina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Bernandina requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Bernandina has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernandina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 60 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josefina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma is 65 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Norma has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish.

Norma has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Nazrijan

texts.ru:
Назричан веселый мужчина с чевством умора и большим добрым сердцем. Назичан примерный семьянин. Он женат и имеет детей. Назирчан работает и старается, чтобы его жена и дети ненуждвлись не в чем.
   Назирчан дома продвигает животноводческую деятельность. Он разводит крупоногатых скотин. Сейчас количество его скот уменшилось и он планирует приобрети еще пару голов телят. Для этой операции нужны денежные средства. Его собственный капитал не позволяют ему соверщить задуманный план и он принял решение обратиться за заемными средствами. Назирчан верит, что сделал верный шаг и уверен, что его поддержат.
texts.en: Nazrijan is a cheerful man with a great sense of humor and a big, kind heart.  Nazirjan is an exemplary family man - he is married and has children.  Nazrijan works hard so that his wife and children want for nothing.  Nazirjan works in animal husbandry from his home and raises livestock.  Currently, the number of livestock in his herd has diminished, and so he plans to purchase another pair of calves.  For this he needs money - his own capital does not allow him to fulfill his plan, and so he made the decision to seek a loan.  Nazrijan believes that he has taken the right step, and is confident that he will receive support.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of calves

loans.name: Carmen Josefina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como secretaria,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo quiere sacar aadelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar una cocina para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues working as a secretary. She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead through this job. She is requesting this loan to buy a stove for her home. She is grateful for the loan, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy a stove for her house

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз занимается традиционным рукоделием — «Гулдузи» вышиванием красивых узоров на ткани. С самого детства она увлекалась этим ремеслом.  Дилафруз вышивкой украшает самые разнообразные изделия: подушки, скатерти, полотенца, салфетки, покрывала, детские и женские платья. Однако для вышивания Дилафруз необходимо соответствующие нитки и ткани, нужно иметь несколько иголок (коротких с широким ушком), наперсток, ножницы, заостренную палочку, крючок, шило и много другое. Для приобретения всех этих инструментов Дилафруз необходимо дополнительное финансирование и с этой просьбой она обращается к вам.
texts.en: Dilafruz works in a traditional craft - "gulduzi" - which involves embroidering beautiful patterns in fabrics.  Since her childhood she has been fond of this profession.  Dilarfruz embroiders a wide variety of items - pillows, tablecloths, towels, napkins, blankets, and children's and women's dresses.  However, in order to embroider Dilafruz needs appropriate thread and fabric, a few needles (short and with a wide eye), a thimble, scissors, a sharpened stick, a hook, awl, and many other things.  In order to get all of these instruments, Dilafruz needs additional funds, and for this purpose is appealing to you.

loans.use: To purchase thimble, threads, fabrics and etc.

loans.name: Sumaya Group

texts.ru: Это группа Сумая. Она состоит из Мичгона и Бибиноз. Справа Бииноз, ей 47 лет. Слева Мичгона, ей 28 лет. Бибиноз и Мичгона мать и дочь. Мичгона умелая швея, она уже 5 лет занимается шитьем одежды. После развода с мужем, эта деятельность вернула ее к жизни. Мичгона любит проводить время за швейной машинкой. Бибиноз помогая дочке тоже научилась этой деятельности. Вот уже 2 года мать и дочь вместе занимаются шитьем и принимают заказы на шитье женской одежды. Так как у них всего одна швейная машинка, им тяжело продвигать бизнес. Бибиноз и Мичгона приняли решение обратиться за кредитом, чтобы приобрести еще одну швейную машинку. Они верят, что их поддержат и заранее выражают благодарность.
texts.en: This is the group, "Sumaya," which is made up of Mijgona and Bibinoz.  Bibinoz is on the right, and she is 47 years old, and Mijgona is on the left, and is 28 years old.  Bibinoz and Mijgona are mother and daughter.  Mijgona is an accomplished seamstress - she has already been sewing clothes for 5 years.  After her divorce from her husband, this job brought her back to life.  Mijgona loves to spend her time at the sewing machine.  In order to help her daughter, Bibinoz also learned how to sew.  Mother and daughter have now been working together as seamstresses for 2 years, and make women's clothing to order.  Because they have only one sewing machine, it is difficult for them to promote their business.  Bibinoz and Mijgona made the decision to request a loan in order to purchase an additional sewing machine.  They believe that you will support them and extend their thanks in advance.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Las Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su actividad de venta ambulante de refrescos (la cuarta de la izquierda, viste polera blanca, chompa roja, pantalón azul). El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de un carrito hamburguesero para iniciar una segunda actividad de venta de comida rápida. La banca continúa trabajando en conjunto en busca de continuar mejorando sus actividades actuales, las cuales son; venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, librería, venta de ropa, venta de empanadas, tejido de sombreros, confección de vestidos y venta de productos lácteos.
Su negocio e ingresos mejoraron, al igual que sus necesidades crecieron, “vendo comida a diario y no tengo una heladera dónde almacenar los alimentos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de una heladera dónde almacenar los alimentos perecederos. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de una heladera para conservar los alimentos frescos. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en diez años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra una heladera para conservar los alimentos frescos y abrir un puesto fijo de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Maria is continuing with her business selling soft drinks as a street vendor. She is the fourth person from the left wearing a white T-shirt, red sweater, and blue pants. She invested the previous loan she received in the purchase of a hamburger cart to begin a second business selling fast food. 

The communal bank is continuing to work together, seeking to continue their daily business activities, which are selling sandwiches, making crafts in plaster, selling books, selling clothing, selling empanadas, weaving hats, making dresses and selling dairy products. 

Her business and income have improved, at the same time as her needs have grown. "I sell food every day and I don't have refrigerator to store the food," she says. Her business's advantage is that she sells every day. The disadvantage is the lack of a refrigerator for storing her perishable food. 

Her dream is to open a permanent stand so that she can stop selling as a street vendor. She wishes to purchase a refrigerator so that she can keep the food fresh. She is in her sixth loan sequence with the institution in the 10 years she has been doing this work. These are the reasons Maria is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator for keeping food fresh and opening a permanent food stand

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for keeping food fresh and opening a permanent food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm products to sell for additional income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 15 kilograms of assorted frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 45-year-old, enterprising woman who lives in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Her husband Chandan is involved in a paper business. She is a mother of two lovely daughters. One of her daughters is married and other is pursuing her Bachelor's degree. Shikha supports her family financially by running a clothing business. 

She purchases varieties of clothing according to the seasonal demand from a wholesaler and sells them at the retail price in her neighborhood. She mainly sells sarees (a garment traditionally worn by Indian women), but sometimes she also sells other clothing like petticoats, nightwear, blouses, salwar suits, etc., according to the demand of her customers.

Her customers are gradually increasing day by day. Continuous price rise of the essential goods and the concern of saving for the future have made Shikha think to expand the size of her small-scale business. 

Thus she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS, to buy clothing stock. She is confident that with the help of this loan she will be able to expand her customer base. The profit generated from her business will help her improve her standard of living and remain financially secure. 

Shikha owes a debt of gratitude to her lenders and humbly thanks them for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 60, is married to Lilian and supports six children. He has been growing cash crops for the past 20 years and has had a profitable business. 

Joseph has applied for a loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer. He wishes to grow more farm produce to sell and generate additional income to provide for the needs of his family. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, to grow more farm produce to sell and generate additional income.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 45, is married and has five children to provide for. She is engaged in vegetable gardening to earn a living and provide for her children's daily needs.
 
She plants a variety of vegetables and sells them in the market. She aims for a better income so she has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer for vegetable plants. She hopes to produce a good harvest and sell plenty of vegetables in the market to generate more income.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to save money from her business income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is 57 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Alla is a widow and she has a daughter who is married and lives separately from her mother. 

Alla has worked very hard and raised her daughter alone without any support. All her life Alla has been engaged in land cultivation and animal breeding, activities which are her main source of income. She has her own plot of land where she cultivates different vegetables and sells them in the fruit markets in Sevan city. Also, she has three cows and with their milk, Alla makes dairy products and also sells those. She has had a hard life but at the same time she is a very optimistic lady and as she says, she is very happy. 

From Nor Horizon and Kiva she seeks a loan in order to buy  vegetable seedlings, fertilizer for her plot of land, and also fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings, fertilizer for her plot of land, and also fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a married woman from Alipurduar. She is 32 years old and an active and energetic entrepreneur.  She has two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is attending school and her daughter got married. 

Ratna's husband, Shibu, is engaged with agricultural business. He cultivates different varieties of crops and sells them in the market. Ratna runs a micro enterprise of milk selling. She rears cows and supplies milk in her local area; for additional income she also sells cow dung to her customers. The income generated from her business is spent on her family household expenses and she can save only a small amount for her son's educational expenses. But the amount is not sufficient; and so she wants to grow her business. 

Thus Ratna seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a new cow, which will allow her to sell more milk. The loan will help her to generate more profit from her business. She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Santos Matilde

texts.es:
Santos, es dueña de una tienda de productos varios, ella tiene 53 años edad, es viuda, vive con su sobrina de 22 años de edad, solo tiene una persona dependiente y no tiene ayuda económica de parientes. Su negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 16 años, el oficio se lo enseño una amiga y lo atiende a tiempo completo.
Invertirá en azúcar, sal, pastas, cereales, productos enlatados, boquitas y otros productos necesarios para tener un inventario surtido, de tal manera que pueda cubrir las demandas de sus clientes con rapidez, espera que las ventas e ingresos sean mayores para resarcir su deuda.
Su visión es mantenerse trabajando para vivir en un ambiente más digno junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos owns a general store. She is 53 years old. She is a widow who lives with her 22-year-old niece who depends on her and does not have economic help from family. She has had her business for more than 16 years. She learned the business from a friend and works full time.
She will invest in sugar, salt, pasta, cereal, canned goods and other products necessary for stocking inventory. She will be able to cover the demands of her customers quickly. She hopes that the sales and earnings will be greater in order to repay her debt. Her vision is to continue working so she can live in a decent environment with her family.

loans.use: invest in sugar, salt, pasta, cereal, canned goods and other products

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 39, has two children, aged 10 and 18. For 20 years, she has been in the business of making, buying and selling mats. She also operates a sari-sari (general store) in her town of Badian, Cebu. 

Marites is requesting a loan to buy more mats to sell and grocery items for her store, such as canned goods, chips, noodles, seasoning and toiletries. In her experience, full shelves always attract customers. 

In the future, she hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more mats to sell and grocery items for her store, such as canned goods, chips, noodles, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr: Diane, jeune dame âgée de 33 ans est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée est mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de l'eau et du jus et cela fait 3 ans. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter ses ingrédients(bissap, gingembre, du sucre,...) pour faire le jus pour vendre. Diane à comme projet l'achat d'un congélateur d’occasion et pour y parvenir, elle fait de l'épargne chaque jour. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra d'aider à faire les dépenses de la famille mais aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Diane, a young woman aged 33, is the leader of this group. She is married and the mother of four children. She sells water and juice drinks and has done that for three years. She needs a loan to buy ingredients (dried hibiscus flowers, ginger, sugar, etc.) to make juice drinks to sell. 

Diane's plan is to buy a used freezer and to manage that, she puts by savings every day. After her sales, she will have a profit that will permit her to make family expenditures but also to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy dried hibiscus flowers, ginger, tamarind, and sugar to make juice drinks to sell

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 39-year-old married woman from a village near Nablus city. She is a mother to three sons and one daughter. Her husband works but earns a low income. 

Khetam has a sewing workshop and takes orders from local traders. She lives with her family in very bad health conditions because of their old and unhealthy house. 

She wants to improve her business to increase her income so she has taken out a loan with Palestine for Credit and Development. This loan will help her to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop. 

Khetam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy textiles and yarn for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah is 25 years old, a single man and he supports 5 family members. 

He has been a livestock keeper such as goats for the last 1 year and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients daily and meet their demand in milk supply.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate himself. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients daily and meet their demand in milk supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so as to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a big busy city with her family. She is married and has three children. She is working at an organization as a manager of a project. She has four years of work experience. As an educated person, she wants to see her children also educated. Her son is a student at the Turkish lyceum. This month, the family expenditures increased and Lola and her husband tried to spare their savings.
