Because of the economic crisis, everything at market is very expensive. Lola has no money to pay her son’s education fee. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to pay her son’s education fee. Now she hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son’s education fee

loans.name: Achma

texts.en:
Achma is a 32-year-old, young and energetic entrepreneur from Falakata.  She is a responsible mother of three daughters.  She lives in Jogendrapur, a small village in Alipurduar district, with her husband and daughters. Her husband is a mason. Two of her daughters attend school and one is a kid. Achma has attended school up to grade five but she is determined that her daughters complete high school and maybe even college.

In addition to caring for her family and doing household chores alone, Achma also runs an animal husbandry business. She owns a milking cow of substantial productivity.  The milk is sold for local consumption, while a small quantity is set aside for her children. Since Achma's husband has no regular income, the income generated from Achma’s milk-selling business covers the maximum expenses incurred in the family.  Achma intends to invest in the expansion of her business by buying another dairy cow to increase productivity. She will also sell cow dung, which is good for farm manure and used as fuel in their region.

To this end, she applied for a microloan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase a dairy cow.  This will enhance her business and she will earn more profit. She wants to fulfill her long-cherished dream of constructing a concrete house with the profit generated from her business.

Achma extends her deep gratitude to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha, 52, is married with four children, one who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. 

Bernaditha has requested a loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy canned goods, personal care products and other items to sell in her store.
  
In the future, Bernaditha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, personal care products and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell for additional income.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is a 38 years old, married and have three children. To earn for living and able to her husband in providing her family needs she is engaged as a seaweeds grower. She wants to earn more income to give her family a good living. So she decided to borrowed a loan to buy additional materials for their seaweed business.

Jessel plan for the future to expand her business and buy a new fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for seaweed growing use.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Salvacion dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky is an old client.  He is married with two (2) children having one attending school.  He is a plumber, a job he has done for 6 years, as his major source of income.  However later he started a boda boda business to supplement his income. Lucky is applying for a loan of UGX1,500,000 to buy a piece of land. 

Lucky thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to finish his house and expand his business and encourages Ugafode to continue supporting low income earners because it improves people’s standards of living.

Lucky appreciates the services that UGAFODE and Kiva lenders offer to small enterpreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
This is Alfreda. Every week, she joins a group of people that studies the Word of God*. Here, she is inspired and encouraged to live with hope and joy. 

Despite the fact that her family is not as fortunate as other families, she and her husband, Julian, who works as a sidecar driver, persevere and work hard for their children's lives. 

Alfreda operates a stall selling a variety a products along the road. Through this small stand, she and her husband are able to provide the family with its basic needs, although she can't hide the fact that their income is not enough at times. She wants to improve this situation and also develop her sales. She asks for help from you. 

She humbly wants to avail financial support of 16,000 Philippine pesos to buy more products to sell. She is really hoping that you will grant her this amount. This is your chance to help in just a little way. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on the farm for high production and supply to gain more income

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Paulina has been engaged in a direct-selling business within her community for almost 25 years now. She is 58 years of age and blessed with four children.

She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. 

Due to financial insufficiency, Paulina wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Paulina had a sari-sari store before and she wants to revive the business eventually. She also aims to have her own stall and grow in progress with this to provide her family with a better living condition.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise products that are needed to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Mia May

texts.en:
Mia May is a 20-year-old woman from Badian, Cebu. Even at her young age, she is engaged in multiple businesses. She owns a sari-sari store, raises hogs and also offers butane refill to customers. Her business started two years ago. 

She is asking a loan to expand it and make it more profitable. She will use her loan to  buy liquefied petroleum gas for butane refills, butane canisters, piglets, seasoning, toiletries and condiments for her store. 

Mia May plans to continue exploring other business opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy liquefied petroleum gas for butane refills, butane canisters, piglets, seasoning, toiletries and condiments

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and daughter in a small old house. Ahmad has a stall where he sells accessories and perfumes for the neighborhood where he lives. 

He took a USD loan from FATEN; this loan will help him to buy new goods (perfumes and accessories) to sell in his stall. 

Ahmad has a dream to open a big shop in the future and to give his family a better life.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new goods (perfumes and accessories) to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma.Elma is 46 years old, married and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma.Elma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma.Elma has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en:
Matlab is 42 years old, married, and he has 2 kids. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. 

He is repairing cars in his garage and he also does welding for the maintenance of the cars. He has been doing this job for more than 14 years. Matlab says that it’s very hard work but to take care of his family, he must work. His profit from this business is about 100 AZN a month. 

Matlab wants to take a loan because he requires new equipment and machinery in his garage. 

With a good loan history, he has applied for second loan of 1,200 AZN. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is aged 45 years and he supports 3 children. He has been a farmer for the last 15 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer and jembes for his farming activity to enable him get a better harvest for family use and the surplus to sell to clients. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector, hence become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and jembes for his farming activity to enable him get a better harvest for family use and the surplus to sell to clients.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 27-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He is a father for one small son. 

Isam has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. 

Isam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell it.  This will increase the sales and also the income. 

Isam appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing and sell it.

loans.name: Florcefida

texts.en:
This is Florcefida. She is 60 years old and currently resides with her husband, Alfredo, in Caloocan City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than 20 years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Florcefida would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 18,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Florcefida hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) stores sell different kinds of products from biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, products used for personal hygiene and the like which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodities for people. 

With this fact, Eulalia was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 50 years old, married to Lolito and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. By now, they are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the store helps them for their daily expenditures. 

However, what profits they get from the business are sometimes insufficient. It is because of this that at times she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products. This is why she is requesting PHP 50 000 loan that she will utilize to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she will have the opportunity to increase in income. 

In due time, she hopes that she progresses and that her business will see a boost in sales. Through this, she can earn and save money for a house someday if God will allow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her inventory.

loans.name: Charmae

texts.en:
Charmae is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Charmae is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Charmae has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Charmae has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Sotera

texts.es:
María, de 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijas, pues el padre de las abandonó y desde entonces tuvo que desempeñar el rol de madre y padre, solo estudio hasta primer grado, pues las condiciones económicas de su familia no eran las mejores para que siguieran estudiando.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde muy pequeña, pero ahora su principal actividad es la fabricación  de artesanías, específicamente de matates y hamacas, ella desde pequeña también practica esta actividad y junto a su primer hija de 18 años de edad realizan este tipo de trabajos.- Su día empieza a las 5 de la mañana, junto a su hija tienen que trasladar su mercadería al pueblo más cercano para poder venderla, pues gracias a este trabajo ella obtiene los ingresos para su familia. 

El financiamiento del crédito lo necesita para comprar un saco de abono, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra, ya que junto a su hija tienen que cultivar la tierra para tener maíz y frijol para su alimentación diaria, y para el resto del año.

Los planes a futuro que tiene María son, que sus hijas puedan estudiar y sean profesionales; además desea reparar su casa, pues se le ha deteriorado a través de los años.
texts.en:
María is a 41 year old single mother to two daughters.  The father abandoned them and since then she has had to take on the role of both mother and father.   She only studied through first grade, as the economic situation of her family was not one that allowed her to continue studying.   Maria did housework from a young age, but now her main activity is making artisan goods, specifically bags and hammocks.  She has done this since she was young, and now she completes the work together with her youngest daughter, who is 18.  Her day begins at 5am, when she and her daughter take their merchandise to the closest town to sell it. Thanks to this work she receives income for her family.  

She needs the loan to buy a bag of compost, fertilizers, and pay for manual labor to prepare her land, as she and her daughter cultivate the land so that they will have corn and beans for daily consumption, and for the rest of the year.  Maria's plans for the future are that her daughters will be able to study and be professionals.   She would also like to repair her house, as it has deteriorated over the years.

loans.use: to buy a bag of compost, fertilizer and to pay for manual labor to prepare her land.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. This is her story:

I am doing my Bachelor of Business Administration. I enjoy the Principles of Economics as my subject choice; I love everything that has to do with Economics.

After graduating, I would like to work in a big company where I will be getting skills and experience. After 3 years I would like to start my own company where I will employ the youth of South Africa.

I was born in Natalspruit in Katlehong. I only have one brother who is currently doing grade 11 at Fumana Comprehensive School in Katlehong. I was raised by a single parent. My mother supports us by selling fruits and vegetables. My father left us when I was just four months old. The day he left us we thought he was going to work but he could not come back and instead he decided to stay with his girlfriend. My mother is so supportive and she wants the best for her children and we are going to make her proud.

In my spare time I read novels, listen to my favorite music, which is gospel as it brings me closer to my God. I go to church every Sunday and sometimes I help my brother with his homework.

The Kiva loan will change my life because I will be able to finish my studies and get my degree and start working. This will help my mother to take my little brother to university to further his studies. This loan will help me with transport money to school every day and I will not miss my classes every day so that I can get my degree.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 28 years old, married, and blessed with 3 children. He makes bricks to sell to construction sites and it has been profitable for the eight years he has been in the business.

He will be using the loan to buy brick making materials and in the hope this will enable him to supply more bricks and generate more income to support his family. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. His future hopes and dreams are to be successful in his business and be able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy brick making materials and in the hope this will enable him to supply more bricks to construction sites and generate more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of flour, rice, cooking oil and soap detergents to sell so as to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of charcoal for sale in the market so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en:
Ma. Rolita is 55 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Rolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Rolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Emiliano

texts.es:
Santos, tiene un negocio bien establecido con la ayuda del crédito anterior, continuo teniendo cultivos de calidad y su porqueriza está mejor equipada, está percibiendo nuevos ingresos y los utiliza para cubrir necesidades básicas familiares y cancelar su deuda.
Nuevamente hace la petición de un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el alquiler del terreno, así podrá sembrar granos básicos, con esta inversión tendrá oportunidad de mantener su negocio funcionando.
texts.en:
Santos has a well-established business thanks to a previous loan. He continues to have high quality crops and his pigpen is better equipped.  He is receiving new income, which he will use to cover the basic family needs and pay back his debt.  

He is now requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and pay to rent land so that he can plant basic grains.  With this investment he will have the opportunity to maintain a functioning business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay to rent land to be able to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Agreement

texts.en:
Velile is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story:

1.What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration. The class that I enjoy the most is the Entrepreneur course.

2.What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After graduating I wish to work for government sector for 2-3 years, saving money to start my own enterprise. I would like to work in Johannesburg and I enjoy travelling nationally and internationally.

3.Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?

 I am from a rural area in Limpopo. I was born in a place called Dzumeri village. I am the second-born from a family of four. My mother died when I was 18 years old; my father is self-employed and he is struggling to support us because he is married again with two kids. I was brought up by my grandmother; she was not working and life was not easy for us because we used to go to school with hungry stomachs.

4.What do you like to do in your spare time? 
In my spare time I go house-to-house in my township, Soweto, selling archaar. I have to work with my hands and I enjoy doing various home repair tasks. I also like reading novels and newspapers sometimes. I visit my family in Alexandra to spend the weekend with them.

5.How will the Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 
The Kiva loan will change my life because I will be able to pay my education fee and transport to school. My lifestyle will change because sometimes I struggle to come to school because of transport money.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su grupo familiar integrado por su esposo y tres hijos, con edades de 40, 21, 15 y 13 años respectivamente, tiene como negocio la venta de verduras, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado municipal y trabaja todos los días.
Comprará variedad de verduras frescas como papas, güisquiles, pepinos, pipianes, etc., fortalecerá su negocio para atraer a nuevos clientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
Sus sueños son darles a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para que estudien en la universidad y tener estabilidad económica para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Roxana lives with her husband and three children ages 21, 15 and 13. Her occupation is the sale of vegetables. She has a stand located in the municipal market and works every day. 

She will buy a variety of fresh vegetables such as potatoes, squashes, cucumbers, cushaws, etc., which will strengthen her business by attracting new customers and will help her improve her earnings.

Her dreams are to provide her children with the necessary support for them to go to university and to have the financial stability required to meet her obligations.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, squashes, cucumbers, cushaws, etc., which will strengthen her business and attract new customers.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is 49 year old who has made headway by working hard, supported by his wife and his three kids.  He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Kamran has more than 24 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle. He loves to save money, and thanks to his savings, he was able to buy his own house, which he has improved little by little. Now he needs help from Kiva and Aqroinvest to buy materials and to build a bathroom, since his family is still using a latrine, which pollutes the ground and has a negative impact on human health.

His biggest dream is to see his family enjoying better living conditions than the ones he experienced when he was a little boy.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik is 42 years old and lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She lives with her small family of a lovely husband and a 20-year-old daughter who is a student. Satenik and her husband work hard in order to maintain their family and help her daughter to pay for her education. Now Satenik has a health problem and she needs a surgical intervention. Satenik is asking for a loan from Kiva in order to solve her health problem. She is very thankful to Nor Horizon and sends her huge greetings to Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for her surgical intervention

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is asking for a loan that means a lot for her business expansion today. 

Taking a small peek at her background, she wasn't able to finish her schooling. But that never became a hindrance to move forward and reach her dreams. She is already 34 years old now and with her self-will and courage, she's making herself quite busy now in handling her buy-and-sell business. 

As you can see in the picture, she offers different kinds of products. She sells bags and some accessories like ponytails and other stuff. From here, she gets income that serves as a remedy for her family's (seemingly unending) financial incapacity. 

At times, there are cases where her sales never meet her expectations. It's really hard when such moments like these come. There are also circumstances when her capital is not enough. And being one of the breadwinners of the family, she doesn't want this business to just end with an unreasonable cause-- insufficiency. 

She believes that there is always a provision when there is a vision (a dream). This inspiration comes from the people around her that encourage her, including the people that she interacts with every week at a regular fellowship*. (Here, they share, testify and study the word of God.)

Prove to her that what she believes is always true. She's asking now for a loan of 50,000 PHP that she would use in purchasing additional products for her inventory. It's just one small step for you to take to help Maricel. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional products like bags and accessories for her inventory.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 22 years old and supports one child. She has a tailoring business and has been running the business for the past year. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of fabric materials for making dresses, blouses and skirts to sell. She hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to expand her shop and open more boutiques.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fabric materials for making dresses, blouses and skirts to sell. She hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of four sons and one daughter. Isam works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He is also a student in the university where he studies business administration. Isam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies. This will help him to write reports and do his homework easily. Isam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his study.

loans.name: Joebeth

texts.en:
Joebeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joebeth is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Joebeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Joebeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Joebeth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Joebeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jorge Franklin

texts.es:
Jorge, atiende una venta de productos varios para uso doméstico y también elabora hielo para vender, el negocio lo aprendió por medio de amistades, poco a poco ha ido incorporando nuevos productos y atrayendo más clientes, tiene su negocio desde hace 11 años. Vive con su compañera de vida, todavía no tienen hijos y ambos trabajan para tener menos necesidades en su hogar.
Requiere de un préstamo para comprar bebidas, cereales, golosinas, granos básicos y otros productos para satisfacer las necesidades primordiales de sus clientes, pretende incorporar nuevos productos y venderlos a precios accesibles, espera que su situación financiera sea más favorable.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar su negocio, resarcir su deuda y darle a su familia alimentación y vestuario adecuado.
texts.en:
Jorge runs a general store made up of various products for domestic use and he also makes ice to sell.  He learned his business through friends.  He has slowly been introducing new products and hence attracting more customers.  He has been running this business for 11 years now.  

He lives with his life partner.  They have no children yet but they both work to have fewer needs at home.

He is requesting a loan to purchase drinks, cereals, snacks, basic grains and other products to meet the basic needs of his customers.  He aims to incorporate new products and sell them at affordable prices.  He expects his financial situation will be more favorable.

His aspirations are to expand his business, repay debt and provide his family with adequate food and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, cereals, snacks, basic grains and other products to meet the basic needs of his customers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 40 years old and has one child is still in school.

Juliet has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other material for her business.

Juliet has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt and other material for her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 59 years old and single.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. Jane is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Jane requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

Jane has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy, sweet mints, peanuts, cashew seeds, etc. in order to maintain his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, rebar, stones, cement, and sand to build a protective wall at her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of tomatoes and onions to sell to clients in the market.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pacca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina  ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacra adelante a su familia ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PACCA.” This bank is located in the district of Anta, belonging to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member is Agripina. She is married, 48 years old, and has two children. She works raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. She wants to get her family ahead through this business since having her own business is her dream. She also wants to have a larger place so she can sell her animals. She requests the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, and also feed for the animals.

The other members work in food sales, agriculture, a grocery store business, and animal sales.

Agriprina thanks those who form part of this dream through these means, and she promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens, and also feed for the animals.

loans.name: Marlene De Jesus

texts.es:
Marlene, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y está acompañado, su manera de sacar adelante a su familia es elaborar antojitos y panes con pollo para vender, así genera los ingresos necesarios para ser una persona responsable con sus compromisos, el  negocio lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda y lo realiza por las tardes.
El capital de trabajo será de ayuda para comprar pollo, pan, condimentos, yuca, papas, maíz, leña y otros materiales necesarios para preparar la venta de antojitos y panes con pollo, su objetivo es aumentar la productividad de su negocio para atender a nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más competitivo en la zona y mantener el apoyo económico a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene is a single mother, and lives with her son who is now older and is married. Her way of moving her family forward is making traditional snack foods and chicken sandwiches to sell. She earns an income necessary to be a responsible person to her commitments. She has her business located in her house, and she works in the afternoons.

The working capital loan will be helpful in purchasing chicken, bread, condiments, yucca, potatoes, corn, firewood, and other materials needed to prepare her sale of snack foods and chicken sandwiches. Her goal is to increase productivity in her business in order to serve new customers and increase her earnings. Her dreams are to have a more competitive business in the area and maintain the financial support of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, bread, condiments, yucca, potatoes, corn, firewood, and other materials needed to prepare her sale of snack foods and chicken sandwiches.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juvy has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of gasoline to sell to her customers.

Juvy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of gasoline to sell to customers.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 6.  She engages in a hog-raising business. She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for six years now.  Aside from hog raising, she also has a food vending business for supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and ingredients for food vending. With these, she will be able to improve her current sources of income. Thus, she can now expand her food vending business and settle her obligations. 

Perla will now be able to prepare healthy diets and provide better shelter to live.

In the future, she hopes that both of her businesses will improve so she can continue to support her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 46 years old, married and has five children to support. To earn a living and be able to provide her children's daily needs, she is engaged in coconut production. She aims to increase her family income and to achieve this, she must double her coconut harvest. That's why she decided to borrow a loan to pay for labor costs to harvest the coconuts.

Rosemarie plans in the future to save money from her business.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs to harvest coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs for high production and supply to gain more income gain.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr: Mamou est la femme qui a la corde  du mouton en mains sur la photo. Mamou est âgée de 44ans  mère de 3 enfants. Elle réside au mali avec sa famille. Mamou est emboucheuse de moutons il y’a 7ans de cela. Parmi ses enfants 1 est  à  l’école. Mamou achète ses moutons  au marché hebdomadaire d'un village environnant pour  les traiter et  les nourrir, et après quelques mois elle les revend  au même marché. Les autres membres du groupe font la même activité  d’embouche. Le groupe de caisse communautaire a fait recourt aux services de R.M.C.R  pour une bonne progression de l’activité d’embouche.  Mamou  a demandé  de l’argent pour  acheter plus de moutons et fréquenter plus de marché. Elle rêve dans son activité une amélioration de nourriture en famille et acheter des bœufs pour l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mamou is the one holding the lamb's rope in the photo. Mamou is 44 years old and has four children. She lives in Mali with her family. Mamou has been raising sheep for seven years. One of her children goes to school. Mamou buys her sheep at the weekly market in a nearby village, takes care of them and feeds them and a few months later resells them at the same marekt. The other members of her group also raise livestock. 

This community savings group has reached out to RMCR in order to develop their livestock businesses. Mamou has requested funds in order to buy more sheep and come to the market more often. Her goal is to improve her family's nutrition and also buy cattle to provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and later resale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Etant veuve, Adjoa est âgée de 52  ans et habite avec ses deux enfants dans le quartier de Tokoin. Adjoa vend de la boisson dans une boutique pour avoir son économie. Grâce  ce commerce Adjoa trouve le bénéfice nécessaire afin de subvenir aux charges de la famille. Adjoa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Adjoa demande ce prêt pour commander des cartons de boissons. Grâce au bénéfice, Adjoa souhaite favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjoa is a 52-year old widow who lives with her two children in the Tokoin neighborhood. Adjoa makes a living selling beverages in a store. Thanks to this business she earns an income allowing her to support her family. Adjoa stocks up from suppliers three times a month. Adjoa is requesting this loan to buy cases of beverages. Thanks to her revenues, Adjoa would like to give priority to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy three cases of beverages.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana, 43, is married to Joseph and has three children. She has been a farmer for the last thirteen years, harvesting enough for both her family to eat and customers to buy. She currently earns approximately 10,000 KES a month.

Hana has applied for a 25,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for her farmland. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. She works to maintain financial stability and hopes to enlarge her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas de 14 y 22 años, y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, fuere, luchadora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad, que es aquella parte que se encuentra junto a la ciudad pero que está fuera de la ciudad, es decir fuera de aquella unidad económica social o cultural que define la ciudad, la gente del suburbio vive, se organiza, construye sus casas, abre sus calles, construye sus escuelas, atiende sus dolencias y se muere, al margen del Estado, de su normativa e instituciones.
Yolanda es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste blusa celeste a rayas blancas y negras con pantalón guindo). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer asalariado y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela y en la universidad y le ayudan en el negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su deseo por mejorar sus ingresos la llevó a formar una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio y poder pagar los gastos escolares de último año de su hija menor. Las personas de la banca desarrollan actividades como; tejido de chompas de lana, venta de medicinas naturales, agricultura, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, librería y recarga de baterías de auto, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; azúcar, pan, arroz, fideo, aceite, agua, refrescos, galletas, golosinas, y otros, actividad que realiza en su tienda de barrio ubicada en su domicilio, durante la semana en horas del día. Paralelamente a su tienda, también tiene una segunda actividad que es la de modista; se encarga de realizar ajustes te tamaño y ancho principalmente a vestidos de niña, también confecciona a pedido, “mis hijas me ayudan a atender la tienda cuando tengo pedidos de confección…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la familia colabora en la venta, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir la tienda y abastecerla. Su sueño es mejorar ambas actividades y volverlas más rentables, ella desea realizar la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para surtir y abastecer su tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Yolanda solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de graduación de la escuela de su hija.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 44-year-old married woman. She has two daughters who are 14 and 22, and her business is a neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, strong, tenacious, persevering, and very hard-working. She carries out her business in the southern area of the city, which is next to the city but outside of it. That is, it is outside of the economic, social, or cultural unit that defines the city. The suburb's residents live, organize themselves, build their houses, open their streets, build their schools, deal with their struggles, and die on the margins of the government and its regulations and institutions.

Yolanda is tan with dark eyes and uses eye glasses. She has short dark hair, short stature, and medium build. Her mother language is Quechua, which is spoken in the area, and she speaks Spanish in everyday life and in her business. (She is in the center, wearing a sky blue shirt with black and white stripes and maroon pants.)

She shares her life with her husband, who works as a non-salaried chauffeur, and with her daughters, who are in school and in college and help her with the business. They live in a house they own, made of brink and cement with a corrugated metal roof and cement floor. It has electricity and drinking water with plumbing.

Her desire to improve her income impelled her to join a communal bank to request a loan, in order to stock her business and be able to pay her younger daughter's last year of school expenses.

The members of the communal bank work in areas such as sewing wool shirts, selling natural medicine, farming, selling food, selling second-hand clothes, a bookstore, and recharging car batteries. She makes her living by selling food and basic necessities such as sugar, bread, rice, noodles, oil, water, soda, cookies, sweets, and others. She sells from her neighborhood shop located in her home, on weekdays during the daytime hours.

Alongside her store, she has a second occupation as a seamstress. She makes adjustments in size and width, mainly to girls' dresses, and she also makes clothing to order. "My daughters help me take care of the store when I have clothing orders," she says. The advantage of her business is that the family collaborates on sales; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock the store. Her dream is to better both businesses and make them more profitable.

She wants to purchase food and basic necessities to stock her store. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the 15 years that she has in both businesses.

For these reasons, Yolanda is requesting a loan to stock her neighborhood store and use the income to pay her daughter's school graduation fees

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood store and use the income to pay her daughter's school graduation fees

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a comercializar ganado y a trabajar en la agricultura; está acompañado, vive junto a su compañera de vida, no tienen hijos ni familiares en el extranjero; cuenta con su negocio desde hace 8 años, el oficio lo heredo de su familia y lo perfecciono con ayuda de amistades, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.
Invertirá en ganado, para engordarlo y venderlo a mejores precios, la finalidad de la compra es fortalecer su negocio, incrementar los ingresos para cancelar su deuda y reducir las necesidades familiares.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio en el mercado para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos works selling cattle and working in agriculture. He is married and lives together with his life partner. They do not have children or family abroad. He has had his business for the last 8 years. He inherited the profession from his family and perfected it with the help of friendships. He does not have an established work schedule.

He will invest in cattle in order to fatten it and sell it at better prices. The purpose of the purchase is to strengthen his business, increase his income to settle his debt, and reduce his family’s needs.

His dream is to maintain his business in the market in order to cover the basic needs of his household.

loans.use: to invest in cattle in order to fatten it and sell it at better prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
This is Maribeth. Every week, she joins a group of people who study the word of God. Here, she is inspired and encouraged to live with hope and joy. She and her husband, Teody, who is working as a construction worker, persevere and work hard for their children's lives, despite the fact that their family is not as fortunate as other families. 

As of today, Maribeth is operating a small food stall along the road. Through this small stand, they are able to support the family's basic needs, but cannot hide the fact that their income at times is still not enough. Maribeth wants to improve this so she can also develop her sales; and she asks help from you. 

She humbly wants financial support amounting to 12,000 PHP to be used to buy more products to sell and additional raw ingredients for cooking. She is really hoping that you will grant her this. 

This is now your chance to help in just a little way. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and additional raw ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes to sell in the market so as to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, cracklings, flour, oil, meat, vegetables, beverages, and other ingredients

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 32-year-old single client from Agdash region. He earns a living by working as a waiter in a small café. He has been doing this for seven years. Rashad is the only person bringing in income for his family because his parents are very old and retired. His salary is 150 AZN per month, but this isn’t enough to meet the family's expenses. 

Now Rashad requires 1,000 AZN because he needs to build a bathroom on the back patio of his home, since the one they have is in bad condition. It is more worthwhile to install a new hygiene service, since it is very important for a family home.

Rashad will use the loan to purchase materials: cement, sand, iron, blocks, a toilet, and accessories to start the work. Please support him.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Good day lenders! 

This is Emelita. She is 47 years old now and has only one child. Flinging herself into managing her current sari-sari (general) store, she is hopeful that in no time she will be able to finally get her dream house and have more businesses as well. But as of now, she is working persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household. 

Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most like a convenience store, but quite a bit smaller than the usual and offers only limited products that are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Making headway to improve her sales, Emelita would like to ask for help from you. She would like to borrow 30,000 PHP, which she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to increase her sales and provide a better remedy for her family’s daily living conditions. And, today, you can be a big part of her life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soy sauce, noodles, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, and seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs to increase her production.

loans.name: Surayohon

texts.en:
Surayohon is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is single and lives with her parents. 

Surayohon is a tailor. She sews traditional Tajik women’s dresses. She attracts customers with her beautiful designs and fashionable dresses. She started this business at home, but recently she has opened a tailoring salon where she gets orders and sews with other tailors. She already has regular clients.

The upcoming season is the best time to have a large number of orders. Surayohon wants to work hard in order to have income to live and to help her parents. She wants to buy the necessary things for her business, such as textiles, thread and needles for sewing. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to buy a new sewing machine in order to continue her activity. She wishes to be supported and awaits the compassion of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to continue her business activity.

loans.name: Nbuibe

texts.fr: Nbuibe est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans et habite dans le quartier de Tokoin.  Nbuibe travaille courageusement pour assurer les charges quotidiennes de ses cinq enfants. Pour répondre aux besoins, Nbuibe vend des produits d’alimentation en se promenant  pour avoir le revenu nécessaire. Nbuibe désire ce crédit pour commander des cartons de spaghettis, des cartons de tomates et des cubes qui vont permettre d’élargir son commerce et tirer assez de bénéfice.
texts.en: Nbuibe is a 45 year old married woman living in the Tokoin district. She works hard to meet the daily living expenses of her five children. In order to meet their needs, Nbuibe generates the necessary income as a mobile seller of food products. Nbuibe is requesting this credit to order boxes of spaghetti, tomatoes and stock cubes - this will allow her to grow her business and to generate sufficient profit.

loans.use: to buy seven boxes of spaghetti, ten boxes of tomatoes and ten boxes of cubes.

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 40-year-old rural woman from Falakata. She is married and a mother of two sons. She is a woman who is illiterate but can sign her name.  

Her husband, Dulal, is a farmer, one son runs a small carpentry business, and the other is a student of grade 11. Though being a housewife and a lovely mother, Anjana has her own business of selling cow milk in her neighborhood and to local villagers. She adds the major portion of income to her family. 

Extremely diligent with her finances, Anjana saves a small portion of her income towards building a financially stable future for her family. Hoping to make larger profits and better living conditions for her family, Anjana wants to grow her business. She wants to buy one more dairy cow to cater to more customers. The capital she needs to make this happen is her main crisis. 

She has applied for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to buy a dairy cow and thereby expand her milk-selling business. Anjana is hopeful that the loan will provide her more income to fulfill her dream of constructing a concrete house for them. In the future, her aim is to buy more dairy cows with the outcome of profit from her business.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Sena

texts.fr: Sena est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans et mère de deux enfants. Sena vit à Tokoin pour entreprendre son activité. Sena vend des charbons de bois dans son quartier  pour avoir son revenu. Sena s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Sena demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Sena is a 35 year old married woman, and the mother of two children. Sena lives and works in Tokoin. She sells charcoal in her local neighbourhood in order to earn her income. She buys her supplies five times a month at the market. Sena is requesting this loan in order to buy sacks of charcoal and to generate profit; thus she will help her husband to cover the family's living expenses and to allow the children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Abla est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Abla habite à Tokoin et vend des cures dent en bois pour réaliser son revenu quotidien. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois dans le mois au marché. Abla souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Abla  demande ce crédit pour commander des troncs de bois destinés à la vente afin d’avoir une marge de bénéfice pour couvrir les charges régulières.
texts.en:
48 years old, Abla is a married mother of two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells wooden toothpicks to make her daily income. Abla buys her supplies twice a month in the market. She wants to be able to meet the demand from her customers who gain satisfaction from her business.
Abla is requesting this loan to order tree trunks destined for resale, in order to have a profit margin that will cover her ongoing expenses

loans.use: to buy three tree trunks.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Nieves continúa con su negocio de venta de juguetes. El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de juguetes para la venta en las fiestas de fin de año. Su negocio tuvo buenos ingresos con lo que pudo pagar los gastos de su familia (la primera de la izquierda, viste de forma tradicional). En esta oportunidad la banca que lidera está compuesta por personas con negocios como; venta de mandiles, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de polleras, venta de ropa para niños, venta de medicamentos naturales, panadería, confección de tejidos y artesanía en yeso, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. “continúo con la venta de juguetes, mi familia vive de esta actividad y tenemos la esperanza de seguir mejorando en el negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, y desea realizar la compra por mayor de juguetes surtidos para continuar con su negocio y alimentar a su familia. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nieves solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes surtidos por mayor para continuar con su negocio y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nieves continues her business selling toys. The previous loan was invested in the purchase of toys for sale during the end of year holidays. Her business generated good income so that she could pay for her family's expenses (she is the first on the left, dressed in traditional fashion). This time the bank, which is composed of people in the following businesses: selling aprons, selling secondhand clothes, selling skirts, selling children's clothing sale, selling of natural medicines, a bakery, and production of textiles and plaster handicrafts, is requesting a loan to improve their businesses. 

She says "I continue selling toys. My family lives from this business and we hope to keep improving it". The advantage of her business is that sales are continuous, and the disadvantage is the lack of investment capital. Her dream is to have a stable business, and she wants to purchase assorted wholesale toys to continue her business and feed her family. This is the fourth loan with the institution in eight years that she has been engaged in this business.

It is for these reasons that Nevis is requesting a loan to purchase assorted wholesale toys to continue her business and pay for her children's school fees with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase assorted wholesale toys to continue her business and pay her children's school fees with the profits.

loans.name: Patassoue

texts.fr: Patassoue est agée de 44 ans et vit à Tokoin. Patassoue a trois enfants à sa charge et vend des charbons de bois et du maïs dans les marchés et dans son quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire. Patassoue s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Patassoue veut commander des sacs de charbon de bois et demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le profit nécessaire pour leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Patassoue is 44 years old and lives in Tokoin. She has three dependent children. She sells charcoal and corn in the market and her neighborhood in order to make the income she needs. 

Patassoue buys her supplies four times a month in the market. She wants to order bags of charcoal. She is asking for this loan so that she can make her purchase and have the profit necessarily for her children to thrive.

loans.use: buy three bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita is a married woman who is 42 years old. She received an education up to grade 10. She lives with her husband, Shyilen, and one daughter at their own small house in a small village of Falakata. Her daughter reads in class 5. 

Sumita’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Sumita also helps her husband in this business. Now they are thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and that is an all season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy (rice) on their farmland. Having inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Sumita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), and the requested loan is very important for Sumita to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for paddy cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work, and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business, as the crop has tremendous demand in the market. She dreams to expand their agribusiness.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of two sons. She is from a rural village, Babupara in Alipurduar. Both of her sons are students. She is illiterate and can sign her name only.

Rekha's husband is a driver by profession. His income is inconsistent. To help her family financially, she started her business of selling clothing, mainly saris. Saris are garments consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India. For additional income, she sells many kinds of garments like petticoats, cut pieces of salwar suits and night dresses in accordance with the customer demand. Her main customers are her neighbors, friends and relatives. 

She is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy different varieties of saris and other varieties of clothing from the wholesale market to increase her collection of stock. Her goal is the fulfillment of the demand of her customers. 

With this loan, she hopes she will play an important role by giving financial support to her family. She expects a large profit from this business and a boost in her earnings so that she can purchase new land to build her own concrete house for her family’s comfort.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase wide varieties of clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 20-year-old, single man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Yousef is a student in a local university, where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future.

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay university fees for the coming semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees for the coming semester

loans.name: Leena

texts.en: Leena is a single lady living in Mafraq. She is a university student majoring in special education. She chose this major because she wants to help those with special education needs; she believes that those people need a lot of things that she can give to them. Her father has died and her mother stays at home to care for the children, so Lenna needs the loan to pay for her semester. Leena wants to finish studying so that she can find a full-time job to help her mom support her sibling’s education.

loans.use: to pay for her semester at university

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a 29-year-old married woman from Deir El Balah city. She lives with her husband and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income.

Hadeel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. This will enable her to provide hot water without using electricity.

Hadeel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Bishakha is a rural housewife who resides in a small village called Boro Shoulmari in Falakata with her husband and two children. In her childhood, she was deprived of an education due to the poor economic resources of her family. She can only sign her name. Due to poverty, she was unable to provide an education to her children. Her daughter is married and her son is engaged in small work.

Bishakha's husband is a farmer by profession. He has been associated with cultivation for many years. So, he has acquired lots of experience in farming. Bishakha also assists her husband in the field work. Earlier, they used to grow different types of vegetables and crops in different seasons. But now they thought of growing maize on their farm land. These days, maize is in a lot of demand in markets because of its nutritious value. So, they want to cultivate maize and sell it directly to the village market. Due to the lack of capital, they cannot start this maize cultivation. For that reason, Bishakha applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, pesticides, etc. to cultivate maize. 

She hopes this will enable her to ensure the financial stability of their family so that she can fulfill her long cherished dream of building a concrete house for her family’s well-being.

Bishakha thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, pesticides and other agricultural supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and fruits for selling in hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is a very energetic young woman of 28 years from Falakata, a town located in Alipurduar district. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is now married to Rajkumar and the mother of two sons. Her sons read in grade two and one, respectively, in the local village school. 

Sima's husband is a fish vender who sells fish in the market. Sima is a hardworking, responsible lady with a great desire for her personal as well her family's success. She runs a small grocery store.  She sells food products and grocery items in her shop such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, detergent, chips etc. Her neighbors are her main customers. 

Now she aims to extend her business to obtain a better income, and thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  The objective for her loan is to invest in buying more grocery items so she can give financial sustenance to her family.

Sima is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her existing grocery store.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is 38 years old. She is married with four children between 12 and 21 years old. They all go to school and one of them is in higher education in INILAK. She sells construction materials and she has been doing this business for the past four years. Her husband is a businessman too. She is requesting a loan to pay for school fees and she would like to pay in installments. After paying school fees, she plans to save more from the same business.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Here is Leonida. She didn't complete her studies. She only attained a high school education and though she wants to continue this, her age seems not to fit anymore. She is already 46 years old, living at Las Piñas City, Philippines and is married to Jesus. They have three kids by now, only one left studying. To support her child, she busies herself by managing her small sari-sari store, (a variety store) where she gains a not-so-high profit. 

Leonida wants you to know that she wants to expand her business. But she doesn't have enough capital. She wants to provide grocery items for her store in large quantities and that's why she would like to ask for a PHP 50,000 loan from you. Hoping a lot that you'd consider, Leonida plans to save from the profit she will gain from the expansion. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to provide grocery items for her store in large quantities

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en: Sayohat is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a remote district with her family. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a cleaning woman at an organization. Her job is not good for her health as she gets exposed to the cold frequently. She has a kidney infection and she needs to be treated. She wants to find another job, but there are limited opportunities and time. She is requesting a loan from KIVA and IMON to be treated at a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at a medical clinic

loans.name: Yobes

texts.en: Yobes is 44 years old, married and supports five children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for eight years now. He will be using the loan to buy a dairy cow and hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell and make more income to provide for the needs of his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay the loan. His future hopes are to improve his dairy farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow. He hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell and make more income to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new thyme seedlings

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Jennifer owns and operates a food stall today. She has been successful in operating the business for many years and she repaid her previous loan faithfully. From this inventory, she is able to support her household's basic expenses. 

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and other raw ingredients in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes. She is hopeful that you'll be able to help her with this. 

Priscila hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future and being able to send her kids to college and finish their courses. 

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and other raw ingredients in larger quantities

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
For ten years now, it has been Rosemarie's business to sell different kinds of personal products. And for these years, she was able to support her husband, Renato in making a living for their entire household. Her husband works abroad. Leaving their two children with her, she can't do anything else but to take care her family and pray for the safety of her husband from afar. 

In her direct-selling business, she sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers' order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers take as their income. 

Rosemarie wants to further expand her inventory. With this, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 35,000 that she would add to her capital for buying more merchandise to sell. 

She hopes that you'll respond affirmatively with her request. She's doing this for the dream to someday succeed and send her children to college, supporting them until they finish college. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add up in her capital for buying more merchandise products to sell.

loans.name: Nomawabo

texts.en:
Nomawabo is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I’m studying a Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration. I enjoy the business subjects, like Human Resources, Finance and Marketing Management.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
I would like to start my own company. I am interested in construction and building projects. Any city would be fine because I love traveling.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born in the Eastern Cape. I have siblings. My parents are both unemployed and they both get social grants to live on. I am married and I have three children. I am a young lady of 34 years old; I am capable of fulfilling my dreams to chase my goals.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
In my spare time like weekends and holidays I am catering for small events and selling some stuff to my community.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
In terms of transport it will definitely change my situation because there are times when I don’t come to school because I can’t afford the taxi fare, especially since my husband lost his job.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mlimani Group Msm

texts.en:
John, a businessman in furniture for five years, is married and has kids who are in school. He is 37 years old, and as father and son from his parent's side, works hard to see both sides gets better everyday.
