He makes furniture of different types (chairs, tables and sofa-sets) and sells to neighbors and passerby customers. John works from 7am to 6pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is John's fifth credit request to be apportioned among Mlimani, the two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous loans to buy more wood, nails and other required furniture-making materials. He is doing great and shows good improvement. He has paid back the previous loans successfully. John managed to receive a profit, which he used to cover family needs, particularly school fees for his kids. He dreams of improving his business together with introducing a new one. 

With this credit, he will invest in furniture-making equipment (woods, nails and other requirements).

loans.use: to buy furniture-making equipment (wood, nails and other requirements)

loans.name: Evidel Alexander

texts.es:
Evidel, se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 5 años, aprendió el oficio de sus padres que también son agricultores y crían ganado, su negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su familia y una ONG, que le presto capital sin intereses y además lo capacito en el área. Vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y un hijo, tiene más de 20 años de residir en su comunidad.
Buscando mantener su negocio ha decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar vacas lecheras para que le den nuevas crías y así aumentar su inventario, espera que satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos para pagar la deuda adquirida.
Sus sueños son tener una ganadería más grande y mejor equipada para ir cambiando su situación económica y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Evidel has been making a living raising cattle for five years. He learned this trade from his parents, who were both farmers and cattle-raisers. Evidel started his business with the help of his family, and an NGO that provided him with an interest-free loan and training. Evidel lives in a house that he owns with his partner and one son. Evidel has been living in the same place for 20 years.

In order to keep his business going, Evidel has decided to apply for a loan so that he can buy dairy cows to breed and increase stock. Evidel hopes to satisfy customer demand and increase his income in order to pay off his debt.

Evidel’s dreams are to have a larger and better equipped ranch so that he can improve his financial situation and move forward with his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to breed and increase stock.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ciudad Real Group

texts.es: Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “CIUDAD REAL”. Un grupo conformado por 5 personas emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Uno de ellos es el Sr. Julián de 61 años de edad y con 3 hijos, el Sr. Julián  es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor que a base  de su esfuerzo ha sabido superarse y sacar a su familia adelante, el Sr.  Julián trabaja ya hace 17 años como moto taxista (una moto modificada para transportar una cantidad de personas), el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para él y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá para el mantenimiento de su moto y así  poder  apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. El Sr. Julián es la segunda persona de la mano derecha se  le distingue por el pantalón plomo y una chompa de color negro, es la  única persona que usa gorra de color negra. A la vez  el Sr. Julián y todos los integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado y se  despiden  dejando la promesa  que cumplirán todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This is the “Ciudad Real” group, which has five enterprising and creative members.

One member is 61-year-old Julián, who has three children. Julián is very hard-working and enterprising and, as a result of his efforts, he has progressed in life and helped his family to do the same. For 17 years, Julián has been working driving a motorcycle taxi, his and his family’s only source of income.

Julián will use this loan to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle, thereby enabling him to support his children’s education.

In the photo, Julián is second from the right; he is wearing grey trousers and a dark top.

Julián and the other members of “Ciudad Real” are grateful to Kiva for this loan, and for the trust put in them. They promise to achieve all of their goals.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of a motorcycle.

loans.name: Martha Estefani

texts.es:
Martha, tiene una venta de tortillas, habita en una casa propiedad de un familiar, comparte su vida con su compañero de vida y tres hijos, dos ya estudian preparatoria, su pareja trabaja como empleado de una tienda de productos comestibles. Abrió la tortillería hace aproximadamente un año, su madre la inculco el oficio cuando le solicitaba su colaboración en el negocio de la familia, cuando formo su hogar puso en práctica su experiencia para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
Comprará maíz al por mayor para abastecer su negocio a bajo precio, ya que actualmente lo está comprando por quintales y le genera más costos, espera aumentar la producción de tortillas para atender a más clientes y seguir teniendo su negocio en el mercado.
Sus objetivos son cancelar con buena calificación crediticia el préstamo y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha has a stall where she sells tortillas. She lives in a house owned by a relative and shares her life with her partner and three children, two of whom are now in kindergarten. Martha’s partner works at a shop. Martha opened her tortilla shop around one year ago. Martha learned the trade working with her mother at the family business. When she started her own family, Martha decided to use her experience in order to support her husband with family expenses.

Martha will use this loan to buy corn in bulk to stock up her business for a low cost. She currently buys corn by the hundredweight, which is more expensive. Marta hopes to increase tortilla production in order to serve more customers and keep her business going.

Martha’s goals are to pay off her debt and have a good credit rating, and to move forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk to stock up her business for a low cost.

loans.name: Laura Melissa

texts.es: Laura de 20 años es una emprendedora mujer que inició su negocio de venta de comidas en el año 2014, durante varios años fue ayudante de cocina en el negocio de su suegra, experiencia que le permitió independizarse y buscar nuevos horizontes.  Día a día prepara comida típica de la Región Caribe como sancochos, carnes, legumbres guisadas, ensaladas y refrescos, los cuales comercializa de lunes a viernes al medio día.  Su éxito ha sido tal que sus comensales no la cambian por nada en su gran mayoría son obreros de construcciones aledañas a su vivienda ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en víveres como aceite, arroz, legumbres, carnes y frutas.  Esta inversión es muy importante porque al surtirse de víveres le permite variar su carta de comidas  y abastecer a las demandas de sus clientes.  Laura es madre de un hijo a quien desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida brindándole una vivienda estable, por ello su meta es comprar una casa y adquirir un local.
texts.en:
Laura, 20 years old, is a female entrepreneur who started her business of selling food in 2014. For many years, she worked as a kitchen assistant in her mother-in-law's business. This experience allowed her to become independent and pursue new aspirations. Every day she prepares typical Caribbean food like Sancocho, meat, stewed legumes, salads and refreshments, which she sells Mondays to Fridays at midday. She has been so successful that her guests do not want to eat anywhere else. For the most part, they are workers from construction sites adjacent to her house in a neighborhood of Barranquilla.

Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in food supplies such as oil, rice, legumes, meat and fruit. This investment is very important because stocking up on supplies will allow her to bring more variety into her menu and satisfy the demands of her customers. Laura is the mother of one child. She wishes to offer it a better quality of life by providing it with a stable housing situation. This is why her goal is to buy a house, as well as premises for her business.

loans.use: to invest in food supplies such as oil, rice, legumes, meat and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, iron, stones, windows and doors in order to build a wall.

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

texts.es:
Silvia, nuevamente está solicitando un crédito que utilizara para comprar gallinas, vitaminas, y concentrado, le permitirá engordar las aves de corral, aumentar la producción de huevos, también podrá venderlas aliñadas y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
Al tener oportunidad de invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, ha tenido una experiencia satisfactoria, ya que tiene nuevos clientes, sus ingresos son más estables y puede compartir un estilo de vida más digno con su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is applying for another loan in order to buy hens, vitamins and feed, allowing her to fatten up her poultry and increase egg production. She will also be able to sell the hens in order to meet customers’ demands.

Silvia has a positive experience with her first loan: she has more customers, her income is more stable, and she can now enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy hens, vitamins and feed, allowing her to fatten up her poultry.

loans.name: Cristela Jeanneth

texts.es:
Cristela, está motiva a seguir trabajando con créditos por los buenos resultados que estos le dan, en esta oportunidad el capital que solicita lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar semilla de maíz y frijol, espera que sus cultivos tengan un desarrollo favorable.
Cristela administro muy bien el crédito anterior por lo que sus cosechas han sido suficientes para tener alimento para su familia y para vender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristela is motivated to continue working with loans because of the good results that she has had with them. On this occasion, Cristeral is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies to grow corn and beans; Cristela hopes that her crops will grow well.

Cristela managed her last loan very well. As a result, she had enough crops to feed her family and to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn and beans; Cristela hopes that her crops will grow well.

loans.name: Florenia

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! 

Florenia sends her utmost gratitude for the financial support that you allowed her, and which indeed helped her in her junk shop business. Aside from this, she also gets income from her small sari-sari store, which she aims to improve as well. 

The problem is, however, that she doesn't have a full capacity to have enough capital to do so. Therefore she is asking to take out a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell. The main reason behind this expansion is that she wants to earn more profit, as it will surely help and support her family in their daily expenses. 

She really hopes for your helping hands. 

Florenia dreams of being successful in the years to come. At the same time, she dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies as well. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es: El Grupo ¨La Familia¨, esta con formado por 3 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras. Coordinado por Dolores, de 38 años, soltera y dueña de una pulperia en su hogar, ella mantiene este negocio desde hace 10 años, ya que su mama se lo dejo de herencia. Tiene 23 ciclos con ADIM, demostrando ser una persona responsable con el pago de las cuotas. Ahora solicita crédito para invertirlo en compra de granos básicos, como arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, frutas. Anteriormente con el crédito pudo abastecer de productos su tienda y eso trae consigo mas ingresos para la familia.Las otras socias son Lorenza, de 58 años, dedicada a la venta de papel. Rosa de 45 años vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
The communal bank group called "La Familia" is comprised of three determined, enterprising women.  Dolores, 38, is the coordinator and has been running a grocery store at home for ten years, which she inherited from her mother.  She has worked with ADIM for 23 cycles and proven herself to be responsible in paying back her loans.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy staple goods such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, toilet paper and fruit.  She used the previous loan to stock her store which increased her income for the family.  

The other group members are Lorenza, 58, who sells paper and Rosa, 45, who sells used clothing.

loans.use: To buy staple goods such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, toilet paper and fruit.

loans.name: Claudia Francisca

texts.es:
Claudia, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, junto a su esposo trabajan para cubrir los gastos familiares, ella es propietaria de una tienda de consumo, trabaja todos los días con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, no cuenta con inconvenientes para seguir trabajando.
Con el crédito podrá comprar papel higiénico, jabón, detergente, shampoo, granos básicos, etc., para comercializar nuevos productos y que sus clientes necesitan, espera lograr tener estabilidad económica y tener clientes satisfechos.
Sus aspiraciones son tener utilidades a corto plazo con la ayuda de créditos de igual manera salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia lives with her husband and children, and both she and her husband share the household expenses.  She is the owner of a store where she works daily from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., with no inconveniences when it comes to continuing her work.

Claudia will use the loan to buy toilet paper, soap, detergent, shampoo, staple goods, etc., to sell new products as requested by her customers.  She hopes to achieve economic stability and keep her customers satisfied.

Her short-term goal through the loan is to earn more profit and get ahead together with her family.

loans.use: To buy toilet paper, soap, detergent, shampoo, stable goods, etc. to sell new products as requested by customers.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha mantenido la tienda de artículos varios funcionado y mejorado la ganadería, la familia se mantiene y todos tienen la oportunidad de una mejor vida.
Se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para atender las nuevas demandas de sus clientes, comprara maíz, frijol, arroz, bebidas, boquitas, etc., para ofrecer un inventario surtido.
texts.en:
With the help of her previous loan, Maria has kept her general store running and improved her livestock.  Her family is thriving and everyone has the opportunity to enjoy a better lifestyle.

She has decided to request a new loan to meet the new demands of her customers.  She will buy corn, beans, rice, beverages, snacks, etc. to offer a wider variety of products.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, beverages, snacks, etc. to offer a wider variety of products.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural,una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos y para mejoramiento de infraestructura donde cría sus animales. Con esto Sebastiana espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana, 36, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in the district of Oyotun in a rural community which works in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc. and her business is set up at home.  She has ten years' experience in this activity and has very good personal and work references in the area.  The loan she is requesting is to buy more animals, including hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, etc. and balanced animal feed to improve her business infrastructure.

Sebastiana hopes to improve her product and earn more income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed to improve her business infrastructure.

loans.name: Ntlokholo

texts.en:
Ntlokholo is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute, and she was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story:

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most? 
I am studying a Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration, and I enjoy  Financial Management the most.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? 
After graduating, I would like to work as a financial advisor in a big company in the Free State (another province in South Africa) so that I can help my family or support them. I would also like to have my own organization where I will be helping orphans and vulnerable children, as I know what it feels like to live without parents and to live in poverty.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?  
I was born in Pimville in Soweto into a family of five. I have three sisters and one young brother. I am the third born in my family. I am staying with my aunt because I lost both my parents when I was five, so my guardian had to take care of us. We are staying at her place with her two children, both girls. My aunt is a domestic worker and she is the only breadwinner in the family. We are all in school.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like to read and write most of the time, when I am not busy.

5.	How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 
A Kiva loan will bring a lot of changes in my life because I am going to be able to pay attention to my studies. This is because sometimes, when I don’t have money for transport, I am unable to come to school every day because I struggle with transport money. It will therefore positively affect my studies.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Velile

texts.en:
Velile is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute, and she was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story:

1. What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most? 
I am studying a Bachelor of Art in Business Administration degree. I enjoy Marketing and Human Resources.

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goals are to be able to support my family and to be independent. I would prefer to work in the corporate sector where I will be able to use my skills. I would like to work in Pretoria and probably live there.

3. Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? 
I was born in Daveyton in Johannesburg, and I have four brothers and two sisters. My biological mother passed away in 2007, so I stay with my father and stepmother. 

4. What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
My father works at the correctional services and my stepmother is between jobs. I am currently single and have no children. 

5. What do you like to do in your spare time? 
I like to cook, read inspirational books, go outdoors, and visit my close family and friends.

6. How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle? Will there be significant changes?
The Kiva loan will have a huge impact in my life. It will help me to reduce my study fees and that will ease my mind, because I will worry less and will be able to study harder and be much more determined than before. My family will be at ease and stress-free because I come from a struggling family.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.en:
Gulniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970, and she lives in a remote district with her family. She is married and has five children. Her family is big, and she tries to help her husband to feed and support them.

Gulniso is busy with buying and selling grocery products. She has been trading for 2 years and knows her duties really well and how to be polite with customers. She buys from a domestic market and sells near her house at a small store. She has regular customers who are mostly her neighbors.  

She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy a new assortment of grocery products. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of grocery products

loans.name: Kouassi Pierre

texts.fr:
Mr KOUASSI PIERRE est mariée et père de 01enfant. Il est âgé de 1mois. Personne ne va à l'école et il a 02personnes en charge.
Mr est coiffeur depuis 2008. Il s'approvisionne en ville.Ses clients sont les hommes.
Il veut s'acheter 05tondeuses.
Avec ses bénéfice, il veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s'acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Kouassi Pierre is a married father to a month-old child. His child is not old enough to attend school yet and he has two people living within his care. Kouassi Pierre has worked as a hairdresser since 2008. He gets his supplies from town. He works with male clients. He wishes to purchase five hair clippers. He wants to use the profits to reinvest back into his business. His goal is to be able to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase five hair clippers

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
This 26-year-old young lady, Armine, has a higher academic education and works at a chemical laboratory as a research fellow. She lives with her father and elder brother, who from time to time lives abroad as he works for the Russian Federation. 

Armine likes her job and she is a very hardworking person. Every working day, she travels a long way from Sevan city to the capital, Yerevan, in order to reach her place of work. 

Recently she lost her lovely mother, who died after a long illness. Now Armine is asking for Kiva lenders' support for the building of her mother's gravestone.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's gravestone

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mme SALIMATA est mariée et mère de 04enfants. Le plus a âgé 30ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Les 04 vont à l'école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend pagnes depuis 25ans. Elle s'approvisionne au Mali et à Lomé.
Elle veut s'acheter 1/2 balle de pagne bazin.
Avec ses bénéfice, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s'acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Salimata is a married mother to four children. Her eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 10 years old. All four of them are currently receiving an education and she has five people living within her care. Salimata has been selling traditional pagne cloth for 25 years. She gets her supplies from Mali and Lomé. She wishes to purchase half a pack of damask pagne cloth. She wants to reinvest her profits back into her business. Her goal is to able to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase half a pack of damask pagne cloth

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). All of her children work to earn money for the family. Manju lives with her family in a small house in Falakata, West Bengal

Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates seasonal fruits and vegetables on their farmland. Manju is a homemaker and also helps her husband with the farming. They usually sell the crop in the local market. Now they decided to cultivate maize because this is a very profitable crop in their area.

Manju needs capital to invest in seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies to grow maize. So she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. Manju hopes to have a good harvest with the help of this loan and increase her monthly turnover.  This way, she can increase the profitability of her business and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life. 

She conveys her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate maize.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Oumar,est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Balandougou au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 65 ans, Oumar est le père de 10 enfants âgés de 0,5 à 39 ans, dont 9 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'amour de l'agriculture a incité Oumar à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs, le sorgho et le maraîchage sur sa parcelle de 5 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de productivité. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour évaluer la différence entre son ancien semoir et celui de myAgro. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'avancer les choses en terme de productivité. Oumar espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et faire face aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Oumar is a myAgro farmer who lives and works in the village of Balandougou to the south-west of Bamako in Mali. Oumar is the 65-year-old father to 10 children aged between six months old and 39 years old, nine of whom are currently receiving an education. A passion for agriculture was what pushed Oumar to become a farmer. He grows corn, sorghum and vegetables over his five-hectare plot of land, but he must face many difficulties as a farmer, such as a lack of productivity. This year, he wanted to purchase a drilling machine to test the difference between his old machine and myAgro's machine. Access to a drilling machine will allow him to increase his productivity. Oumar hopes that with an increase in his yield and his revenue, he'll be able to ensure his family's food sufficiency and meet their monetary needs.

loans.use: to purchase a precision drilling machine

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute, and she was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute. This is her story:

1. What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying a BA in Business Administration. The classes that I enjoy the most are CBE classes, which focus on building my inner and outer self.

2. What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My short term goal after graduating is to get a permanent job in Sasol. I would like to work as an administrator for a period of 5 years and it must be in Mpumalanga. I love travelling a lot, so being the Personal Assistant of the CEO would also be fine. My long term goal is to own a few flats and rent them. I want to be in the property business.

3. Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I am from Bushbuckridge and am from a family of five. I am the third born. I have two sisters and two brothers. My mother is currently not working, and as for my father I lost contact with him in 2008. I am a mother of three kids, 1 girl and 2 boys, who live in Mpumalanga with their dad. I am single. I grew up with my grandmother, who later died, and I had to learn how to do certain things. Through hard work, I am proud to say that I have made my grandmother proud by completing my matric, and I am now on my way to completing my degree. I have nothing today but tomorrow I’ll be someone.

4. What do you like to do in your spare time?
I love reading novels so that it can improve my English. What I am reading at the moment is 'Traitor’s Heart' by David Milan, if I am not mistaken. Either that or I go and visit my kids in Mpumalanga and spend some time with them.

5. How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
The Kiva loan will change my life in a good way - socially, emotionally and financially, because lately I have been having problems with money and that affects my studies and health as I always have thoughts and questions about how I am going to do things. With the loan, I’ll be able to cover most of the things like my fees, transport, etc.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Hanady

texts.en:
Hanady is a 19-year-old, single lady who lives in Amman with her mother and her three siblings.

Hanady's father died many years ago. He always wished to see Hanady get her bachelor degree, find good job and be a successful lady in the future. That is why she is facing all these challenges in order to achieve the dream of her father. 

Her father's pension is not enough to cover her university fees, that's why she applied for a loan to pay for her university fees so she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees so she can achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife in a small house. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will enable him to provide hot water without using electricity.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is from Irbid. He is 20 years old and single. Mohammad is studying business administration. His dad is working in a car shop and his mother is working in the students' services office. 

Lately his family faced financial problems which prevent Mohammad from paying for his university. Because of that he decided to apply for an education loan to help him pay the university fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a good job with high salary.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 33-year-old housewife and the mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She is an illiterate woman who can sign her name. All her children are students in village schools. They live in Raychenga, a village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. 

Her husband is running a tea stall in the village. The movable shop has an immense advantage in earning due to its location because tired and exhausted travelers usually come to his tea stall for a cup of tea to start off. He also tries his best to give good customer service. Jyotsna also helps her husband by making tea at the peak time, morning and evening. But the generated income from the stall is hardly sufficient for the family as she has to bear the educational expenses of her three children. They hope an investment in the business may solve this problem. 

So Jyotsna has applied for a loan from BJS, Kiva's partner to buy tea leaves, powdered milk, sugar, biscuits, tiffin cakes etc. on a large scale. This investment will increase her earnings and the number of customers they can serve. It will help her to secure a good future for her family. 

Jyotsna hopes to save enough to purchase some land in the future.

She is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for her family-run tea stall.

loans.name: Mahmmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is a 21-year-old, single man who lives in Irbid. He is studying a bachelor degree and is in his second year, majoring in class teacher. 

Mahmmoud has a problem paying his degree fees, and therefore he is applying for a loan to help him to cover his semester fees and buy school supplies.

loans.use: To cover his semester fees and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Siziphiwe

texts.en:
Siziphiwe is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story:

1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying at the Maharishi Institute; I am studying for a Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration. I enjoyed Business Law and Ethics, English classes and Leadership; these are courses that stood out for me.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? 
After graduating I would like to work in a private organization as an Human resources manager for five years then start working on my business. I want to start a property business in South Africa and yes I would like to travel and work in other countries.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children? 
I was born and raised in the Eastern Cape in a small town called Butterworth. I am the third born of 10 children; 7 girls and 3 boys. My father used to work in the mines but was retrenched in 1996 and since then he has been unemployed, as is my mother. I have never been married and don’t have children.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time? 
In my spare time I like to go out with friends to watch movies or stay indoors and read or write stories. I have always been interested in writing about my past and childhood.

5.	How will the Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 
The Kiva loan will help me a lot as I am falling behind in paying for my studies. I will also have the money for transport to go to school, so I will be able to go to school every day.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Irbid. He is 27 years old and single. Ahmad believes that having a certificate is the most important thing in life, but he could not complete his education because of the financial situation of his family. Therefore he decided to work and save money to be able to cover his education expenses himself.

Now Ahmad is working as interior designer and he is also a university student. He wants to complete his education and find a good job in addition to his business.

Lately his family has faced financial problems which prevent Ahmad from paying his university fees as he gives his money to his father to help him. Because of that he decided to apply for an education loan to help him pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees for next semester.

loans.name: Hector De Jesus

texts.es:
Héctor, está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, para sembrar maíz, espera tener todo listo para iniciar la temporada de siembra y asegurarse de tener una cosecha abundante para vender maíz en grano y en elote, así mismo tener estabilidad económica.
Para Héctor el crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar maíz, desafortunadamente perdió la cosecha por problemas de plagas, con dificultades cancelo su deuda pero este problema no le quita el deseo de seguir trabajando, mantiene el mismo grupo familiar y comenta que uno de sus hijos está enfrentando problemas de salud por lo que está teniendo más gastos.
texts.en:
Héctor needs a new loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide to plant corn. He hopes to have everything ready to start the planting season and ensure an abundant harvest to sell corn in kernel and on the cob, in order to have financial stability.  

For Hector, the previous loan helped him to acquire the necessary agricultural materials to plant corn. unfortunately, he lost the harvest due to problems with pests. With difficulty, he paid off his loan, but the problem didn't remove his desire to keep working. He supports his same family members and he says that one of his children is facing some health problems and because of that he has more expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and herbicide to plant corn. He hopes to have everything ready to start the planting season.

loans.name: Silvia Jenni

texts.es:
Silvia, de 34 años de edad, está acompañada, estudio hasta noveno grado, no siguió estudiando porque eran bastantes hermanos y los recursos no alcanzaban para todos, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela y su esposo de dedica a prestar sus servicios en la alcaldía municipal del municipio y en ocasiones trabaja en la agricultura.

Silvia, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, mientras, pero como su esposo no dispone de mucho tiempo para trabajar en la agricultura, ella se ha dedicado a la coordinación de las actividades del campo, para sembrar los granos básicos del consumo en su hogar. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, sorgo y pagar la mano de obra para cultivar los granos; con la aprobación del financiamiento tendrán la posibilidad de producir sus propios alimentos y tener un excedente para venderlos y cubrir algunas necesidades.

Silvia, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria y también quier dedicarse más a la producción agrícola, ya que disponen de terrenos para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 34 years old. She is married and went to school up to the ninth grade. She didn't continue her education because she had a lot of siblings and there weren't enough resources for everyone. She has 2 children who are in school and her husband works in the city hall and sometimes works in agriculture.

Silvia works offering domestic services, but since her husband doesn't have a lot of time to work in agriculture, she also coordinates the agricultural activities to plant the basic grains for household consumption.  

The loan she is asking for is to buy corn, bean and sorghum seed as well as to pay for the labor to plant the grains. With the approval of the loan, they will be able to produce their own food and have some left over to sell and cover some needs. 

Silvia dreams of seeing her children graduate from college and she also wants to work more in agriculture, because they have cropland.

loans.use: to buy corn, bean, and sorghum seed as well as to pay for the labor to plant the grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, bricks, iron, doors and windows to install and repair the water tank area of her home.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 32-year-old mhnhgbicro-entrepreneur. He is married and lives in a rented house in Lusaka, Zambia. He operates a mobile money business that serves the needs of his community by providing financial services. The business is Henry's only source of income.

Henry is requesting a loan to grow his business so that he can open another Zoona mobile money transfer outlet and serve more customers.He would like to let his lenders know that his past two loans have enabled him to expand from one shop to three in his town of Lusaka. He is now able to serve many more customers. This is good for customers as well as Henry because his income has increased. He explains that his personal life has improved with this business growth as.he is able to manage his home and has managed to use some of the profits from his business to furnish his house. 

Henry has fully repaid his last two loans. This loan will be used to expand his business by opening a fourth shop in Lusaka's Mandevu compound . 

He has seen the need for another shop with customer demand. Many people enjoy the service of being able to easily send and receive money. Henry would like to thank lenders for believing in him and allowing him to grow his business and improve his life through access to capital.

loans.use: To purchase a banded Zoona mobile money trading kiosk and provide the funds needed for him to serve customers at his new location

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 45 años de edad, no estudio por falta de recursos económicos, actualmente está casada, tiene 9 hijos, pero solo 4 dependen de ella.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde que tenia 14 años de edad, está actividad la aprendió de su madre; ahora se se dedica al cuidado de aves de corral en lo cual tiene 9 años de experiencia.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar 200 pollitos, 2 quintales de concentrado y vacunas para la prevención de enfermedades.

María, sueña con seguir trabajando con pollos y cerdos para llegar a tener granja grande de pollos.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and did not go to school, lacking the financial resources for it. At the moment, she is married, has nine children, only four of which still depend on her.

Maria has been taking care of household duties since she was 14 years old. She learned this from her mother. Now she earns a living in poultry, where she has nine years of experience.

Maria needs this loan to buy 200 chickens, 2 quintals of concentrate and vaccine to prevent diseases.

Maria dreams of keeping on working with chickens and pigs until she will have a big chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, 2 quintals of concentrate and vaccine to prevent diseases.

loans.name: Sonaxanim

texts.en:
Sonaxanim is 60 year old, a widow and she has a son. She has a high school education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops, which she started doing 22 years ago. Thanks to her tenacity, dedication, and hard work, she currently has two cows. She grows onions, tomatoes and potatoes to sell. 

Sonaxanim applied for a loan of 1400 azn  to buy seedlings to grow and resell.  Sonaxanim intends to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings to grow and resell, to increase her income

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 15 años inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más de frutas por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. 

She has been earning a living selling fruit for 15 years and started with her own capital. Her business is located in her house and she has many customers. She is improving her financial situation with what she makes from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more fruit at wholesale to keep on selling and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Saidtojidin

texts.en:
Saidtojidin is a resident of the city Kulob. He is 41 years old, married and a very good father. Saidtojidin is a master technician. He has been doing this activity for 16 years. His wife is a seamstress, with five years of experience in this field. She sews accurately and earns a good income. 

Not long ago, her sewing machine broken and Saidtojidin wants to buy her a new sewing machine, since currently he has no orders from his customers. They do not have any other source of income. His main challenge is lack of money. 

Saidtojidin hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for his wife, so that she may continue to sew to support the family

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children in the Sagarejo district. Ana works at local water supply company as a cashier and gets a monthly income. In addition, she owns 2 cows, which she milks every day and sells produced yogurt and cheese. 

Ana wants to start a poultry business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing chicks. Ana will raise chicks and will sell eggs and hens to increase family income. She is very hardworking woman and hopes that the business will be profitable and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to start a poultry business in order to increase income for her family

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
José Heriberto es un pequeño cafetalero de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Con 51 años de edad, es un productor apasionado por lo que hace. Junto a su esposa y 2 hijos, trabaja su pequeña finca para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

La actividad agrícola a la que se dedica fue herencia de su padre, y ahora él la transmite a sus hijos, enseñándoles el amor a la caficultura; para que sus descendientes sigan la misma actividad económica, pero de una manera más tecnificada.

Este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas, lo cual es parte del plan de mantenimiento de su cafetal. Con esta inversión logrará mejores resultados productivos y económicos para la sostenibilidad de su pequeña finca y familia.
texts.en:
José Heriberto is a small coffee plantation owner in the northern area of Nicaragua. He is 51 years old and a producer who is passionate about what he does. With his wife and 2 children, he works on his small farm to improve his living conditions. Farming is an inheritance from his father, and now he is passing it on to his children, teaching them a love of coffee so that his descendants continue with the same business but in a more technical way. 

This cycle, he is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies that help him to improve his plant's nutrition, which is part of his coffee plantation maintenance plan. With this investment, he will achieve better production and economic results for the sustainability of his small farm and his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that allow him to give proper maintenance to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana is a 25-years-old married woman from Bethlehem City. She is married, has a small daughter and her husband is a worker where he gets a low income. Maryana works as an employee in a hotel. She also makes decorations for wedding parties.

Maryana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more raw materials for her business. She is predicting a high demand because the summer season is wedding season.

Maryana appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her wedding party decorations business.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 36 year old, married and has 2 children. Kamala is an IDP (internally displaced person). She is involved in animal husbandry and loves animals and takes good care of them. She is also involved in agriculture. Kamala is very happy to be able to help her family, who do not have a good source of income. 

She wants to increase her livestock headcount and make a good income. Although she has a small capital, she is missing 1200 AZN to buy livestock. She hopes to be able to achieve her goals thanks to your support.

loans.use: to increase her livestock herd for better income

loans.name: Behruzjon

texts.ru: Бехрузчон городской парень. Он из города Душанбе. Бехрузчон самостоятельный, шустрый, умный и активный парень. Он живет вместе отцом, матерью и сестренками. Мама и сестры  домохозяйка. Бехрузчон сейчас сам зарабатывает и помогает папе обеспечить семью. Его отец занимался резчиком. У него был мечта, изучать Бехрузчона на свою профессию. Бехрузчон вырос и стал мужчиной, и он сейчас идет по стопам отца. Его отец сейчас на пенсии. У Бехрузчон есть ученики, и он сам управляет цех по производства сундука. Он производит сундук на заказ. У него есть постоянные клиенты, и они постепенно вырастают. Бехрузчон хочет купить и запасать дрова для производства сундука, потому что сейчас сезон свадьбы и заказы будет больше. Он  с такими планами обратился к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en: Behruzjon is a city guy. He is from the city of Dushanbe. Behruzjon is an independent, agile, clever and active guy. He lives together with his father, mother and little sisters. His mother and sisters are home-makers. Currently Behruzjon earns money himself and helps his father to provide for the family. His father was a wood carver. He had a dream to teach Behruzjon his profession. Behruzjon grew up and became a man, and now he is following in his father's footsteps. His father is now retired. Behruzjon has apprentices, and he runs a workshop that produces chests. He makes chests to order. He has regular clients and they are gradually growing. Behruzjon wants to buy and store wood for making the chests because now it is wedding season and there will be more orders. With such plans he has turned to you for a loan.

loans.use: to buy and store wood for making chests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Life may not be so easy as it seems, but when you have hope, nothing would be impossible. That's what Nena believes and she's thankful that you let her borrow an amount that helped her a lot in her food stall business. Because of that, she was able to increase her profit in such a way that she was able to supply her family with their basic needs at home.

She would like to access again another loan that she would use to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling. A PHP 50,000 loan is enough to cater these. She really hopes that you'll entrust her again this time. You know that the main reason why she does persevere in her business is to provide and invest for her family a better future. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy enough raw ingredients for her food stall business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 30 years old and married with one child. Liezel works very hard to provide for them.

Liezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Liezel has been in this business for 4 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 49 years old and married with six children.

Merlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, home product care and other groceries.

Merlita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Aracely Maricelda

texts.es:
Aracely, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y en la crianza de ganado y tiene un hijo de ocho meses de nacido.

Aracely, se dedica a cuidar a su hijo y a los oficios del hogar, pero por las mañanas ordeña una vaca, mientras su esposo va a trabajar, todo lo aprendió de sus padres ya que sus padres también lo hacían.

Aracely, necesita el crédito para comprar otra vaca lechera, porque la que tiene ya no le produce mucha leche y esto le generara mayores ingresos, ya que la leche la procesa y vende cuajada.

Su sueño es tener un buen establo para tener muchas vacas lecheras, para incrementar su producción de lácteos.
texts.en:
Aracely is 31 years old. She only went to school until the sixth grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture and raising livestock. They have an 8 month old baby. Aracely is dedicated to taking care of her son and household chores, but in the mornings she milks a cow while her husband works. She learned everything from her parents because her parents also did it. 

She needs a loan to buy another dairy cow because the one that she has does not produce a lot of milk and having another one would get better earnings since she processes the milk and sells it curdled. Her dream is to have a good barn to have many cows to increase her dairy production.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un pequeño productor de café desde hace 20 años. Junto a su esposa manejan las actividades productivas de café en su pequeña finca, ubicada al norte de Nicaragua, la cual está certificada por comercio justo a través de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC). En su comunidad es un líder por ser un hombre trabajador y transparente en sus negocios.

Para este nuevo ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de  insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mejorar el estado nutricional de sus cafetos. Estas actividades forman parte de un plan de manejo integral de su finca, con el cual se ha propuesto alcanzar mejores resultados este año. La meta de Carlos es continuar invirtiendo en su finca, para hacerla más productiva y rentable.
texts.en:
Carlos has been a small coffee producer for 20 years. Together with his wife, they manage the coffee production jobs on their small farm, located in northern Nicaragua, which is certified by Fair Trade through the Peoples Community Action Partnership (PAC). He is a leader in his community for being a hard-working man and clear in his business. 

For this new cycle, he is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies that help him to improve the nutritional state of his coffee plants. These jobs form part of the integrated management of his farm, with which he has proposed to achieve better results this year. Carlos's goal is to continue investing in his farm to make it more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that his coffee plantation needs to have a good production this year.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rosa  is a married woman with seven children and is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Rosa is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ana Rosa has a personal product retail business in the Philippines. Ana Rose requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of personal care products to sell.

Ana Rosa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ana Rosa  would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de cereales (maíz, maicillo y frijol) se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 20 años inicio con capital propio para luego buscar apoyo con créditos en otras instituciones, el cliente realiza sus cultivos en invierno y los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así continuar con sus cultivo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his two children. 

He is earning a living by growing cereals (corn, sorghum, and beans). He has been doing this for 20 years. He started with his own capital and later searched for support through loans from other banks. He starts planting his crops in the winter and sells it on different markets around where he lives.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, and improve the land shown in the photo. This way he keeps on farming and improves his financial income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbizides, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn 01 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thoa is 48 years old and she is married She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years and lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thoa faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.
This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.


 .

loans.use: to build a toilet for the health and welfare of the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of tomatoes and onions for sale in the market so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Pamella is 43 years old, married to Peter and she supports 9 children. 

She has been a livestock keeper such as goats for the last 16 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feeds for her animal inorder to increase milk production produced and sold to clients daily.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds for her animals in order to increase milk production and sold to clients daily.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Contribute now for Lilibeth. Recently, she was granted a loan amounting PHP 26,000 which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanks, she would like to avail another loan worth PHP 10,000. This time, she will utilize this to add heaps of grocery items for her sari-sari store business. 

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help sustain the family needs basically their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

She simply prays for more strength and more blessings for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add heaps of grocery items for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Teme Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALMATOU est responsable du groupe TEME. Marié, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 05mois. 02 vont à l'école et elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend de la farine depuis 10ans. Elle s'approvisionne à LEO.
Elle veut s'acheter 06sacs de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfice, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une maison afin de mieux conserver la farine.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salmatou is the leader of the group Teme. She is married and is a mother to four children. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 5 months old. Two of them go to school and she is responsible for 6 people.

Mrs. Salmatou has been selling flour for 10 years. She resupplies in Leo. She wants to buy 6 sacks of corn.

With her profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. She strives to build a house in order to better conserve the flour.

loans.use: to acquire 6 sacks of corn.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es:
Simeón es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace más de 30 años, rubro que maneja de acuerdo a los criterios de comercio justo.

Para mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas en este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes a fin de asegurar una buena cosecha, y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este productor es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, para ello trabaja cada día con mucho entusiasmo, seguro de que irá creciendo y en un futuro a través de su finca poder percibir mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Simeón is a small producer in the northern area of Nicaragua, who has made a living in coffee production for more than 30 years and manages things according to the criteria of fair trade. To improve the nutrition of his plants this cycle, he is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for the purpose of ensuring a good harvest and in turn get better earnings for his family. This producer's dream is to improve the living conditions for him and his family. For this reason, he works every day with a lot of enthusiasm, sure that it will grow and in the future he will earn more income through his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers that his coffee plantation needs to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a married woman, 35 years old. She received education up to grade 3. She lives with her husband Haradhan, and three children in their own small house in a small village of Falakata, West Bengal, India. Her children are studying at a local village school. 

Sabita's husband is a farmer; he is a hard worker and a very enterprising man. He works on their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow varieties of crops according to the seasonal demand, which he sells in the local market to earn money for their livelihood. Sabita also helps her husband after doing her household work. Now they decided to grow paddy on their land, as it is a very beneficial crop and also is in great demand. Being a staple food of West Bengal, paddy cultivation will be very profitable for them.

Thus Sabita is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, manure and other necessary farm supplies etc., so that they can grow a good quality of paddy on their land. Sabita's dream is to expand their business to give good financial support to her family and a better life to their children.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for growing paddy.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un restaurante desde hace 5 años ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada, trabaja de lunes a domingo y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente y una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face is blurred because she is 25 years old and lives in an area of high-risk, has been owning a restaurant for five years. It is located in the municipal market in a very busy area. 

She works from Monday to Sunday and has many customers. She lives in her own house with her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients, such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and so on, to alter her menu and have a little more financial income and a better quality of live with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and so on.

loans.name: Tanushree

texts.en:
Tanushree is a 45-year-old rural woman from Birpara village in Alipurduar. She lives there with her husband and their only son. As she ended her education in Higher Secondary grade, her first priority is to provide a good education to her son. He is now at graduation level doing a Bachelor in Commerce.

Being a dedicated homemaker, Tanushree is engaged with sewing works while her husband is a local bus conductor. Together the couple works tirelessly to earn their livelihood. Tanushree purchases various high quality cut piece clothes from the wholesale market to sew various garments like salwar suits, nightgowns, petticoats, frocks etc and sells her products to the shops in her village and locality. 

As her products are in demand in the market, Tanushree wants to make more designed and fashionable products to make them more attractive. For this she needs varieties of good quality sewing materials but lack of funds is her main problem. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more varieties of cut piece clothes, colorful threads, needles, buttons, ribbons and many other modern sewing materials.

Tanushree hopes this will enable her to make more new designed products so that she can supply them on time as per the customers’ orders. She hopes that her family's financial condition will also improve and she could save some amount to fulfill her desire of making a concrete house for her family’s well being.

She gladly thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials to enhance her business.

loans.name: Cecilia María

texts.es: Cecilia de 52 años, inició su negocio motivada por una amiga que se dedicaba a la venta de productos por catálogos, al observar el éxito que su amiga logró, decidió incorporarse. Se encaminó a la vida como comerciante y  hoy en día cuenta con una clientela fidelizada a quienes como estrategia de venta les ofrece facilidad de pago para que incorporen estos productos a su estilo de vida.  Ella es muy comprometida con su negocio por ello labora de lunes a domingo  y no tiene horario, su cadena de comercialización consiste en agendar citas a sus clientes para ofrecerles charlas sobre los beneficios del uso de los productos de uso personal como jabones, talcos, desodorantes, cremas corporales, perfumes y demás.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de productos para tener un stock de productos; fragancias, talcos, desodorantes, cremas corporales y demás. Su meta a futuro es brindarles a sus cuatro hijos educación profesional y en su negocio incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 52 years old and began her business motivated by a friend who was making a living selling products from a catalog. When she saw the success that her friend was having, she decided to get involved. She started life as a merchant and today she has a loyal clientele who she offers easy payments to as a sales strategy so that they can incorporate these products into their lifestyles. She is very committed to her business, so she works from Monday to Sunday and does not have a set schedule. Her marketing chain includes scheduling appointments for her clients to offer to talk to them about the benefits of using the personal care products such as soaps, powders, deodorants, body lotions, perfumes and more. 

At the moment, she is applying for her first Credikiva though the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in buying products to have a stock of fragrances, powders, deodorants, body lotions and more. Her future goal is to give her four children a professional education and increase sales in her business.

loans.use: to invest in buying products to have a stock of fragrances, powders, deodorants, body lotions and more.

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Tereza is a mother of 4 boys and 3 girls who are in school. She is 46 six years old and a widow. Her husband left Tereza with 7 children, but because she was having a food selling business, it was not much trouble to support her kids. She cooks food like rice, ugali with meat and vegetable, sometime sells tea with bites in the morning. She works very hard to raise at least enough money to have food and school fees for her children.  She is the only parent remaining with her children. She starts working from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair profit. 

Tereza approached Tujijenge Tanzania as Kiva's partner, to request financial support so as to improve her restaurant. She managed to receive credit support and this is her 10th credit.  She will use it to buy food cooking ingredients(sugar,maize and baking flour,cooking oils,salts,charcoal). She used the previous loans to buy stock of rice,maize & baking flour, cooking oils, sugar. She is doing great and managed to repay successfully the previous loans. 

Tereza dreams to open a wholesale shop. Furaha group member will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food making ingredients, sugar, maize and baking flour, cooking oils, salts, charcoal etc for her restaurant

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr: Brehima, est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vit et travaille dans le village de Dalakana au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 43 ans, Brehima est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 23 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance alimentaire pour sa famille a incité Brehima à devenir agriculteur. Il a mentionné que, "J'ai abandonné l'école pour aider mes parents." Il cultive le maïs, le haricot et le maraîchage sur sa parcelle de 4 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et de main d'œuvre. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour compenser le trou du manque de main d'œuvre. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'économiser car les dépenses qui devraient être  injectées aux mains d'œuvre seraient évitées. Brehima espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille et acheter un moulin de maïs pour les femmes.
texts.en:
Brehima, a myAgro registered farmer, lives and works in the city of Dalakana, southwest of Bamako, Mali. 43 years old, Brehima is the father of 7 children from ages 1 to 23 years old, five of which are currently in school. Agriculture allows him to ensure his family's self-sufficiency, which prompted him to become a farmer. He noted, "I dropped out of school to help my parents." 

He grows corn, beans, and other greens on his 4 hectare plot of land, but, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties such as lack of agricultural materials and laborers. 

This year, he wanted to buy a seeder to compensate this lack of farm-hands. Access to a seeder will allow him to economize, since he'll be able to avoid the expenses of hired workers. 

Brehima hopes that with the increase in his yields and his revenue, he will be able to build a house for his family and to buy a corn mill for the women.

loans.use: to own a precision seeder.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres en el sector Los Laureles del distrito de Cayaltí, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia deChiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Jose Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 05 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, y compra de algunos accesorios para la misma,con esto José Luis espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Luis, 30, lives in his parents' house in the Los Laureles area of the Cayaltí district, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  Life in the community is peaceful and the residents work mainly in commerce and raising small livestock.

José Luis offers passenger transportation services in his vehicle, a motorcycle taxi.  He has had this job for more than five years.  He has experience in the field and very good personal and professional references in his area.

He will use the loan to make some repairs and provide maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in bad shape.  He will also buy some accessories for his taxi.  José Luis hopes with this to provide better customer service, which will earn more income for him and, as a result, improve his quality of life and his family's.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance for his vehicle and to buy accessories

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is from a small village of Falakata in the Alipurduar district. Her family consists of her, her husband and her three sons. She is a 34-year-old housewife who is an illiterate woman who can only sign her name. Her three sons are studying in different grades at a local school. 

Shanti and her husband Ranjit are involved in farming. This is the only source of income for them. They grow seasonal vegetables and sell the produce in the local market. Thus they can somehow manage their household expenses.

As life gets more expensive day by day, Shanti and her husband want to grow their income. They want to cultivate teasel gourds, which is a popular vegetable for the people of their region and the summer season is the appropriate season to grow this vegetable. A loan will help them to purchase seeds and fertilizer for teasel gourd cultivation. Thus Shanti has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in their business. 

Shanti hopes this loan will give a boost to their business as well as to their income. 

Shanti is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 33 years old lady, married and a mother of 4 children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training on enterprise development and financial management.

She is a crop farmer growing kale, vegetables, potatoes and maize. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to increase vegetables production. This will help her sell more and earn more income to enable her pay tuition fees for her children.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy certified seeds and fertilizers to increase vegetables production to increase income hence pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.name: Dinora Yaneth

texts.es: Dinora de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  desde hace 12 años su negocio está ubicado ceca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor y así seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Dinora is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her child.

She has been earning a living by selling fruit and vegetables for 12 years. Her business is located near her home in a very busy area and she has many customers. With the sales of her fruit she is able to cover some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale and to keep on selling because it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Bulelwa

texts.en:
Bulelwa is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Instituteand was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:1 What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am currently studying Bachelor of Art in Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are Organisation and Management and Principles of Economics.

2.What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel? 
I am hoping to work in one of the biggest companies, which can help me learn more about business as I am also planning to open and own my beauty salon in future. I would like to work here in Johannesburg and yes I would like to travel.

3.Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children? 
I was born and grew up in the Eastern Cape. I have 3 siblings and I am the only female child in the family. My mother is a domestic worker. I am not married and yes I do have a child.
