4.What do you like to do in your spare time? 
I always try to find something to help generate some money for my school transport hence I help my uncle to run his tuck-shop during weekends.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes? 
With the Kiva loan I would be able to use a taxi when going to school because I am currently using a train which gives me problems at times and I find myself arriving late for my morning classes. I believe that indeed the Kiva loan will bring a significant change to my life as I also struggle with paying my school fees.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 65 years old, widowed and has 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development. 

She practices vegetables farming such as potatoes and spinach. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds so as increase vegetables production for increased sales.  She intends to use the profits to buy indigenous chicken for farming business expansion.

Lucy is happy with Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase vegetables production for increased sales and income hence expand her farming business through buying poultry.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is aged mid 40's, single with three daughters who are at school. For six years now, she has been supporting her family by running a business of fish(dagaa). She buys and fries them and after that, she transports them for sale upcountry. She goes early to the market(6am) where she collects stock from fishermen and carries them to the place where they are fried. Her business ends at 6pm where she takes her stock home ready for transport. Asha is able to make a small profit per month. 

This is her fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous credits, which were paid back successfully, to increase her business stock of dagaa. She managed to receive some extra income which she used to cover school and household expenses. Asha dreams to expand her business capital and sell big stock. 

With her new credit request, she will invest to buy stock of dagaa, fry them and transport for selling. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of dagaa (fish), fry them and transport upcountry for selling.

loans.name: Guljan

texts.ru: Гулжан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,50 Га собственной земли она выращивает клевер и клубнику для реализации. Работает библиотекарем в школе. Ежемесячный доход Гулжан составляет 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжан вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота, а именно 2 коров и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Guljan successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. Today she has two cows and ten sheep. She grows clover and strawberries for sale on 1.5 hectares of her own land. She works as a librarian in a school. Guljan's monthly income is 22,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Guljan has once again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy additional heads of livestock, specifically two cows and ten sheep. Guljan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows and ten sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 46 year old and the married mother of four children.  Elza works hard to support her family and improve their economy. Her husband also supports them with work as a driver. The main source of income for the family is the raising of seasonal vegetables (onions, greens etc.) She has been raising vegetables for 9 years and has good skills in this area.

Greens and onions are very popular in Azerbaijan national cuisine. They used in cooking of kebab, levengi, qutab, doghramajh and other dishes. That’s why these vegetables are in high demand. She raises and then sells them at the local bazaar.

Her income for this small business doesn’t cover life demands, nor is her harvest profitable enough and she plans to raise more vegetables and fruits additionally.  .She applied for 1500AZN in order to buy new good fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new good fertilizers to expand her vegetables and fruits business

loans.name: Saptami

texts.en:
Saptami is a rural housewife aged 40. She lives with her husband and a daughter in a small village named Itkhola in Alipurduar.  Her daughter is a student in grade 10. She completed her education up to Higher Secondary level.

Saptami's husband is engaged with a ready-made garments business and she runs a small grocery shop with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, lentils, eggs, etc. after managing her household work. With their small income, it is very difficult to provide the family with its daily basic needs as well as pay their daughter’s education cost.

So to expand her business and get more income, Saptami has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for their grocery store. She hopes this investment will help her to increase her income; she will be able to provide sufficient financial sustenance to her family and give a better education to her daughter. 

She wants to enlarge her grocery shop in the future with the profit generated from her business. She will be grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Lamine,est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Gonsolo au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 35 ans, Lamine est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 3 à 12 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance alimentaire pour sa famille a incité Lamine à devenir agriculteur. Il a mentionné que, "on gagne ce qu'on a fait." Il cultive l'arachide, le maïs  et le coton sur sa parcelle de 15 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour être satisfait dans son travail. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide en semis et en usage d'engrais. Lamine espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et diminuer son champ de coton pour le maïs.
texts.en:
Lamine, a myAgro registered farmer, lives and works in the city of Gonsolo, southwest of Bamako, Mali. 35 years old, Lamine is the father of 7 children, ages 3 to 12 years old, three of whom are currently in school. Agriculture allows him to ensure the self-sufficiency of his family, which encouraged him to become a farmer. He said that, "we earn what we make."

He grows peanuts, corn, and cotton on his 15 hectare plot of land, but must cope with difficulties as a farmer, such as lack of rain and farming materials. This year, he wanted to buy a seeder to be satisfied with his work. Access to a seeder will allow him to be quick seeding and fertilizing. 

Lamine hopes that with the increase in his yields and his revenue, he will be able to ensure the self-sufficiency of his family and diminish his cotton field for corn.

loans.use: To buy a precision seeder.

loans.name: Mampi

texts.en:
Mampi is a loving and hardworking young lady aged 23. She has a secondary grade education. She lives in a small village in Alipurduar. She is a mother of a toddler son.

Mampi is an active and dedicated wife to Gopal who works in a small company. She has her grocery store where different kinds of grocery items are sold. She has chosen this business as there are very few other grocery stores in her locality and also so she can make an additional contribution to her family.

Now she aims to develop her grocery shop due to the increasing demands of her customers. To achieve the same she needs capital. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy varieties of grocery items like biscuits, bread, butter, spices, flour, oil and other daily essential commodities in a bulk to meet the demands of her daily customers and at the same time, improve her financial stability for providing a decent life to her family.

She wants to save money for her family from the profit generated from her grocery business so that she can use it in future emergencies.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items in bulk for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 31 years old and married. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development. 

She is involved in farming vegetables such as kale, spinach and cabbages which she sells in her nearby local market. She also does buying and selling of second hand clothes. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and certified seedlings to enable her to increase her vegetable production. With the increased stock, she will earn more income to enable her pay to renovate her family's house.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and certified seedlings to increase vegetable production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm to grow more farm produce to sell and make more income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.name: Zodel

texts.en:
Zodel is 35 years, married to Phylis old and he supports 3 children. 

He has been in a motorcycle transport services business for the last 4 year and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens, so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and purchase more motorcycles to do transport services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 45 years old, married woman and the mother of 4 children. Her husband has been doing business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Jamila  fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Donari

texts.en:
Donari is 35 years old. She lives in Batumi with her husband. The family owns mandarin and walnut trees and sells the harvested products locally. Donari decided to start a more stable business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for starting trading business. With the received credit she will purchase cheese to resell at a higher price. This will give her a chance to earn stable income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trade in cheese.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and married with two children. Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, bread, shampoo, noodles, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Balla,est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Farani au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 76 ans, Balla est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 5 à 46 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Balla à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs, le mil et le coton sur sa parcelle de 15 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour être rapide en semis et usage d'engrais et ça économise aussi l'effort physique des enfants. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'avoir le courage de faire plus avec abnégation. Balla espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et continuer définitivement avec myAgro si ses attentes ont été satisfaites.
texts.en: Balla, a myAgro registered farmer, lives and works in the town of Farani, southeast of Bamako, Mali. 76 years old, Balla is the father of eight children, ages 5 to 46 years old, 2 of which are currently in school. The deep family tradition of agricultural practice, the main source of revenue and food for the home, encouraged Balla to become a farmer, He grows corn, millet, and cotton on his 15 hectare plot of land, but, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties such as lack of rain and agricultural materials. This year, he wanted to buy a seeder to be quick with seeding and fertilizing. That also saves his children the physical labor. Access to a seeder will allow him to have the courage to do more with selflessness. Balla hopes that with the increase in his yields and his revenue, he will be able to ensure the self-sufficiency of his family and to definitively continue with myAgro if his expectations are met.

loans.use: to own a precision seeder.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice. Imelda is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is 51 years old and she lives with her family in Kapan city which is in Syunik region. Arevik has a married daughter and a 12 years old son. For a long time, Arevik used to work as a nurse in different hospitals in Kapan city and now she works in a medical point at the copper production plant in Kadjaran city. 

At the same time Arevik and her husband engage in land cultivation and fruit production. They have apples and oriental persimmons in their large orchard which they sell in fruit markets. Also Arevik grows potatoes and beans and the profit from their agricultural business helps them to solve their family needs.  

Now Arevik wants to build a new fence around her orchard and would like to change the water pipes. She asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a new materials for the fence and new water pipes.

loans.use: to buy a new material for a fence and new water pipes for her orchard

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret; thirty nine years old, married and blessed with three children. Margret joined Hand in hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.
Margaret does maize, beans and banana farming. HiH EA enterprise training has enabled her manage her enterprise well. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields, thus maximize profit. Income from this enterprise will help take care of her family basic needs i.e. children's education and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will improve on crop yield, thus more profits to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in remote district where a good location to do business in agriculture. She is widow and has two children. She has ten year experience doing business in agriculture. She plants agricultural products and sells in domestic market. She is planning to cultivate and process her land in order to gain well harvest to coming season. 

She requested a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and hopes to be supported. The income from her harvest will help her to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals to improve her agriculture business

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in a beautiful nature scene town with hospitable residents. She is divorced and has two children. She is an honest and hardworking person. She is a challenged and experienced woman who got divorced from her husband in 1985 because of misunderstandings in the family. She was able to raise her children alone. 

In order to feed and ensure her children she was used to doing business. She started to buy sunflower seeds, cakes, candies, etc. and to sell them. Additionally, in her free time, she sews traditional blankets and carpets to orders of customers. She has raised her children doing this business. 

Recently, she has needed money to continue her business. She asked the help of IMON and Kiva to get a loan to widen her assortment of selling goods. She awaits your kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to widen her assortment of selling goods.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 55 years old, married to Alloys and she supports 3 children.
 
She has been a farmer for the last 24 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm in order to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest, to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Dianira

texts.es:
Dianira tiene 52 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su conyugue y su menor hijo, en una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Dianira espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dianira, who is 52 years old and in a common-law relationship, lives with her partner and youngest son in a rural zone of the district of Callayuc, located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents earn a living mainly in agriculture, livestock farming, and commerce.

She has a business in her own domicile raising and selling small animals, including chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys. She has fifteen years of experience in this work, and very good personal and work references.

Dianira is applying for a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and more, as well as the balanced feed for the same. She is looking to offer a better product to her clients, thereby generating higher income, which will allow her to improve the quality of life for herself and family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of  animals to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Rosevelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosevelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Rosevelinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Rosevelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and animal feeds that will increase farm yield, thus bring in more income to provide for the family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Maria, seventy one years old, married and blessed with ten children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013.

Maria farms maize and beans, she also rears sheep. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and more profitably than before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and animal feeds. This will increase her farm production and meet the demand for cereal, hence go a long way in supporting her family basic needs and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and animal feeds. This will increase farm production and income, thus meet family basic needs.

loans.name: Jayamani

texts.en:
Jayamani is a 41-year-old rural woman blessed with two sons and a daughter. She lives with her husband and children in Jogendrapur village of Falakata in Alipurduar district. Two of her children are students. Jayamani was deprived of education in her childhood due to poverty, but she can sign her name.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. He has been growing seasonal fruits and vegetables for years. He works hard on his farmland to grow good quality vegetables so that he can satisfy his customers.The local people have high demand for his fresh fruits and vegetables. Jayamani is a homemaker but helps her husband in cultivation whenever she gets time. Their income is hardly sufficient to meet the expenses of their family. 

Now they plan to grow cucumber, as cucumber is the right vegetable to beat scorching summer heat. Moreover, this low-calorie vegetable indeed has more nutrients to offer than just water and electrolytes and is easy for cultivation. 

So Jayamani applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers to grow fresh cucumbers. She hopes cucumber cultivation will be profitable for them and they can generate more income through this. She dreams of constructing a better house for them with the profit.

She is thankful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Tomé Group

texts.fr: Colette, âgée de 63 ans est une femmes battantes très dévouée qui fait le commerce de pagne, draps et des prêt à porter depuis 20 ans maintenant. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Colette a besoin de crédit pour renforcer son activité et surtout pour proposer de nouveaux produits à ses clients. Pour faire avancer son activité, Colette se déplace dans les services pour vendre. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activités et aussi de faire ses propres dépenses.
texts.en:
Colette is 63 years old and is a very devoted women's activist, who has been selling traditional cloth, bedsheets, and outfits for 20 years now. She is married and a mother of four children. Colette needs a loan to bolster her business activity and, above all, to offer new products to her clients. In order to make her business progress, Colette sells her products on the go. 

After her sales, she will have a profit that will allow her to continue her business and to make her own purchases as well.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth (pagne), bedsheets, and outfits for resale.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 61 years old, married and has three sons and daughters who are grown. She has managed a business selling clothes for 16 years now, working from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. per working day. She is able to make a small profit each month. 

This is her tenth credit from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, paid back fully, to replace stock in her business. Veronika received some extra income that she used to cover her means of living with her family. She dreams of opening a big shop selling clothes. 

She will use this credit to buy new fashionable clothes to resell. Veronika will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes to resell.

loans.name: Euneice Rica Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Euneice Rica Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Euneice Rica Ann is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Euneice Rica Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past  three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ester, one of Ruma’s agents. Ester lives in West Bandung, a village located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta. She is happily married. Together with her husband, they have one cute child. 

Ester sells mobile airtime credits to her community. She already joined Ruma almost a year ago. She learned about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband to increase their income, as well as give more contribution to her community. 

As the business grows, Ester is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Knowing the importance of communication, your loan will be very useful to help Ester improve her business and accordingly, help her community who needs access to such services. 

Ester is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her village community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Dukundane Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is a group leader, aged 45. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 21 years; they all go to school. 

The group is called Dukundane which means “Love each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to change their future to a better one. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and she wishes to buy a car in order to help with her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Bisaka

texts.en:
Bisaka is a 27-year-old rural woman of Jitpur village in Alipurduar. She lives there with her husband and a son who is a toddler. She has completed her education up to grade 10. 

Together the couple makes various products from cane to earn their livelihood. They purchase cane and bamboo splits from the wholesale market and make different items like baskets, cane chairs, stools, etc. and sell their products to the local shops, markets and village fairs. There is a great demand for their products in the region. 

As the needs of her family are gradually rising, Bisaka wants to enhance her business by making more varieties of cane products to fulfill the demands. To achieve this, she needs capital. So Bisaka applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy various kinds of cane, good quality bamboo splits and modern tools from the wholesale market.

She hopes she will be able to make more fashionable products to attract customers. It will enable her to earn more and ensure the financial stability of her family for leading a decent life.

Her future dream is to build a concrete house for her family’s well being. 

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase good quality canes, bamboo splits and necessary tools for their existing business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret wants to thank Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which allowed her to purchase more stock of flour and cooking oil for her food cafe business. She was able to meet the growing demand for her service, thus doubling her income. Margaret used the increased profit to buy additional stock. 

She is requesting a new loan to add more stock of foods such as flour, sugar and vegetables in her cafe in order to meet the rising demand for services. She hopes that she will earn more income that will enable her to meet her family’s basic needs and pay school fees for her children with ease.

Margaret promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of flour, sugar and vegetables for her cafe in order to meet the rising demand for services.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is a farmer and she has been growing crops to sell for the past five years. 

She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for use in her farm in hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Sansan

texts.en:
Good day lenders! This is Sansan, one of Ruma’s agents. Sansan lives in Sukabumi, a village in West Java located about five hours drive from Jakarta. She is happily married and she owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She already Ruma almost a year ago and she learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business into technology. 
 
As the business grows, Sansan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Given the importance of communication, your loan will be very useful to help Sansan improve her business and accordingly, help her community who needs access to such services. 

Sansan is the one you can see in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is a hospitable woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1958. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She is a business woman. She does business of selling textiles for traditional dresses and children's wear. She has permanent customers and serves each client politely and gently. Her family’s standard of living is good because she and her husband are working hard in order to live better. 

She has a wish to enlarge her business for the upcoming season and help her husband to ensure their family's welfare. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy a new assortment of textiles and children’s wear. She is hoping to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of textiles and children's wear.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta, 46, is a married woman with five children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ernesta has a buy and sell personal care products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Ernesta requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like ointment, etc.

In the future, Ernesta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like ointment, etc.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Wegesa is a mother of five boys and one girl, who are at school. She is aged 47 years old and is married. For 17 years now, she has been a fruit vendor, selling bananas, oranges, avocados etc. depending on what season fruits are available. She resells them in small quantities because of the small capital that she has. Wegesa starts working from 07.am to 10.pm per working day and is able to make a very small profit each month. 

This is her eleventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and it will be shared among Tupendane, a two-member group. The group members will be held accountable for paying back the loan. 

She used the previous credits, which she paid back successfully, to buy a stock of fruits. Her business capital was small but after joining Tujijenge that has changed. Her life has improved and it is now better than before and she wants to change it even more. Wegesa's dream is to open a retail shop.

With her credit request, she will buy seasonal fruits to sell to different customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell to different customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm so as to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Husni

texts.en:
Husni is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1955 and is living with her family in a big mountainous town. She is married and has a child. She is an honest, business, responsible and gentle person. Almost nine years ago she started a business selling office supplies. She has rented a place at the center of a city. 

She is now planning to open an electronic library where people would have an opportunity to use books electronically. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to buy equipment for opening an electronic library. She hopes to be supported and give an opportunity and access to books for people.

loans.use: to buy equipment to open an electronic library

loans.name: Mncedisi

texts.en:
Mncedisi is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:

1.What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am doing a Bachelor Degree in Business Administration (BBA) and the class that I enjoy the most is Financial management class.

2.What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My first goal is to become a financial manager and to have my own accounting firm. I will like to work in any financial institute anywhere around the world as long as I prosper.

3.Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born in Mpumalanga province in South Africa in Mpuluzi rural area. My mother has two children,a boy and a girl, I am the first born. I was raised by a single parent, I don’t know the whereabouts of my father. I am unwed. My parents are unemployed but my guardian who is my mother's sister is self employed. I do not have any children. In 2011 I moved to Johannesburg to fulfill my desire and now I live in Soweto because I cannot afford to rent in Johannesburg.

4.What do you like to do in your spare time?
The thing that I normally do in my spare time is to read newspapers because my intention is to be familiar with everything that occur around the world.

5.How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva will bring a significant change in my studies because it will cover my monthly tuition fee at Mahrishi Institute and because Kiva loan offers a basic living expense per month,then I will be able to attend my classes everyday because I have to buy a monthly ticket to travel to school and I will be able to buy formal clothes because our dress code is formal.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 35 years old, and is from Rustavi city. He has wife who is a housekeeper and a little child. Zurab was living abroad and has just arrived back in his country. He wants to set up his own business, as he was unable to find any stable job. 

He is eager to start a trading business with his own mini-bus. Zurab requested financial support to make his plan reality. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to poor people, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low or no income. 

With the received credit, Zurab plans to purchase fruits and vegetables and trade the products; he also wants to have money for working capital.

This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions and Zurab will be involved in his own business and do his bit for the family's welfare.

loans.use: To start trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 53 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hermenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Hermenia has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Marie. She is married and has three children aged 34, 29 and 27.

In 2012, Marie established her provision and grocery business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed and keep up her family livelihood. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are both men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business.

Marie would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, cooking oil, onions, rice and provisions for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase the level of her additional income.

In the future, Marie plans to raise more capital to build her own shop and stores for business expansion. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, cooking oil, onions, rice and provisions for resale

loans.name: Francina

texts.en:
Francina is a mother of one girl and two boys. Having worked hard all her life and successfully raised her children who are all in their 30s, the divorced 58-year-old would be forgiven for choosing to sit back and enjoy her retirement. However, she is defying the odds and venturing into entrepreneurship. She has noted the difficulties she and her children experience looking for Internet services in her neighborhood and has consequently decided to open an Internet cafe in her backyard.

She is requesting a loan to buy two laptops, a Samsung mono laser printer, and desks as well as to put up shelves. A Kiva loan will help her kick-start her Internet cafe and provide a much-needed service for her community.

Francina is an avid reader and hopes to turn her backyard into a mini library offering computer lessons, Internet services and hardcopy books for people of all ages to indulge in.

loans.use: to buy two laptops, a mono laser printer, and two desks and to install a shelf unit.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
Mavis is a member who sells fast food . She is married with children. In the group picture, Mavis is on the second right. This group members are into selling fast food, charcoal, Kenkey (cooked corn paste) and bakery items. 

Mavis plans to use the loan to buy rice and ingredients to prepare spiced (jollof) rice and sell to customers. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used to pay her children's school fees and also reinvest the rest. Mavis and her group members need a loan totaling GHS 4,500 of which she is entitled to GHS 2,200. 

Mavis and the rest of the group members thank you for your support and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To prepare spiced (jollof) rice and sell to customers.

loans.name: Norma Marlen

texts.es: Norma de 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en la comunidad de San Juan Pueblo, La Masica, Atlántida junto a sus dos hijos. Hace 8 años que Norma decidió por tener su propio negocio de crianza, engorde y venta de cerdos. Esta actividad le ayuda a generar mas ingresos para su familia. Los cerdos los vende en la misma comunidad para destazo. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar mas cerdos para engorde y vender. Su sueño es ampliar el negocio y aumentar las ganancias para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma, 36 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband and her two children in the community of San Juan Pueblo, La Masica, Atlántida. Eight years ago, Norma decided to have her own business raising, fattening, and selling pigs. This work helps her generate more income for her family. She sells the pigs for slaughter.

She has requested the loan for 20,000 Lempiras to purchase more pigs to fatten and sell. Her dream is to expand her business and increase her earnings to support her children.

loans.use: purchase pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Lameck

texts.en:
Lameck is 28 years, single man and he supports 3 family members. 

He has been in a motorcycle transport services business for the last 1 year and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and start a motorcycle spare part shop. 

His hope is to be financially stable and purchase more motorcycles to do transport services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rochelle works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Rochelle is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Rochelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Romeo De Jesús

texts.es:
Romeo de 68 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica  a los oficios domésticos.

Romeo se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas y siembra de maíz, el primer trabajo lo aprendió cuando era ayudante de un taller, y luego decidió independizarse, el taller lo tiene en su casa y no tiene un horario de trabajo específico pues cierra hasta que termina el último encargo.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar abonos, veneno, insecticidas, fertilizantes, etc. para sus cultivos.

Romeo sueña con ampliar su taller y comprar un terreno para ya no alquilar cuando cultive.
texts.en:
Romeo is 68 years old, and never had te opportunity to study.  He is in a domestic partnership and his partner does housework.  

Romeo dedicates him to making metal structures and to planting corn.  He learned this first skill when he was an assistant in a workshop, and later her decided to become independent.  He has a workshop in his house and doesn't have a specific work schedule, as he closes when he is done with his last order.  

The loan will be invested to buy compost, poison, insecticide, fertilizer, etc. for his crops.  Romeo dreams of expanding his workshop and buy a piece of land so that he doesn't have to rent to plant.

loans.use: to buy compost, poison, insecticide, fertilizer, etc. for his crops.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Letecia is 54 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Letecia has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Letecia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 49 years old lady, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2015 in order to benefit from enterprise development training. 
She practices vegetable farming where she grows vegetables such as kale and spinach for both consumption and commercial purposes. She also operates a food cafe to supplement her income. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to increase vegetables production. This will enable her earn more income thus buy modern furniture and utensils for her food cafe. This will enable her attract more customers and increase her sales.
She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase vegetables production for increased income and buy modern furniture and utensils for her cafe to attract more customers.

loans.name: Tujikaze Arutani Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Gladys, a member of Tujikaze Arutani women group. She forty one years old, married and a mother of one child. She joined hand in hand eastern Africa in April 2013 and received trainings on enterprise development and financial planning which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise of maize and beans farming.

Gladys is borrowing from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She trusts this will boost her farming thus increase her income. 
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost farming thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su padre, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su camión desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, también se dedica a la agricultura, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Roberto is thirty-five years old and lives in his own home with his father. He has driven a truck for the past ten years, he has many loyal customers who appreciate his responsible driving. He also works in agriculture, and he is able to pay his household expenses with what he earns. He is seeking a loan to purchase tires and to pay for the cost of maintenance for his vehicle, since it is his sole means of support and it will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 68-year-old Marie. She is married and has five children aged 46, 43, 40, 35 and 30 years. In 2000, Marie established her grocery shop (selling rice, cooking oil, pure drinking water and provisions) business. She began her business because she was trained in business and to assist her husband to educate the children. 

Her business is located on the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are from the general community. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Marie requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of sardines, milk, biscuits and soft drinks for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to cater to more customers, and as a result, the business will expand. 

In the future, Marie plans to build her own shop and empower the children to take good care of her in her old age. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of sardines, milk, biscuits and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Minda is 58 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Minda has a buying and selling of sugar business in the Philippines. Minda requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of sugar to sell.

Minda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar to sell

loans.name: Pipe Line Group

texts.en:
Isatu is a member of Pipe Line solidarity group (in the group picture, Isatu stands in the middle).  She sells textiles.  Isatu has been selling textiles for the past 30 years.  She uses the proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business. 

Isatu and other group members of Pile Line solidarity group are requesting their first loan. Isatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Isatu will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to purchase different types of textiles for her business. 

Isatu is forty-eight years old, married, and has five children aged twenty-six, twenty-three, twenty-five, sixteen and ten years old. Isatu hopes that her business will continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well.

Isatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase different types of textiles for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 43 years old and married with eight children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Wilma has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Wilma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Levani

texts.en:
Levani, who is 25 years old young man, from village Argveta. He lives with father, brother and pensioner grandmother. The family has a small income from agricultural activity. Levani and his family members are engaged in cattle breeding, in harvesting nuts and cultivating family-owned agricultural land.

Levani wants somehow to increase the productivity and expand his trading business. With the help of his brother, Levani plans to purchase a truck and start trading with agricultural products through the district. After several unsuccessful attempts, Levani applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.
 
Levani will purchase a second-hand car and start purchasing fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices, which will be sold with price mark-ups. 
These hard-working brothers will get the chance to earn significant income and they will be able to improve the economic situation and give their family a better style of life.

loans.use: To purchase a truck and trade with agricultural products to provide family income

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is fifty one years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in year 2013 so as to benefit from trainings especially on enterprise development. 

Her economic activity is crop farming where she grows maize and beans. She is taking a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and certified seeds in order to increase her production. This will increase her income thus enable her pay for construction of a  house for her family and access to quality health care services. 
Regina is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase crop production hence pay for construction expenses of her family's modern house and access to quality health care services.

loans.name: Kavithe

texts.en:
Kavithe is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from trainings and especially enterprise development. 
She is involved in stone/ballast selling business. She is applying for Kiva loan to buy more ballast for resale hence increase her income levels to buy family's food and meet the rising demand of ballast by her customers.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more ballast for resale hence increase her income levels to buy family's food and meet the rising demand of ballast by her customers.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is thirty seven years old and married with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) so as to benefit from training especially on enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices crop farming and also operates a general retail shop. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs like irrigation equipment and storage sacks. She hopes this will enable her increase her farm produce hence earn more income to pay for her family's modern housing and access to quality health care. 

Winfred is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy irrigation equipment and storage sacks to increase farm produce to earn more income to pay for her family's modern housing and access to quality health care.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Dufatanye is a group led by Peruth who is 56 years old. The group name means “Collaboration” in English. She is married with three children aged between 2 and 22 years. She sells clothes and has been doing in a business for the past 10 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bales of clothes for selling. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is forty two years old, married with three children, and all of his children are attending school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

He operates a general retail shop where he sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea, soap, cooking fat and other household items. He is borrowing from a Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs e.g sugar, salt and flour hence add stock for increased income. This will enable him pay school fees for his three children.
 
Johnstone is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like sugar, salt and flour to add stock to his shop for increased income to pay school fees for his three children.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 61 years old and married with six children. One of her children is currently studying in college. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to benefit from trainings and especially enterprise development. 

She operates a general retail shop in partnership with her husband. She is applying Kiva loan to buy foodstuffs e.g. sugar, flour and cooking fat so as to add stock for increased income to help her pay tuition fees for her child. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs e.g. sugar, flour and cooking fat to add stock to her general shop for increased income to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Basgul

texts.en:
Basgul is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1953 and she is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a pensioner. 

She is an old woman that has some problems with her backbones. In order to be healthy and work for a living she needs to be treated at hospital. She asked a loan from Kiva to be treated in a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to have treatment for her back in a medical clinic

loans.name: Camino Al Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Camino al Cielo" esta coordinado por Tania, 25 años,  casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 5 años, la mayor de ella acude 3er grado de primaria, y su hijo menor esta en preescolar, se dedica a la producción y venta de buñuelos y atol de manera ambulante en el sector. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el negocio, y su esposo le ayuda en la producción, con el crédito invertirá en la compra de azúcar, huevos, yuca y maíz pujagua. Con el crédito anterior pudo expandir su negocio y ahora hace donas y pan. Ahora tiene pensando seguir incrementando su producción y así seguir brindandoles a sus hijos mejoras económicas.
Las demás integrantes son Rosa, de 22 años, dedicada a la venta de pan. Kenia quien compra y vende cosechas de aguacates y Dina, 54 años, quien también comercializa cosechas de frutas.
texts.en:
The group  "Camino al Cielo" is coordinated by Tania, who is 25 years old, married, and has two children, who are 8 and 5 years old.  The oldest is coming out of 3rd grade and the little one is in preschool.  

She makes a living selling donuts and atol (a corn drink) as a mobile vendor.  She has 4 years of experience in this business, and her husband helps her with the production.  She will invest in sugar, eggs, yucca, and purple corn with this loan.   With the previous loan she was able to expand her business and now she makes donuts and bread.  Now she is thinking of increasing production to continue giving her children a better economic situation.  

The other members are Rosa, who is 22 and makes bread.  Kenia buys and sells avocados and Dina, 54 years old, also sells harvested fruit.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, yucca, and purple corn.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be dynamic and reliable. He operates a photography business. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of photography items. 

His business goal is to have a large studio within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of photography items

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a single woman. She describes herself to be dynamic and reliable. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to have a large boutique within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes
